hashtags:
Sobre aceitação:
.
"A aceitação de uma situação não desejada libera a iniciativa, aliviando-a das cargas impossíveis e transferindo o foco da ação para o possível
.
A aceitação libera o aceitante das cadeias da autopiedade e lhe requer coragem para seguir apesar de...
.
Já foi dito que uma mente imatura procura um mundo ideal mas, querendo ou não, precisamos encará-lo como ele é, muitas vezes cruel e inconsciente
.
Em última análise, talvez seja esse o início da sabedoria, apenas a simples admissão de que as coisas nem sempre são como queríamos. E tudo bem. Porque, no fundo, nós somos imperfeitos e não tão bondosos como gostaríamos de ser."
(Autor desconhecido)
.
Eu amei isso, gente! Bjus, boa noite, bons sonhos!
.
Grazi💗

hashtags:
The reality for a lot of women isn’t easy. Male privilege isn’t saying that men don’t have issues and struggles but they don’t have any based on their gender. Male mental health and the lack of awareness and their ability to talk about it is less because they’re locked into this form of ‘toxic masculinity’ that stated they had to ‘be strong, tough and show no weakness’. Toxic masculinity is a byproduct of patriarchy. It did not just affect women, but men also. It still exists in today’s society. Feminism fights for that equality. Feminism didn’t cause the male mental stats, patriarchy did that. We need to know the enemy and work together. You don’t have to be a women to be a feminist
.

#feminism #feminist #rapeculture #sexism #patriarchy #kavanaugh #brockturner #toxicmasculinity #change #equality #metoo #timesup #heforshe

hashtags:
A night ago, I walked into a cafe in Karimabad and the moment I entered my eyes were transfixed on the lady sitting behind laptop at the far back. She looked up, and yes that was Alyne! For months I was looking forward to see her, but never knew a spontaneous trip to hunza would end up in meeting my favorite woman and the fiery founder of Girls Gone Global. She got up all ecstatic looking at my bewildered yet excited face as I called out her name in disbelief and gave me a huge hug. She was still working at midnight and asked me to sit down and share my views on women rights in Pakistan. 
We had a discussion on the general stigma surrounding the gender, the lost opportunities and ways to mitigate societal vices such as child marriage. I saw the agony in her eyes as she kept listening and typing. There is not one, but countless reasons why I follow her as a mentor and look up to her and one of them is empathy and selflessness which she has for all living beings wether animals or humans. Its her first time visiting Pakistan and she was already invested in doing all she could to become a voice of the unheard young girls and women in this country. I met a humanist that night and a beautiful soul with a heart of gold. 
This was yet again 'Maktoob'. I wish to see the change her efforts will bring in my lifetime. Can't wait to see her again in Islamabad for an all girls meet up. I'll ask you all to put your differences aside and join her so we can all be part of something so revered that will determine the future of our country in coming years. 
@dearalyne 💕

Life will not always give you answers. That doesn't mean you should be passive and live in a boring and meaningless way without letting anything give you all the happiness & love you need.
You can get the opportunity to find your purpose, create it. Maybe it is growing up & making your own family, getting into university, doing the job of your dreams, being famous or rich, helping people, being the reason why someone's life changed or something else. You are going to figure this out. Who knows? Maybe the purpose of life is trying to find it. And it's not pointless as it may seem, it's worth it. Because in the process you learn so much about yourself & others, you are filled with emotions that make you stronger, you develop relationships, you live to know how much you can reach.
Set further goals even if they are too much and difficult for you. Work to do the impossible. It's something that will lead you to great places. Don't give up, explore yourself & your potential. Don't let bad moments or people who didn't appreciate you change or define your world. Don't fear having ambitions and changing them. 
Go get the life you can have & live it to the fullest!
@emmawatson #emmawatson

hashtags:
What exactly is female empowerment? 💪⁣
⁣
Turns out there isn’t a single definition- most languages don’t even have a word for empowerment! We believe empowerment enables women to make their own choices, and have the opportunity to turn those choices into actions. Essentially, to have the ability to turn “I can’t” into “I can”. At MWF, we want to lift up our community of women to feel like they can do ANYTHING they set their minds to! Here’s the short-list of sessions to help raise you up: ⁣
⁣
👉Ambitious Living - Dream Big⁣
👉Freedom from Limiting Beliefs⁣
👉Girl Rising movie screening⁣
👉Conscious Self-Talk: Change your Voice, Change your Life⁣
👉Standing in Your Power⁣
👉Ignite Your Radiance: Kundalini Yoga + Meditation⁣
👉Drop the Goddess Mask⁣
👉Unframe yourself towards Radical Freedom⁣
👉Unstoppable: Learn the Tricks to Ooze Confidence, Courage and Charisma⁣
👉Fierce Feminine Leadership - Lessons in Emotional Intelligence⁣
👉Awaken Your Goddess ⁣
👉I Am Woman, Hear Me Roar⁣
👉FindYourRoar Finding Liberation & Empowerment through the Voice⁣
👉[I AM] EMPOWERED⁣
⁣
We’re lucky enough to have our new empowered-woman role model, Tricia Grant @triciagranteq , joining us to lead a session on Fierce Feminine Leadership - Lessons in Emotional Intelligence. 
Tricia is a bada** business woman who has climbed the corporate ladder and now trains people in corporate to buy and sell businesses! She will teach us how to be strong female leaders using clever tricks to boost our emotional intelligence and be our best in business. Personally, we can’t think of anything more empowering than feeling ready and able to kick-butt in the business world! ⁣
⁣
⁣
Have you got your tickets yet? Don’t forget that the tickets at the door will be 20% more expensive than the discounted pre-sale!

hashtags:
👩🏻‍💻¿Sabes qué es lo que más me emociona del pack intensivo #Feminismo y #Política Internacional?⁣
⁣
Que no tiene fronteras ni límites para ayudarte a CRECER.⁣
⁣
💜Me emociona combinar todo el conocimiento de los talleres presenciales y online que he impartido en un programa que sí puedas sacarle provecho seas del país que seas y seas de la profesión que seas:  profesional, activista, periodista, abogad@, profesor@, estudiante, feministas...⁣
⁣
Para mí es importante ofrecerte una base sólida de conocimiento para que puedas construir sobre él, desde tus trincheras o tus líneas de trabajo, desde tu oficina en los más altos niveles o en tus iniciativas personales...⁣
⁣
Quería crear algo que no fuera tedioso o complicado porque para eso ya está la universidad.⁣
⁣
Quería crear algo que no fuese superficial o desconectado de tu realidad porque para eso ya están los informes de instituciones y los medios masivos de comunicación.⁣
⁣
Creé el pack pensando en que los temas fueran trabajados como punta de lanza:⁣
⁣
👉Para que no recibieras información difícil de digerir y ya.⁣
⁣
👉Para que no hicieras una inversión monetaria solo para recibir pasivamente contenido y ya.⁣
⁣
👉Para que no sintieras que el mundo es un lugar cruel y jodido y no se puede hacer nada y ya.⁣
⁣
👉Porque sí puedes hacer MUCHO para cambiarlo cuando conoces sus dinámicas a MULTI-NIVEL.⁣
⁣
✍️Para mí es importante que no sientas que acumulaste otro certificado más en tu CV.⁣
⁣
👩🏻‍💻Por eso he creado esta convocatoria con cupo limitado para que tengas la oportunidad de compartir con otras personas: preguntas, ideas, contactos, líneas de trabajo, proyectos en común, un mismo tiempo y espacio.⁣
⁣
El pack es una experiencia que va en escala: desde lo más básico de la teoría (y deconstrucción) hasta lo más complejo de su implementación.⁣
⁣
Por tal razón, en 4 semanas aprenderás, compartirás y crecerás a nivel personal y profesional.⁣
⁣
💜Si buscas ampliar tu visión y herramientas para analizar el mundo o conoces de alguien que sí, te espero y l@s espero en el pack.🙌💫⁣
⁣
🤨Si tienes dudas, preguntas, aún estás a tiempo para escribirme. Hablemos. 🙌💜
⁣
Las inscripciones cierran el 21 de octubre.

hashtags:
Vocês sabiam que recentemente os Escoteiros do Brasil fecharam uma parceria com a iniciativa HeForShe, da ONU Mulheres? Alinhados aos Objetivos do Desenvolvimento Sustentável, entendemos igualdade de gênero como um um dos principais objetivos que compõem a a construção de um mundo melhor. Mas o que você entende por igualdade de gênero?
Igualdade de gênero significa que homens e mulheres devem ter os mesmos direitos e deveres. E com isso analisamos como o Movimento Escoteiro evoluiu desde que foi criado, no começo do século passado: as  meninas só puderam ser Pioneiras no Brasil a partir de 1979. Escoteiras a partir de 1980, Guias a partir de 1981 e as primeiras Alcateias mistas só foram oficializadas em 1982. Já  em 2016, haviam mais de 24.000 mulheres entre nossos jovens e mais de 10.000 entre nossos chefes. O Movimento Escoteiro assim como todo o nosso planeta compreende como a igualdade de gênero (ODS número 5) é extremamente importante para a nossa evolução em sociedade. Mudamos muita coisa, mas ainda temos muito pela frente.
#mutcom #heforshe #elesporelas #escoteirosdobrasil #ods #objetivosdodesenvolvimentosustentável

She joined the Histopathology BST before joining surgical scheme. In addition to being a beloved surgical lecturer at RCSI, Dr Cunningham is also a Team Ireland’s head coach for Womens Soft Ball. We cannot wait to hear more from this surgeon on October 19th!

This is Lebanon. My country. And a lot of it is burning. Can we please talk about this? How come no one gives a shit about what's happening in small countries like mine but the minute a building is on fire it's the end of the world? The octobor fires are no joke and have threatened my safety as well as the entire of Lebanon. Please RAISE AWARENESS.  And thank you for all the poeple who sent me dms to confirm my safety. Fortunately I am fine, but I cannot speak for the rest! 🇱🇧 Is on 🔥

Go check out @thirdworldfeminist for more info on how you can help us

Markus Granlund, VD för @semcon, är #heforshe! Ta ställning för jämställdhet du också via https://www.heforshe.org/ och skicka DM till oss om du bor i Göteborgsområdet och vill bli HeForShe som Markus. 🌟

#heforshe #genderequality #iamheforshe #tasnacket

Sanjiv Mehta, Chairman & Managing Director, Hindustan Unilever Limited received the prestigious UN Women #HeforShe Pin at the #BloombergEquality Summit  in Mumbai, India. He was recognized as part of the UN Women’s initiative to honour Indian CEOs who are active advocates of gender equality in the country.

#HeForShe is a global solidarity movement for the advancement of gender equality, initiated by the UN. Its goal is to achieve equality by encouraging both genders to partake as agents of change and take action against negative stereotypes and behaviours.

On Saturday 23 November, Dellasposa will be hosting a brunch with Ehryn Torrell at Home House. •

Ehryn Torrell is a London-based Canadian artist interested in visual culture and the myriad ways it impacts human experience and shapes ideas. Collage is central to her practice because it makes use of existing images and, at the same time, it resists accepting the way things are by presenting new and alternative imagery through deconstructive and constructive methods. •

For more information and to view the artworks on display contact info@dellasposa.com 📧 •

Pictured above: Ehryn Torrell, Secondary Collage [02], 2017. Inkjet Print,  Edition of 3, 52 x 39.5 cm (framed).
Below: Ehryn Torrell, Secondary Collage [01], 2017. Inkjet Print edition of 3, 52 x 39.5 cm (framed). •

“I think this is burnout. I can’t really remember a head space that wasn’t totally fuzzy. 🙅🏻‍♀️ I’ve got so much stuff going on: trying to juggle a full time job, starting my degree, running a blog and the supporting social media pages, launching my new website and merch store, finalising and publishing my book and juggling a lifestyle deemed appropriate and helpful for my PCOS. I’ve got social events coming out of my ears and absolutely no fucking money, free time or motivation. My house is either spotless or frighteningly messy (Kim and Aggie would have a mother-loving field day) and this appears to mirror itself in my appearance; I’m either dressed up to the nines, going out to drink copious amounts of gin and pretend I’ve got my life together or I can barely get out of bed, let alone brush my hair, and go about my daily activities in a zombie-style trance 🧟‍♀️. And for once, I really don’t want to whinge. I want to be positive Polly and pop up on your Instagram feeds reminding you to drink water, love yourself and have a great day. Except, right now, I want to fucking throttle Polly, whoever she is. And if I don’t address this, I won’t be able to deal with it and will likely feel fuzzed for the foreseeable future. 🌫 It feels pretty GD rubbish to admit you think your life is falling apart a little bit, and you don’t know how to stop the seemingly downwards spiral, but there 👏🏼 is 👏🏼 no 👏🏼 shame in it, and often reaching out is the first step to feeling much, much better. Plus, I like to be as honest as poss with you mega-babes to remind you that ‘real’ life is more than brunches with your besties, bikini selfies and book clubs. It’s gotta include the bad days, weeks and months, otherwise no-one will have any relatability and we’ll all keep hiding away our thoughts and feelings, inevitably causing more damage than intended. 
Ironically, I couldn’t post this on #WorldMentalHealthDay. Partially because I was so wrapped up in some other trivial issue that social media content was the last of my bloody worries, and partially because I couldn’t fucking identify it and therefore didn’t have the words.” 💭 (Continued on blog) #WomanOnTop

𝓡𝓮𝓯𝓵𝓮𝓬𝓽𝓲𝓷𝓰 𝓑𝓮𝓪𝓾𝓽𝔂 𝓒𝓱𝓪𝓵𝓵𝓮𝓷𝓰𝓮…
💫

In a society that profits from your self-doubt, liking yourself is a rebellious act.
💫
Dear body,
I apologize for not loving you always. I apologize for not being appreciative of you always. I am sorry for comparing you to others so often.
Today, I want to say I love you and am grateful.
A body that is healthy beyond number of pounds or inches.
A body that is remarkable for being pregnant 4 times and giving me 2 wonderful babies.
A body that is strong for lifting weights and running half a marathon.
A body that is proficient in helping patients and having hands that continue to heal so many.
💫
As I’m getting older, I am learning that I am good enough. No one is perfect and I am going to love all of my imperfections.
💫
Thank you Nadia @themindfulmdmom for starting this thoughtful discussion and inviting me to share my thoughts.
.
.
.
.

Ok now I have to wax lyrical about the men on whose shoulders I stand (and have stood for the past 20 years in building JAN). Junior Achievement Nigeria has been blessed with a devoted few good men who always (ALWAYS) rise to the call. This first photo is powerful because @beloosagie handing #NiyiYusuf his award is pure joy — the founding Chairman thanking our most recent Chairman for sustaining the work he started conjures up plenty of emotions. Between them is 20 years of hard work which have not always been rosy. Between them, they have housed JAN in their respective offices (UBA House and Accenture offices) motivated their staff to volunteer for JAN in and out of the classroom and kept me motivated when sometimes the problems of Nigeria have overwhelmed me. Between them is a group of incubators and past chairmen who all received awards that night, from #EmekaEmuwa who served as Chairman when he was at Citi to now being one of our longest running Partners in Development at @unionbankng , to #DotunSulaiman and #SeyiBickersteth who supported JAN from Day One as they pledged members of the Arthur Andersen family to build our website, create our processes from HR to paying taxes, and volunteer in JAN classrooms (sometimes even carrying projectors from their offices)! 👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾 @rufailadipo served as Chair of our 20th anniversary committee and orchestrated every single detail of all three events that day. He also handles all PR for JAN. #SeyeArowolo  and @dave.uduanu not only help manage JAN’s finances on our Finance & Investments Committee but have also become my personal mentors and cheerleaders (especially on those days when the women are tough on you and you need a man to say “never mind them, you’re doing a fantastic job!” 🤣) Thank you gentlemen for being the solid rock on which we have built @janigeria 🙏🏾🙏🏾👏🏾👏🏾👏🏾🙌🏾🙌🏾 :

hashtags:
While I grew up I learned certain things. Like, you don’t hit woman. My grandparents were quite modern on that topic. I grew up with stories like: ‘Your grandpa was only allowed to marry your grandma because he promised to send her to school and learn for a job.’ My grandpa was definitely a feminist! 
I felt quite strong! And I was certain that something like rape or domestic violence would never happen to me. 
It sometimes feels quite ironical that it happened to me. I always thought I would be a big fighter who stands up for her rights. And in the end it turned out that I was that afraid woman who was a shadow of herself. But looking back, I see the traps now. And I stepped in every single one of them. And sometimes I still ask myself WHY COULD YOU HAVE BEEN SO STUPID? 
The answer is that I always want to do it right. I want to help people. I was in love. It was a slow process. It was like the frog in the pan of water. If you put the frog in boiling water, he will jump. If you put him in cold water and slowly heat up the water till the boiling point (DON’T try this at home!!!), he will stay and dies. 
So I made excuses! 
I told my family that speaking another language made him feel insecure. Oh, they loved him. All he had to do on family visits was to smile (and eat everything my grandma cooked). I never told them that he never wanted to come, I never told them that he hated them. 
I never told him of when he destroyed my things. He sometimes did throw things and afterwards he told me that it felt great. He once told me that, after smashing my ceramic bowl (I gave him grapes in it, washed etc., ready to eat), that it felt so great. His reasoning: he hated that bowl. I loved that bowl. But I kept quiet 
I thought that what he did to me was not bad enough! 
I wanted help but was afraid that nobody would believe me! I mean, I helped him to maintain the image of a perfect boyfriend. 
He threated to kill himself if I would ever leave him. 
He drove like crazy when he was angry. I was not allowed to drive at those moments. I was so afraid he would cause an accident by crashing into a tree or driving of a bridge.

He hurt me!
likes:
|He hurt me! And I was brave enough to confront him with that. He made excuses. I caused it. I was the reason that he got that angry. If I wouldn’t make him angry, everything would be alright. . . . . . . . . and there was so much more……. And I still thought it was NOT a form of domestic violence. Other woman were hit daily. They had to go to the hospital, I didn’t! My case wasn’t that bad. So I kept going!
Until I realized that I had no friend left. I was isolated from my family (hadn’t seen them for 3 years). I was afraid! I didn’t follow my own advice. 
But I knew, somewhere deep down, that it was sooooooo wrong. And my ex always told me that my greatest weakness was my stubbornness, maybe it is one of my greatest strengths.
.
.
.
.

hashtags:
"There are too many people today who instead of feeling hurt are acting out their hurt; instead of acknowledging pain, they're inflicting pain on others. Rather than risking feeling disappointed, they're choosing to live disappointed.
·
Emotional stoicism is not bad-assery. Perfection is about the furthest thing in the world from bad-assery.
·
To me the real badass is the person who says, "Our family is really hurting. We could use your support." And the man who tells his son, "It's okay to be sad. We all get sad. We just need to talk about it."
·
People who wade into discomfort and vulnerability and tell the truth about their stories are the real badasses." -@brenebrown , "Rising Strong" book
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Hay demasiadas personas hoy en día que, en lugar de sentir su dolor, están escondiendo su dolor; en lugar de reconocer el dolor, infligen dolor a los demás. En lugar de arriesgarse a sentirse decepcionados, eligen vivir desilusionados.
·
El estoicismo emocional no es ser rudo. La perfección es lo más alejado del mundo de la rudeza.
·
Para mí, la verdadera rudeza es aquel que dice: "Nuestra familia realmente está sufriendo. Podríamos usar tu apoyo". Y el hombre que le dice a su hijo: "Está bien estar triste. Todos nos ponemos tristes. Solo tenemos que hablar de ello".
·
Aquellos que se sumergen en la incomodidad y la vulnerabilidad y dicen la verdad sobre sus historias son los verdaderos rudos ".
- @brenebrown , libro "Rising Strong"

Para mudar uma situação que não te faz bem, o primeiro passo é admitir que você é parte dela, sem se colocar como vítima mas como parte integrante
.
Importante se perdoar e não se culpar, porque a culpa bloqueia nossa mente e dificulta na condução da mudança. Admita que você é responsável, e não culpado, pelo que está acontecendo
.
A maioria de nós tem alguma compulsão ou vício, que vai do consumismo desenfreado de comida, passando por roupas, sapatos, até drogas, sexo, compulsão por relacionamentos tóxicos, entre outros
.
Você não está sozinha, procure falar sobre isso, frequente grupos de ajuda, terapia ou, se nesse momento ainda está difícil tomar essas atitudes, apenas admita e, quem sabe, comece a escrever um diário
.
Apenas não desista de você! Vá com calma, mas vá! Estamos juntas!
.
Grazi💗

THANK YOU for all of your support on Day of the Girl. .
We wanted to share this little story that reminds us about the power we have to influence girls’ futures .
This first image is from a few years back - a shy girl with a love of books told us about her dreams to become a doctor, to continue her studies, to live into the life her mom made for her and pursue her passion for helping other people. NOW, she's all grown up! She is doing amazingly in school! She tutors other students and is a mentor to them. She has a strong group of friends who all are dedicated to learning. She dreams of being a therapist so she can help people.

Why settle? You are MORE. You are EXTRA. Most of us are pretty damn accomplished. We live and breathe competence, even excellence. But how many of us actually reside at our own genius levels? I’ve found that internal barriers that I didn’t even know existed were holding me back. “I’m not a morning person.”
“I’m not a good with money.”
“I’m not a good businessperson.” When you speak limited statements about yourself, you have to think back to where and when this started. And you need to change your language. Say it out loud. 
What are your limiting statements?

hashtags:
⚠️⚠️TRIGGER WARNING⚠️⚠️ "Does human trafficking happen in Canada? I get asked these questions all the time, and my answer is always the same…yes, it happens! I know this because I was once a victim of this heinous crime. I was born in the Caribbean but adopted at the age of three to a Canadian family. Growing up, I had a loving but a chaotic childhood. Both my parents suffered from mental illnesses, which increasingly impacted their ability to raise my sisters and me. My school life offered no relief because I was bullied mercilessly for being different. Being the only black kid in my school, I experienced lots of racist taunts, social rejections and bullying on a regular basis.  At 16, I left home and started staying with friends, but eventually dropped out of school and ended up in downtown Toronto, where it didn't take long before I became homeless. Bouncing between youth shelters and transitional homes, I met a young woman who became my best friend. I admired her fashion, beauty and glamorous lifestyle. What I didn't know at the time was that she, herself, was a victim of human trafficking and was forced to recruit other vulnerable young women. She introduced me to a man who presented himself as my protector and said everything I wanted to hear, promising to take me out of poverty and despair. Through this manipulation and coercion, I was lured into the sex industry, working in strip clubs across Ontario.  In the next few months after that, I lived in a state of constant fear and isolation, and under the powerful psychological control of my trafficker. It was only after witnessing a vicious assault on a woman at the hands of her trafficker that I realized that I had to escape this life. I reached out to my street friends from my days of being homeless for help. One would think that this is where the struggle ended. However, even after escaping that life, I struggled with the psychological and emotional trauma of my abuse for much longer. With no resources available at the time, I was forced to live with the shame and guilt of sexual exploitation."
[CONTINUED IN THE CONMENTS]
likes: |[CONTINUED HERE] "At 18, I became pregnant with my daughter, which pushed me to try to rebuild my life. First, I completed my GED and then I went on to earn an Honours & Bachelor of Science degree in Health Services Administration and a Master of Science in Health Informatics. Since then, I have built a successful career in the healthcare industry, working as both an analyst and a researcher. In 2018, I launched the RISE initiative, a grassroots project to support vulnerable youth, many of whom are also survivors of human trafficking. Since the launch of RISE, I have had the opportunity to share my story and advocate for different causes that directly impact vulnerable populations like human trafficking, homelessness and mental health. Most recently I was part of a review on human trafficking in Canada for the United Nations Inter Press Service and participated in a closed-door round table to increase economic empowerment and entrepreneurship in collaboration with Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau. While it is difficult, I hope that by sharing my story, I can help dismantle the stigma and shame that survivors of sexual violence experience even in 2019." ~ @realrhonelle|What a powerful story. Thank you for being so brave and honest. ❤️|#heforshe #bullyingawareness #sexualassault #metoo❤️ #homelessnessawareness #mentalillnessawareness #webelieveher #superheroesofthe6ix #superheroes #sexualabuse #girlup #humantraffickingawareness #humantrafficking #abusiverelationship #emotionalabuse #survivor2019 #humantrafficking #survivors #homeless #endhomelessness #supportsurvivors #empowersurvivors #empowermentquotes|What an amazing story. ‘Take the girls on an adventure Trek’
This has been a goal of mine for the last 2 years. It has been postponed over and over because of school and lack of funds.. However, I’m determined to get this off the ground. 
Hiking has always been a healing experience for me. Mountains 🏔 and being in nature calms the soul and refreshes the mind and body. 
These friends of mine, these girls I’ve worked with, they have difficult stories. I believe an adventure to the Himalayas can contribute to their growth, healing, and self discovery. 
I ask any contribution to this project. Link is in my Bio
And go follow and support @raksha.nepal “To prepare for the mountains develop mind, body, will, and spirit as strong, soft as a pillow, and fluid as water”
- Jeff Rasley

hashtags:
A woman empowered is one with power and control over her own life inside and outside the home.⁣
⁣
In the eyes of Western culture, a woman unable to hold her own outside of the home due to societal constraints is a foreign concept. Lack of skills and, consequently, lack of employment causes women to be completely dependent on their fathers and husbands with no power to control their own circumstances.⁣
⁣
Our passion for girls education is based on the fact that education is equal to power. Empowerment leads to the ability to affect change. ⁣
⁣
We aren't invested in changing one life. We're invested in changing thousands of lives through one.

If you would like your story heard and are willing to share, please send me a message and your story may be in the next article! ✍🏽.

hashtags:
Our Male Champion #MCM of the week is Abiy Ahmed, the Prime Minister of Ethiopia and the recipient of the 2019 Nobel Peace Prize. He was awarded the prize for his efforts to “achieve peace and international cooperation” after he forged a peace deal with Eritea which ended a 20 year military stalemate following their 1998 - 2000 border war.⁣
⁣
At 43, @pmabiyahmed is the youngest head of government in Africa and he achieved this after only 8 years in politics. Since he became prime minister, he has introduced progressive and liberalising reforms to Ethiopia. He freed thousands of opposition activists from jail and allowed exiled dissidents to return home. ⁣
⁣
Mr Abiy is a man that understands the value of women empowerment and inclusion. Outstandingly, under him, several women have been appointed to prominent political positions. He gave half of the government’s 20 ministerial posts to women, in contrast to the 4 posts which women held in the much larger cabinet of his predecessor, Hailemariam Dessalegn. While explaining the appointments, he said women were "less corrupt than men” and would help achieve peace. He also appointed the first female president, Sahle-Work Zewde. He received an African excellence award for gender from the African Union for this move.⁣ #HeForShe ⁣
#AbiyAhmed is an Ethiopian Male Champion worthy of our respect and admiration⁣
likes: |Awesome man. ❤️❤️

hashtags:
DISRUPT YOUR FEED🙅‍♀️ The Express has just published an article on our research study "Disrupting the Feed". Last week we launched our full social media and mental health campaign.
.
In 2018, The Female Lead and Psychologist Dr Terri Apter, Fellow Emerita of Newnham College, Cambridge teamed up to explore whether there was a causal or correlative relationship between teen aspiration, mental health and influence of social media. Much current research into  social media usage has focused on keeping safe online and time-limiting exposure to social channels. This research sought to explore whether teenage girls can be encouraged to use social media to expand, guide or reinforce their interests and aspirations by following more high-achieving women on social media.

Link in bio for the full report ! .
.⠀

hashtags:
#heforshe is a movement launched by @unwomen that invites “men and people of all genders to stand in solidarity with women to create a bold, visible and united force for gender equality”. Last week they also co-hosted the screening of the Indian documentary ‘Son Rise’ by @vibha_bakshi_filmmaker at Siri Fort auditorium in relation to the National Girl Child Day. The movie gave an insight on some of the gender equality issues India faces as well as some of the men who are fighting for gender equality. It was an important event which spread awareness about a massive global issue and encouraged leaders to take part in the fight. It also showed how men can and need to take part in this struggle and use their privilege to lead the way. We recommend everyone to watch the documentary and to go to the ‘heforshe’ website and register themselves in the fight for gender equality. The link is found in the bio. Thanks to the New Zealand High Commissioner, Dean of Diplomatic Corps and UN Women for inviting us!

#sonrise #vibhabakshi #womensrights #genderequality #heforshe #feminism #feminisminindia #indianwomensrights #equality #dcii #danishcultureindia #danishcultureinstitute #cultureforchange #bettertogether
#newzealandhighcommission #deanofdiplomaticcorps #unwomen

hashtags:
🧔🏻HE FOR SHE👱🏼‍♀️ •

Esta fue una campaña creada por la #ONU #Mujeres en el año 2014 con el propósito de lograr la igualdad de género involucrando a hombres y niños, animándoles a tomar medidas para propiciar la equidad en derechos hacia la mujer. •

En #SuperWomenEnAccion creemos en el respeto hacia el otro, en la diversidad, y en que juntos, hombres y mujeres, lograremos expandir la presencia de la mujer en los lugares de mayor exposición y oportunidad de impacto en el mundo, y lograremos el cumplimiento de derechos equitativos, comenzando por los hogares, educando a niños y niñas en ecuanimidad. •

En tu casa, ¿tienen los mismos deberes y derechos los hombres y las mujeres? •

La igualdad comienza desde lo más sencillo... Feliz día!
#Mujer #HeForShe #Hombres #HombreyMujer
likes: |De niña en casa mi madre nos enseñó a todos por igual ( mujer y hombres ) por ser la pequeña yo hacía cosas sencillas pero otras actividades como barrer mopear cocinar lavar y planchar entre mis 3 hermanos mayores las hacían 😍Hoy en día ellos igual comparten el hacer esas cosas con sus esposas 💚 @superwomenenaccion  También a todos se nos enseño estudiar y trabajar 💚 Mis padres lo hicieron bien jeje👏👏👏😍

hashtags:
Uma das coisas que aprendi fazendo anos de terapia (na minha opinião, o melhor investimento que se pode fazer na vida) foi proteger minha sanidade, construída com muito esforço, em meio à dor e medo
.
Aprendi também  que sempre, absolutamente sempre, que me sentir desconfortável em uma situação que eu não possa controlar e que abale o meu equilíbrio emocional, que eu saiba me afastar
.
Como diz a oração: "Deus, conceda-me serenidade para aceitar as coisas que eu não posso modificar, coragem para modificar aquelas que eu posso e sabedoria para reconhecer a diferença"
.
Eu não posso modificar o outro, nem absorver o "barulho" do outro. Desse vício eu já me curei mas estou "sempre alerta" para não repetir relacionamentos tóxicos
.
Eu só posso modificar a mim mesma e, mesmo assim, se eu estiver profundamente disposta a isso. A jornada para autoestima foi, no meu caso, bem difícil mas extremamente libertadora!
.
Eu sou a pessoa mais importante da minha vida
.
Grazi💗

hashtags: Boys don’t cry - Moderner Feminismus ist für mich Humanismus. Frauen haben sich in alle Bereiche des Lebens vorgekämpft und die Grenzen des Mach- und Sagbaren verschoben. Frauen und Mädchen dürfen heute stark sein, Hosen tragen, am Verhandlungstisch sitzen. Aber wie ist das eigentlich bei Jungs oder bei Männern? Der Rahmen des Möglichen, was heute als männlich gilt, ist eng und vielleicht sogar viel enger als bei Frauen, fast stereotyp. Männer sollen stark, mutig, wortkarg, fucking Ritter sein. Fürsorglichkeit, Gefühle ausdrücken, Schminke tragen, gehen oftmals nicht ohne soziale Sanktionen oder kontinuierliche Rückschiebungen in die engen Grenzen, was als männlich gelten darf. Moderner Feminismus ist nicht gegen Männer, sondern gegen Sexist*innen, die immer wieder die Individualität des Einzelnen in Genderschablonen schieben und damit bestimmen, was sein darf und was nicht. „Es geht darum, aus Männern und Frauen Menschen zu machen, die Freiheiten des anderen Menschen zu akzeptieren.“ (Zitat Ivo, Foto) Männer seid empathisch, seid aufmerksam, empfindet. Ihr seid trotzdem 💯Prozent männlich, denn Männlichkeit ist viel, ist divers. Männlichkeit und Weiblichkeit müssen nicht stets binär gedacht werden. Wenn eine Frau verhandeln kann, macht sie das nicht weniger weiblich und wenn ein Mann liebevoll ist, macht ihn das nicht weniger männlich. Und wenn jetzt kommt: Ja schau doch, Männer sind so und Frauen sind so, das “sieht” man doch. Dann kann ich euch die Mario Barth Sunglasses empfehlen. Wenn man durch eine Schablone schaut, dann muss man sich nicht wundern, wenn alles, was man sieht, die Form der Schablone hat. Und wenn etwas nicht in die Schabole passt, dann ist es eben nicht richtig. Von mir gibt’s ein großes und herzliches Bullshit. Boys do cry und das ist auch gut so! Free yourself und let boys set themselves free. #feminism #intersectionalfeminism #genderequality #rabaukerie #fffday #realitäten #gleichberechtigung #menschenrechte #freiheit #thisiswhatafeministlookslike #berlin #heforshe #sheforhe #werbrauchtfeminismus

hashtags:
the fact that feminism is seen as such an abstract concept for people to understand only because it doesn’t focus on men is disturbing. It disrupts ‘natural order’ it challenges your patriarchal traditions. Once you open your eyes to it, you see our society is built upon a lot of oppression, one of them being women’s. It’s easier to say ‘women are crazy’, ‘rape isn’t even that common’, ‘you have equality now’ rather actually sit down and see the truth. Find out the truth. Question everything. Instead they label us as ‘ungrateful’. So many women struggle with workplace sexual harassment, sexism, period poverty, lack of education, having control over their own bodies. These are real issues affecting so many more women than you would accept. We need to wake up and change. Challenge those ‘misogynistic’ jokes, locker room talk, objectification of women. These kind of men don’t listen to women, they already degrade them in front of you. It’s up to our male allies, who also align themselves with the feminist movement. Stop that drunk girl leaving with your ‘friend’, challenge the ‘rape’ jokes as to why they find them funny instead of them saying why you don’t. Do better, do more
.

#feminism #feminist #activism #activist #kavanaugh #rapeculture #sexism #metoo #sexualharassment #lockerroomtalk #heforshe #periodpoverty #abortion #prochoice #women #timesup #patriarchy

hashtags: Esta é uma crítica da DJ e escritora #ProjetoHisteria à campanha #HeforShe, que aqui no Brasil é conhecida como #ElesPorElas (@elesporelasheforshe), de autoria da @onumulheresbr. A crítica é também uma #denúncia, uma vez que a @onumulheresbr não tem se posicionado em favor de mães que, ao enfrentar pais estupradores, se deparam com um Estado que facilita a impunidade do estuprador enquanto promove uma perseguição institucional sistemática contra mães protetivas por causa da Lei da Alienação Parental. Esta lei facilita a produção e divulgação de pornografia infantil na internet, um mercado internacional bilionário. Isso porque a lei permite ao "chefe da família tradicional brasileira" que seja *proprietário* do corpo materno e do corpo infantil, abrindo caminho para a liberdade de um pai estuprar e gravar o estupro de um bebê e ganhar até 50 mil reais por gravação. O chefe de família foi promovido a cafetão com a Lei da Alienação Parental! A Lei da Alienação Parental é a volta do conceito do pátrio poder para a lógica judiciária. Essa lei foi criada para beneficiar pais estupradores de crianças que se utilizam do laço familiar para aliciá-las, principalmente meninas. A revista @papodehomem é uma das parceiras da @onumulheresbr e lançou recentemente um documentário chamado "O silêncio dos homens". Eu gostaria de saber da @onumulheresbr e do @papodehomem quando é que os super preocupados com questões de gênero vão se preocupar em ter aquele "papo de homem" em que esses homens se responsabilizam diretamente pelos problemas criados pela classe masculina ao longo dos últimos milênios. Vocês estão ganhando muito dinheiro e não estão fazendo nada para resolver os problemas que a masculinidade tem causado às meninas e mulheres. Vocês não deveriam estar confortáveis em ganhar dinheiro falando de masculinidade enquanto meninas sao aliciadas para a exploração sexual e nada é feito para parar os pornógrafos. #ElasPorElas #direito #direitoshumanos #amodireito #infânciaprotegida #influencer #gênero #gênerodói

hashtags:
Happy Belated Vijaya Dashami to everyone who celebrates! 
Navratri is a 9 day Hindu Festival marking the fight between Shakti/Kali (female embodiment of power) and a demon named Mahishasura. Around India and even around the world, the goddess is welcomed in people’s homes and is celebrated in temples where different pujas (rituals) and done for her every day. The tenth day, Vijaya Dashami (literally “victorious tenth day”) marks her victory, against the evil that couldn’t be stopped by any man (or male god). Although these 10 days are celebrated with full fervor in praise of the female power, somehow the importance of equality and respect to women is overlooked through the rest of the year. Why is that? When we are able to see power and strength in a female goddess, why are regular women treated any differently? 
This is a serious conversation that needs to be had, mainly because the education starts at home. When we start treating our daughters the same as our sons and show our boys what it means to stand shoulder to shoulder to the women in their lives, the limiting mentality can finally change. As first-gen kids, it’s our job to change the narrow thinking by setting our own standards and questioning the harmful traditions that are practiced blindly. 
How would you approach this conversation? Do you think it’s possible to bridge the gap between what our scriptures tell us about equality and what is actually being practiced? Comment down below!
likes: |#navratri #vijayadashami #devi #shakti #womenempowerment #heforshe #firstgeneration #brownkids #indianamerican #hinduism #filterthechai #inclusivity #change #blog #bloggers

Her current appointments are in the Sports Surgery Clinic in Santry and Blackrock Clinic. We look forward to welcoming her back to another AWS event on October 19th!

5 days ago I rolled my bike into the Atlantic Ocean here in Nantucket. It was an emotional moment stitched with relief and a sense of accomplishment. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
I was certainly proud of having completed all three legs of my Ultimate World Triathlon. But, I think I was more emotional because of all the amazing comments and support I have received over the last 6 months. It has been very humbling to receive messages that people got up and got outside to get some exercise, in part because of some inspiration that they got from watching my triathlon. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
What was really special was to receive messages of friends, family, and followers that had discussions with their young sons and daughters about gender equality... what it is and what it means. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Most recently, I have received numerous messages about how people will miss tuning in daily to see progress and send messages of support. I want to use this opportunity to encourage you to channel any of that support towards doing what you can every day to promote gender equality in society. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
📸: @carolinegleich⁣
#TriForEquality #ClimbForEquality #UltimateWorldTri #HeForShe

hashtags:
Whether you like it or not, this is the harsh reality we’re living in. 
Millions of women from all over the world are facing different types of aggressions which is still evolving every single day. Rape is a severely under-reported crime with surveys showing that up to 91.6% of rapes are going unreported. In fact, less than 10% seek help from law enforcement and I can’t blame them. Did u know that women are being told to take measurements to « prevent » rape instead of men being told not to rape. Did u know that many girls have been bullied and called liars when they try to report their rapists. Even better, a judge sentenced only 30 days in jail a 50 year-old man who raped a 14 year-old  saying the girl was « older than her chronological age ». This is totally bullshit. Our society has been telling all of us how to live and how to behave for decades now and it’ll never stop unless we try to end it. If you don’t call out sexism, if you don’t educate your kids about equality, and that women are not just bodies that men can use whenever they want, if you don’t end this discrimination and thoughts about men being in control and that women are weak, this vicious cycle will never end, and the worse is yet to come. Women and their contributions should be valued as much as this society values men’s. We must know that there is no such law that allows what’s happening in this world. We’re all equal. ——-

hashtags:
Letter to my younger self — I promised @annelouisemarquis I would do this for #internationaldayofthegirl .
.
.
Dear little Mote (the only time you were actually little), I know people always made you feel small, but newsflash you’re larger than life. Use that energy for good and don’t waiver. Ya, you were bullied a lot — but why? What’s the teachable moment here? Could you twist it around, with empathy, and have a chat instead of being so scared? Sometimes people need a shoulder, and it’s up to us as the stronger ones to ask the question, with sincerity, “are you ok”? You are naturally maternal. Don’t lose that. You come from a long line of strong entrepreneurial women - don’t lose that ambition, strength and ability to persevere, you have support. .
.
Play with GI Joes AND get your hair done — you can do both. Wear a dress AND mountain bike — you can do both. Study law without becoming a lawyer — you can do both. Trust your instincts and never waiver with an opportunity to show the world who you are — you have nothing to lose and everything to gain. Take everyone with you on the journey who cherished you and protected you, and forget the rest because they don’t really care about you. .
.
You are your first love, and don’t forget it. While money doesn’t buy happiness, it helps you have a better life — and when you grow up poor, it’s a hard lesson to learn. The respect for money. Learn that respect. A little goes a long way, use the little bits of cash you’ve saved towards something extraordinary that builds your next step. In the words of Rocky, one punch, one step, one round at a time. Surround yourself with those who have the same ambitions — to be extraordinary. Those people help you become extraordinary, they inspire you as much as you inspire them. .
.
Be anything. Do everything. Be kind. 
Be the “you” you’ve always imagined. You’ll change the world. #girlforce #girlempowerment

hashtags:
Did you know Maya Angelou became an acclaimed poet and writer after being in over a dozen occupations? Young Maya served as a fry cook, nightclub dancer, cast member of the opera, coordinator for a Christian leadership conference, a journalist and even a civil rights activist with Martin Luther King Jr. She was an actress, writer, director, and producer of plays, movies, and public television programs. It was the years of insight and maturity gained from doing a spectrum of jobs that led her to write some of the most transformational poetry and prose of her time. 👩🏽‍🎓Every experience is a learning experience. 👩🏽‍🎓

hashtags:
“Sorry, Mom!” - Aiden (age 13) -

Want a quick “beyond the work” look into what I’m doing less than 48 hours before I leave for Africa? ✈️ - ❌Am I packing my suitcase? No. ❌Doing laundry? Guess again. ❌Cleaning house? Not quite. -

I’m letting my middle son do a freakin’ FRONT FLIP over me! 🤣 -

People often ask if it’s hard to leave my family and travel like we do. It’s extremely hard. My heart literally hurts thinking about leaving them again for 10 days. This was not what I had planned for my life... But you know what? I wouldn’t trade it for anything. I feel incredibly LUCKY to do what I get to do. I couldn’t have dreamed this up 11 years ago this month when my world fell apart and I became a single mother to my three precious little boys. -

The deepest, darkest parts of our stories can be used to bring HOPE to others...if we only let it...￼and on the other side of that darkness is a HOPE and a HEALING greater than you can ever imagine. -

I can only go and do what we do BECAUSE of the love and support of my husband and boys. When it all gets to be too much, when I tell them that I want to quit, when I tell them I don’t want to leave them again - they are there lovingly pushing me to keep going. “You have to go, Mom. It’s what you’re supposed to do.” -

Over the last three years we’ve worked with thousands of women and girls around the world. I feel so honored to get to be a small part of helping to empower our sisters across the globe - but I also feel incredibly lucky to come home to the love and support of MY GUYS. ❤️ -

I’ll finish packing tomorrow - but for tonight I have one son to teach how to sew a button on a shirt for his debate tournament tomorrow, one son to take to a sleepover, one son to watch YouTube videos with, and a husband to curl up and soak in these last few hours at home. -

Can’t wait to bring you along on this next journey! -

Here’s to HOPE... ❤️🌍💪🏽
~ Ginger

•
•

•

hashtags:
When a person looks out for others they live life to the fullest. 
Dr. Olawale Sulaiman is living well.
.
.
📸 • @hernetworkonline A What?... A King!👏🏾👑 | Dr. Olawale Sulaiman, 41, is a professor of neurosurgery and spinal surgery and chairman for the neurosurgery department and back and spine center at the Ochsner Neuroscience Institute in New Orleans.

He lives in Louisiana, but splits his time between the US and Nigeria, spending up to 12 days each month providing healthcare in the country of his birth -- sometimes for free.

Born in Lagos Island, Lagos, Sulaiman says his motivation comes from growing up in a relatively poor region. "I am one of 10 children born into a polygamous family. My siblings and I shared one room where we often found ourselves sleeping on a mat on the floor," he told @CNN.

Dr. Sulaiman said he negotiated a 25% pay cut with his American employer in exchange for longer holidays to Nigeria to pursue his passion. @RNZGlobal has treated more than 500 patients and provided preventative medicine to up to 5,000 people in the US and Nigeria.

Dr. Sulaiman believes that happiness doesn't come from what you get, rather, it comes from what you give.

In His Words; "There is always room to give; you don't need to be a millionaire to give."
-
Source: @CNN
#HerNetwork | @hnwoty
-

⠀
Do you remember who encouraged you to pursue this passion? ⠀
⠀
✨Was it a loved one? ⠀
✨Was it a friend?⠀
⠀

Eng below 🇬🇧🇺🇲🇦🇺
Perché quest'uomo ha il rossetto?

Il mese scorso uno dei relatori ad una conferenza internazionale di è reso conto che non c'erano donne nel panel di esperti (configurando un manel --> panel di soli uomini).
Sì è fatto prestare un rossetto dal pubblico, se l'è spiaccicato in faccia e ha iniziato a parlare di politiche industriali come se niente fosse, guadagnandosi l'appellativo di #professorlipstick

Al congresso di @voltveneto io e @sailorprinci abbiamo parlato di parità di genere nella rappresentanza in politica.

Why is this man wearing lipstick?

Last month one of the speakers at an international conference realized that there were no women on the panel of experts (setting up a manel -> panel of men only). He borrowed a lipstick from the public, squashed it in his face and started talking about industrial policies as if nothing had happened, earning the title of #professorlipstick

At the @voltveneto congress I and @sailorprinci talked about gender equality in representation in politics.

-Kızın mı var derdin var... diye etiketler hemen büyükler! Öyle ya “Kız başına yapamazsın!”... “Kız başına gezemezsin!”
“Kız gibi gülme!” “Kız gibi zırlama!”
Ve daha nice ötekileştirici, küçük düşürücü ve hatta aşağılayıcı benzetmeler var bizim de hayatımızda değil mi?
Lütfen söylediklerimizin, işittiklerimizin farkında olalım ve bu haksızlığa dur diyelim!
Bugünün kız çocukları, yarının liderleri, anaları, öğretmenleri, doktorları....
Bugünün kız çocukları, yarının geleceği...
Dünya Kız Çocukları Günü Kutlu Olsun...
Tüm çocuklarımızın değerini bilerek davranmamız dileğiyle....
.

.
.

hashtags: Today is International  #DayOfTheGirl  And like everyday I want to celebrate my extraordinary daughter and #girlhero Jasmine, who has been a shining light of inspiration, grace and power since the day she was born. Like her mother she has a kind and compassionate heart. She’s also a fighter and I have marveled at the courage she has to push herself to succeed no matter the obstacles. And that is NOT because I have ‘empowered’ her, it’s simply because I have not stood in her way. I am and will always be here to guide, nurture and love my children, but like my son Jack, Jasmine was born with passion, power and promise. It’s up to us to listen to our children and give them the opportunity to succeed - boys and girls! That’s why I support @girlupcampaign - Tell me about your girl hero 🙏🏽 #heforshe

200 мільйонів жінок та дівчат із 30 країн світу зазнали обрізання - часткового або повного видалення зовнішніх геніталій.
130 мільйонів дівчат не ходять до школи.
12 мільйонів дівчат щороку насильно видають заміж до 18 років.
71% торгівлі людьми - жінки.
Тільки в Україні від домашнього насилля щороку потерпає майже 2 мільйони жінок.

Мільйони дівчат у світі не мають можливості отримувати освіту та належну медичну допомогу. 
Мільйони дівчат щоденно потерпають від насилля та дискримінації. 
Щоб привернути увагу до страшних реалій та підвищення обізнаності про нерівність, з якою стикаються дівчатка у всьому світі - 11 жовтня ООН проголосила - Міжнародним денем дівчат!

#internationaldayofthegirlchild 
Save and Respect the Girl Child Because She is the Future of the Family, Country and the World.

The theme of the International Day of the Girl Child 2019 is "GirlForce: Unscripted and Unstoppable". Women have led global movements on issues ranging from sexual and reproductive health rights to equal pay. Today, most of the girls are attending school and completing their studies. Now, they are focusing on a career. They are not being forced to marry at a young age. Several movements are organized for adolescent girls and tackling issues related to child marriage, education inequality, gender-based violence, climate change, self-esteem, and girls' rights. Girls are proving that they are Unscripted and Unstoppable.

We celebrate the #girlchild today and forever. A girl child is like a bud, let her bloom and be the flower of the future.

No Girl! No Woman! Thus no life.  #thefutureofafricanwomenisnow

hashtags:
I stand for girls’ right to literacy in all matters of health and intimacy. Access to sexuality education empowers girls, gives them the life skills needed to foster healthier and safer relationships, based on equality and respect. .
We can also prevent gender inequality and violence through access to relationship and sexuality education. I’m working every day to make sure this message gets across. .
I think it’s important for the EU to continue championing reproductive freedom and safety across the globe, not only through its policies but also through investments. I want to see money going where it’s needed, where it can make a difference in girls’ lives. .
What is my vision of an ideal future?
✅ A world where ALL girls have the chance to lead a life free from coercion, threats and violence.
✅ A world where men and women are equally protected and have the same chances to thrive.
✅ A world where all people have access to literacy in all matters of health and intimacy. .
What about you? .
~ Camille #GirlsSpeakOut #GirlsTakeOver #EUGirlsWeek .
.
.
#GirlsVoices #YouthTakeover #GirlsTakeover #GirlsCan #ThisGirlCan #GenderEquality #GirlsRights #GirlsEmpowerment #GirlPower #GirlForce #HeforShe #DayoftheGirl #InternationalDayoftheGirl #HeforShe

hashtags:
One of the biggest challenges facing girls is them not being empowered.
.
Too often, too many girls are facing too many challenges which stop them fulfilling their potential. Whether it is not being able to gain an education, that they are not economically empowered, they do not know their rights or that they face violence or discrimination. .
Statistics show worldwide, for every 10 men in a job, only 6 women are in employment. Approximately 15 million adolescent girls worldwide have experienced forced sex at some point in their life. These statistics should make all of us take action.
.
If we want to empower girls, we have to tackle all of these challenges, not only some of them. .
But we can change things for the better if we work together. What kind of world do I imagine for girls in 2030? I imagine a 2030 where girls are lifted up and empowered. What kind of world do you imagine? .
~ Habiba #GirlsSpeakOut #GirlsTakeOver #EUGirlsWeek .
.
.

hashtags:
It’s not only girls who need to speak out about girls’ rights and gender equality! As a male and a feminist youth advocate, I want to remind people that we need to involve everyone in the world to achieve gender equality.
.
It’s not always easy, but this is important to involve everyone. Achieving gender equality is not just a matter of adding more women but recognising the diversity of all people.
.
We need young roles models, and we need decision makers to open up spaces to speak up to people of different backgrounds as well.
.
Any type of discrimination in one area affects progress in another one. That’s why we need to keep on advocating and asking for the gender equal representation, visibility and diversification that we deserve. Because none of us are equal until we are all equal.
.
~ Siebe
.
Ps: can you spot me speaking out at the @europeanparliament 👆🏼
.
.
.

Today is the UN's International Day of the Girl. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Did you know that globally two million underage girls are trapped in brothels?⁠⠀
⁠⠀
NGO Free a Girl is working on changing this by using radical, grassroots tactics to literally 'free' girls in India, Bangladesh, Brazil and many other regions.⁠⠀
⁠⠀
For us here in so-called 'safer' parts of the world, the problem is that many of us don't emotionally engage with this issue, or see it as 'our' problem. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Well, what if it was our OWN daughter, sister or grandchild?⁠⠀
⁠⠀
In this new campaign, Face Swap technology helps render this insight to chilling effect. Nicely done @ddbunlimited 👌

If somebody asked me why it is important that girls are included in decision making processes, my answer would be simple: it is only when girls are heard, that their challenges are really understood.
.
I believe that having girls sit at the table to discuss issues that affect them will result in finding solutions that really work to tackle the challenges they are facing! .
But the reality is that girls are not included enough. If we look at most of our political decision making, there’s only a small percentage of girls being represented in such spaces, and that’s why I don’t really believe that girls are truly represented. .
We need role more models. The global participation rate of women in national-level parliaments is only around 25%. We cannot be what we can not see. That’s why we need more women in positions of power, making decisions. Only then will we achieve gender equality.
.
I always say, a decision made without a woman, concerning a woman, is a decision made against the woman! Do you agree? Tell me in the comments 🤗
.
~ Mercy #GirlsTakeOver
.
.
.

Education is the key not only to knowledge, but also to girls’ rights!
I’m lucky, I have an education. But this not the case for many girls in the world. #DidYouKnow that 130 million girls out there in the world are out of school? And 15 million will never go to school?
.
Girls around the world are denied right to education because of many different challenges.
1️⃣ social and cultural norms
2️⃣ lack of funding for quality education
3️⃣ no political will to implement commitments .
How can the EU help address these challenges? By
1️⃣ implementing an ambitious Gender Action Plan
2️⃣ Stepping up financial support to quality education systems
3️⃣ Underlining the importance of girls’ education in its political dialogue with partner countries.
.
~ Peace #GirlsTakeOver #GirlsSpeakOut #EUGirlsWeek
.
.
.

Dünya Kız Çocukları Günü Kutlu Olsun! Fenerbahçe Futbol Okullarında Bir İlk: Kız Çocukları Sahaya!

Bugün, her yıl 11 Ekim’de dünya çapında kutlanan Dünya Kız Çocukları Günü. •

Fenerbahçe Spor Kulübü olarak Birleşmiş Milletler tarafından kız çocuklarına karşı ayrımcılığın önlenmesi ve onların insan haklarından tam ve etkili bir şekilde yararlanmalarını sağlamak amacıyla "Dünya Kız Çocukları Günü" ilan ettikleri bu önemli günü kutluyor ve bir kez daha “Birlikte Eşitiz” diyoruz. •

Basketbol, voleybol, boks, yelken, kürek, masa tenisi, atletizm, yüzme branşlarında kadın-erkek onlarca sporcumuzla faaliyet gösteren, altyapılarımızda sporcular yetiştiren Kulübümüz; •

Daha iyi bir toplum, daha iyi bir gelecek ve aydınlık yarınlar için 'Birlikte Eşitiz’ diyerek HeForShe hareketine desteğini sürdürmek, .
Ülkemizin aydınlık yarınları için kız çocukları ve kadınlara eşit imkânlar sunulması, toplumsal cinsiyet eşitliği konusunda sporun gücü ile kitleleri harekete geçirip farkındalık yaratmak adına attığı adımlara bir yenisini daha ekledi. •

Fenerbahçe Spor Okullarımızın, kız çocuklarını futbolla buluşturmak adına kulüp tarihimizde bir ilk olarak kızlar için futbol uygulamasını hayata geçirdiğini paylaşmaktan gurur duyuyoruz. •

Kulübümüzün, Birleşmiş Milletler Kadın Birimi’nin “başta erkekler olmak üzere tüm bireyleri Toplumsal Cinsiyet Eşitliği için dayanışmaya ve harekete geçmeye çağıran” HeForShe hareketine Tüpraş’ın desteği ile dâhil olarak attığı adımın bir parçası olan bu proje ile kız çocukları toplumda egemen olan cinsiyet kalıplarını kırarak Fenerbahçe Dereağzı Lefter Küçükandonyadis Tesislerimizde futbol eğitimi alacaklar. •

Hayali futbol oynamak olan tüm kız çocuklarını Fenerbahçe Spor Okulları’na bekliyoruz! •

BİLGİ İÇİN: 
Tel: 0216 542 92 41-43-61-63

Adres: Fenerbahçe Dereağzı Lefter Küçükandonyadis Tesisleri B Girişi / Spor Okulları Kayıt Merkezi 
Not: 2010-2011-2012 doğum tarihli kız çocukları kayıt yaptırabilecektir.

#minoritiesandmedicine

In 2015, women comprised 46% of trainees across all specialties,
34.4% of gastroenterology GI fellows, and
16.4% of practicing gastroenterologists.

I am one of them.

Being a female gastroenterologist, I feel honored and privileged to be exceling in a male dominated field but it comes with some challenges…

About 41% of female GI reported in a survey that they consider their hand size to be too small for standard endoscope handles resulting in more risk of musculoskeletal and occupational injuries.

I often get mistaken for a physician assistant, as both of my partners are male.

No, where are you REALLY from? Because being a New Yorker is never a good enough answer.

Don’t you want to stay home when you’re husband is a doctor?! You speak English really well. I thought you were Hispanic. (I got that a lot when my hair was colored blonde in fellowship). You’re too pretty to be a doctor. Why do you want to look at people’s BUTTS all the time?! Are you sure you’re a doctor? Are they giving out MD licenses with driver licenses? (I had a patient ask me that in fellowship). How come you don’t cover your head and allowed to work outside the house?

Thank you Maggie @magnoliaprintzmd for starting this discussion. I agree we need more awareness and action because being a GOOD doctor shouldn’t be based on skin color, identity or religious beliefs. We are in it to serve humanity and I don’t discriminate when you walk in my office.
.
.
.
#minoritiesinmedicine 
#womeninmedicine 
#scrublife #babesinscrubs #mamasinmedicine #gastroenterology #gidoctor #womeninwhitecoats #ilooklikeadoctor #medicalschool #girldoctor #girlpower

hashtags:
👉🏻Texto completo para @bjjgirlsmag em bit.ly/bjjelesporelas.
.
🔻🔻🔻🔻🔻🔻
Não seja o jiujiteiro que:

1. Não admite ser finalizado por mulher.
2. Não deixa a namorada treinar com homem.
3. Questiona a capacidade daquela menina que é mais graduada que você.
4. Manda xaveco furado no inbox.
5. Acha natural ter premiações maiores para homens que mulheres nos campeonatos.
6. Inventa desculpas quando toma atraso de mulher no treino.
7. Isola as mulheres no treino.
8. Subestima a companheira de treino e fica fazendo pouco caso enquanto rola com ela.
9. Faz comentários depreciativos do tipo: “Até fulana faz melhor que você” ou “Tá parecendo mulherzinha”.
10. Não liga para as lutas femininas em um campeonato, especialmente nas faixas mais baixas.
.
Não, não seja este jiujiteiro. Pelo contrário, seja aquele que apoia e, principalmente, estimula a mudança de visão dos seus pares.
.
Um movimento lançado globalmente pela ONU em 2014, o #HeForShe estimula justamente a remoção destas barreiras ao convidar os homens a saírem da omissão e a reconhecerem o papel fundamental que eles têm como parceiros do desenvolvimento feminino.
.
Em um esporte que nasceu masculino, em que a própria @kyragracie já contou o quanto teve que suar pra convencer a família, o movimento é mais que necessário nos tatames. Homens e mulheres, juntos, comprometidos na construção de um esporte saudável e igualitário.
.
Se você, jiujiteiro, não se viu em nenhuma destas dez situações tão rotineiras – maravilha, já está um passo a frente. Mas não seja omisso quando vir outro jiujiteiro se comportando dessa forma. Seja aquele cara que, em vez de ficar impassível diante de uma dessas situações, chega para o companheiro de treino e diz: “Meu irmão, não é por aí.”
.
Somos umas poucas mulheres e, em contrapartida, são muitos os homens que poderiam estar ao nosso lado para incentivar, ativamente, a adesão e a permanência feminina no esporte. E no fim do dia, fortalecê-lo, que é o desejo de todos nós. Uma por todos. Todos por uma.

#bjjgirlsmag #jiujiteiras #bjjgirls #supportbjjwomen #igualdadedegenero

hashtags:
Why pretending? Why are we trying to look perfect in front of others? Why do we try to hide our failures, our weaknesses, our imperfections?
·
We have all been facedown in the ground, defeated. We are all imperfect. We all have a story that involves hurt and healing at some point of our lives (maybe even in the present moment).
·
People that look like they are always doing fine, being strong, always positive, being always in the right path... They are just good at pretending.
·
Be honest with yourself and with others, be authentic and accept yourself, and accept others knowing that there's always a story behind every mask, behind every scar. Have compassion. You never know who's in the process of hurting, or healing. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
¿Por qué fingir? ¿Por qué estamos tratando de lucir perfectos frente a los demás? ¿Por qué tratamos de ocultar nuestros fracasos, nuestras debilidades, nuestras imperfecciones?
·
Todos hemos estado boca abajo en el suelo, derrotados. Todos somos imperfectos. Todos tenemos una historia que involucra dolor y sanación en algún momento de nuestras vidas (tal vez incluso justo ahora).
·
Las personas que parecen estar siempre bien, ser fuertes, siempre positivas, estar siempre en el camino correcto... Simplemente son buenas para fingir.
·
Sé honesto contigo mismo y con los demás, sé auténtico y aceptate a ti mismo, y acepta a los demás sabiendo que siempre hay una historia detrás de cada máscara, detrás de cada cicatriz. Ten compasión. Nunca se sabe quién está en un proceso de dolor, o sanando.
·
·
·
·
·

hashtags:
⁣#ACTLIKEACEO - Peer to Peer Communication ⠀
⠀
In a world that’s rapidly becoming more impatient & more intolerant - now more than ever, your professional opportunities for growth, your perception as a leader and a business partner of value are being linked to the way you are able to successfully deploy a multi focal & situational approach to #communication ⠀
⠀
Some tips of how you can disagree yet not come across as disagreeable in the workplace - ⠀
⠀
🔸Respect other people’s communication style & defer to what format they’re most comfortable communicating in (verbal, written etc) ⠀
⠀
🔹Analyze & adapt your own communication style at regular intervals if you’re not getting the results you want. Seek feedback from trusted sources. ⠀
⠀
🔸Non verbal signals play an important part in getting your message across. Observe & learn to recognize them in others. Understand your own. Clarify when necessary!⠀
⠀
🔹Be open minded, welcome diverse viewpoints and recognize that as you’re shaped by your own experiences/choices so are others. ⠀
⠀
🔸Keep the focus on the situation rather than the individual. This is probably the most difficult to stick to. While demanding accountability is important, try & be clear and direct in your expectations, stay solution oriented and make building relationships a priority. ⠀
⠀
[Photos from ASBS-ISMR 2019-21 MBA Batch commencement earlier this year]⠀
⠀

Today is world mental health day, and we want to start a conversation! Mental health issues are invisible in that they’re hard to perceive from the outside, so sometimes it can appear that everything is fine when it’s not (especially on social media). There is no shame in struggling, and we want you to know it’s always a good idea to reach out for support when you need it. Comment below one thing you wish more people knew about mental health. 🧠♥️ pc @recoveryisaboutyou

hashtags:
The United Nations #InternationalDayOfTheGirl is this Friday, Oct 11.  We all need to stand with girls in our lives, in our communities and around the world.  We must break the cycles of gender inequality now, and for generations to follow.  Who can accelerate the pace of change for #Equality? Men joining in to participate.
Did you know that: 
63 million girls aren’t in secondary school worldwide 
15 million girls under 18 are married each year 
781 million illiterate adults are women, making up 2/3 of illiterate adults 
By age 6, girls already see boys as more intelligent and capable of partaking in “really, really smart activities” than they themselves are
(all taken from She’s the First and UN Women)

The numbers are astounding, but there is so much we can do just by using our voices. 
Malala Yousafzai says, “Let us pick up our books and our pens, they are the most powerful weapons. One child, one teacher, one book and one pen can change the world.” #alliesmatter #advocates #genderinequality #HeForShe #Manbassadors #feminist
likes: |Yes we can!!!

hashtags: Today is #WorldMentalHealthDay and I’m here to remind you that your feelings, whatever they are, are valid and important. ✨ You deserve love and respect. And it will get better, I promise. Mental health is a tricky thing to write about, and has it’s own dedicated chapter in my upcoming book. It was hard to write, but I did it. Not one part of me was comfortable spilling the details of my depression and anxiety onto those pages, but I felt like I had to do it. Even if it helps only one person, it will have been worth it. It’s so hard putting yourself in a vulnerable position and asking for help, but there is no shame in it. Your mental health is just as important as your physical health and should be prioritised as so. Please know that if any of my friends/followers ever need a rant/chat/someone to offload on/cry over a bottle of wine, I’m your gal. You’re stronger than you think, and I believe in you 💪🏼❤️ #WomanOnTop

Porque é Outubro, porque é importante!!! Outubro Rosa 🎀 o mês que destaca a importância da conscientização sobre câncer de mama!
O recado de hoje é com a @isa_luchiari 💕 para conscientizar as jovens sobre o cuidado com a própria saúde e também com a de suas mães, tias e avós, influenciando-as a se cuidarem melhor.
O movimento, que surgiu nos anos 90 na primeira Corrida pela Cura, realizada em Nova York, ganhou âmbito mundial, tendo diversos monumentos ganhando a cor rosa associada à luta e cura da doença. O câncer de mama é o tipo que possui maior incidência e maior mortalidade na população feminina. É um tipo de câncer considerado multifatorial. Uma forma eficaz de combate é o diagnóstico precoce. 🎀
.
.

On a serious note...
Today at work we took a stand against gender based violence and watched our male colleagues pledge #heforshe 
To all the brothers reading this...I can’t imagine you feel good after verbally, physically or emotionally abusing a woman and I’m sorry for whatever lead you to feeling like you could or what you may have been exposed to in your own childhood. I implore you to liberate yourself from disease of abuse. I know there are great men out there, my own dad and brothers are evidence. 
To the sisters stuck in abusive relationships; as someone who has chosen a single life, I assure you it is better to be alone than with the wrong person. Lack of companionship is a small price to pay for your happiness. 
#onelove #respectwomen #dignityforall

hashtags:
🌍 HELP SAVE OUR PLANET 🌍

Growing up Karoline was told by people and society that “your actions don’t matter in the big picture” and “this is not your responsibility”. She had to free herself from those believes in her process of becoming engaged in feminism and social justice 💪🦋🍃
.
Through information and events she realized that she could contribute to positive change in her own way. She decided to use her voice and lead by example. Emma Watson's speech at the UN in 2014 about HeforShe was an important inspiration. Seeing Emma use her voice for good inspired Karoline to do the same: “I felt I had to do the same on my platforms, no matter how small”, Karoline told me.

Now she runs a media outlet with her sister where they give young people the opportunity to read and write about the issues they care about. Check out @flytfrem for inspirational quotes, amazing pictures, and to read about important issues 🌳🙋‍♀️🌊
.
And listen to Karoline when she says:
Forgive yourself for not knowing what you didn’t know before you learned it.
Now do better,
Help save our planet 🌍

Card by @karolineflaate

#socialjustice #feminism #heforshe #climatechange #bethechange #noplanetB #helpsaveourplanet #climatecards #flytfrem #fornyetforståelse #sustainability #transformation

✨ Siebe: The campaigning linguist ✨
.
Hoi, hola, salut, hi, hallo. Whatever the language, there’s a good chance 21-year-old Siebe will understand! But not only that: this talented linguist is also a fierce advocate for gender equality. .
As a Youth Ambassador with @one, he campaigns from the grassroots to the highest political offices to get his message across. And he’s no stranger to the media, having appeared in articles in local and national newspapers. .
Siebe is standing alongside the #GirlForce!

hashtags:
Legend. Lore.⠀
⠀
The stories that surround a part of our life heavily influence how we perceive of its meaning. Like these pine cones hanging from the rafters of my family cabin. I’ve heard from a young age about how they came from the tall sequoias of California. How they would fall down from the heights of these giant trees, landing with an enormous thud on the forest floor. Resting until someone came along to discover and treasure them.⠀
⠀
That might have been the first story that was told to me about the magical land of California.. and still to this day that state, and these pine cones, carry a weight and magic far deeper than any map or “fast facts” list could ever convey.⠀
⠀
I like to think about the legends I tell myself about each part of my life. The journey to Boston, the epic love, the righteous struggle of entrepreneurship. It helps when things come dangerously close to the depressing mundane.⠀
⠀
Legend. Lore.⠀
⠀
What legends play in your life? What experiences of your day-to-day will become part of the “lore” you pass down to your children and grandchildren?⠀
⠀
#busthoughts

#DisruptYourFeed 🙅️ ⠀
.⠀
Today we launch our Social Media Pledge, to promote healthier and more positive social media use amongst teens and young people. 📱 The Pledge is based on the ground-breaking findings of a joint research project between The Female Lead and Cambridge Psychologist Dr Terri Apter. Follow the link in our bio to read the full report. ⠀
.⠀
The research comes out of global concern around the effect of the digital world on young people’s wellbeing, especially girls. Current social media guidance focuses on safety and time limits, but very little on how to make the experience more enriching. We wanted to know: can social media become an inspirational force in girls’ lives?⠀
.⠀
This important research has revealed multiple positive outcomes resulting from the introduction of new, female role models and disrupting the social media feed. Our Social Media Pledge turns our main findings into four easy guidelines for young people to use. Influencers, celebrities and teens have signed up to spread the word to millions of social media users - and we hope you will too! ⠀
.⠀
Simple but meaningful actions, done together, can have a big impact. Let's all take a stand to promote healthier and more positive social media use. Share the pledge on your own social channels today.⠀
.⠀
⠀
Thank you to @mariafilar for creating our pledge illustration 🎨⠀

Rachel Meghan Markle was raised in Los Angeles, California and has a mixed ethnic heritage. During her studies at Northwestern University, she began playing small roles in television series and films. From 2011 to 2017, she played Rachel Zane on the American legal drama Suits. She is an outspoken feminist and has addressed issues of gender inequality, and her lifestyle website The Tig featured a column profiling influential women. She represented international charity organizations and received recognition for her fashion and style, releasing a line of clothing in 2016.
Markle was married Prince Harry, son of Princess Diana and Prince Charles, grandson of Queen Elizabeth II, and she moved to London. She retired from acting and started undertaking public engagements as part of the British royal family. She became Duchess of Sussex upon her marriage to Prince Harry in 2018. They have a son, #ArchieMountbattenWindsor ... Cr Google Wikipedia

hashtags:
The hypocritical world we live in today is attached with a complete baggage of expectations for us to "fit in" the so called 'Society'. The expectations to speak, to act, to behave, to pursue, to dress and moreover to impress. 
The daily roles and material stuff are often categorized with the particular genders. 
A guy wearing pink is often regarded as 'a girl'. A girl is expected to be limited to her household or else she's being too bold and dominating. 
The idea of a guy being all tall and muscular and that of a girl being thin and curvy are the only 'body goals' of today's world.  The daily duties of taking care of household and children are quite unquestionably assigned to women without even them acknowledging to it and men are often burdened with the responsibility of having to support their family financially. 
Such little acts often leave a remarkably horrible footprint on someone's mind and can shun them up for lifetime. Our little actions such as a joke or a comment online or offline can change their lives forever and can have some serious questionable impact on their lives. 
So who has the power to change these prevailing stereotypes in our society? 
Of course Us. 
And if we need such things to stop, it starts right from us, from our homes, streets, schools, colleges, workplace and every other place where we can. 
Point out the negative, speak up for it, spread awareness , stand against it and do your best to help out. Don't just sit back and be the silent observer, reach out, talk and provide your support for those who cannot stand up for themselves. 
Uplift someone, strive to make the world a better place. The change begins with you, with me, with US. 
Ps- Stop being judgemental in the name of Sarcasm. Causing mental trauma is not a joke.
Graphics by :- @srishhhh.x , and
@pareekutsav
