Some say the one who keeps his cool the most is the strongest. That's false. Not daring to show yourself fully is absolutely being out of the arena. Not taking risks, not being courageous enough.
·
Being courageous is daring to show yourself in the arena, whether it is having the hard conversations you haven't had, talking about what's inside of you with your friends, or speaking up with your partner about which limits have been crossed in your relationship. All of these situations put you in the arena of vulnerability, not knowing what the exact outcome will be.
·
What situations are "being in the arena" for you?
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Algunos dicen que el que más se guarda sus emociones es el más fuerte. Eso es falso. No atreverse a mostrarse completamente es estar absolutamente fuera de la arena. No correr riesgos, no ser lo suficientemente valiente.
·
Ser valiente es atreverse a mostrarse en la arena, ya sea teniendo conversaciones difíciles que no has tenido, hablando de lo que hay dentro de ti con sus amigos o hablando con tu pareja sobre los límites que se han cruzado en su relación. Todas estas situaciones nos colocan en la arena de la vulnerabilidad, sin saber cuál será el resultado.
·
¿Qué situaciones son "estar en la arena" para ti?
·
·
·
·
·

We want to know which accounts you follow. Which accounts inspire you? Tag them below so you can share with our #Unstoppable #MSMU community 💜
・・・
#DisruptYourFeed 🙅️ ⠀
.⠀
Today we launch our Social Media Pledge, to promote healthier and more positive social media use amongst teens and young people. 📱 The Pledge is based on the ground-breaking findings of a joint research project between The Female Lead and Cambridge Psychologist Dr Terri Apter. Follow the link in our bio to read the full report. ⠀
.⠀
The research comes out of global concern around the effect of the digital world on young people’s wellbeing, especially girls. Current social media guidance focuses on safety and time limits, but very little on how to make the experience more enriching. We wanted to know: can social media become an inspirational force in girls’ lives?⠀
.⠀
This important research has revealed multiple positive outcomes resulting from the introduction of new, female role models and disrupting the social media feed. Our Social Media Pledge turns our main findings into four easy guidelines for young people to use. Influencers, celebrities and teens have signed up to spread the word to millions of social media users - and we hope you will too! ⠀
.⠀
Simple but meaningful actions, done together, can have a big impact. Let's all take a stand to promote healthier and more positive social media use. Share the pledge on your own social channels today.⠀
.⠀
⠀
Thank you to @mariafilar for creating our pledge illustration 🎨⠀

Our next introduction is for Ms Shirley Potter, Consultant Plastic and Reconstructive Surgeon.

Ms Potter is currently working at the Mater Misericordiae Hospital, Dublin. She has a strong research portfolio having published widely, while also supervising masters and PhD students under the Irish Intercalated Clinical and Academic Training program. Ms Potter has also completed a Masters in Medical Education and has a special interest in microsurgery simulation. We are extremely grateful to her for agreeing to participate as one of our mentors on October 19th!

hashtags:
Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf was the first elected female head of state in Africa when she took office as the President of Liberia in January 2006. She signed a Freedom of Information bill (the first of its kind in West Africa) and made reduction of the national debt a cornerstone of her Presidency. To investigate crimes committed during Liberia’s civil war, she established a Truth and Reconciliation Commission and became a global icon with her commitment to fighting dictators, corruption and poverty through empowerment of women and girls. President Sirleaf and two other female leaders (Leymah Gbowee and Tawakkol Karman), were awarded the 2011 Nobel Peace prize for their nonviolent role in promoting peace, democracy and gender equality... Cr Google (one org)

hashtags:
SER MUJER

Muchas mujeres en ocasiones podemos estar pasando por una situación en la que sin darnos cuenta no nos estamos aceptando que somos mujeres; por la sociedad en la que vivimos, educación desde niñas, situación emocional, etc... Pero es algo tan importante para nuestra vida y nuestra salud que para ello de paso el 8 tips para aceptarnos como divinas mujeres
.
💎 EVITA INSULTARTE 
Todos cometemos errores, incluso las mujeres. Cuando cometas un error tómalo como eso, un error, algo que puede ser cambiado y mejorado y solo repite te a ti misma, "va de nuevo" y a seguir adelante.
.
💎 TOMA DECISIONES POR TI MISMA

Confía en que puedes tomar decisiones sin tomar parecer a todo el mundo, es cierto que cometerás errores al tomar cierta decisión pero será tu decisión y aprenderás de ella. Pero también acertarás y también será TU acierto!
.
💎 PASA TIEMPO CONTIGO 
Tiempo a solas con nosotras mismas nos puede llevar a conocernos mejor y descubrir cosas que no sabíamos que teníamos.
.
💎 CUIDA LO QUE LE METES A TU CEREBRO

Procura escuchar música positiva, leer cosas bonitas (evita las noticias amarillistas), rodearte de gente positiva.
Te recomiendo escuchar una playlist en #spotify hecha por mi que se llama ¡Motívate! que contiene canciones positivas y a mi me ha ayudado mucho 😉
.
💎 ENSEÑA TUS VIRTUDES

Tu trabajo te ha costado saber lo que sabes, demuéstralo y aplaúdetelo
.
💎 SE TU MISMA

Esto suena choteado pero específicamente empieza por no fingir emociones que no sientas ni hacer cosas que no quieres.
.
💎 CONÓCETE

Seguramente has escuchado esto muchas veces y es fácil decirlo pero ¿como? Hazte preguntas, mi recomendación es el libro de #OdinDupeyron "En tu única vida ¿de que no te quieres perder?" es un libro que te hace preguntas acerca de ti que igual y nunca te habías hecho tu antes 💎 SATISFACETE A TI PRIMERO

Cuando vallas a tomar una decisión se un poco "egoísta" y piensa primero si te satisface a ti, y si no daña a nadie más y al contrario hasta ayuda a alguien más entonces es buena decisión 👍🏻 Espero te ayuden estos tips y si te gusto la pu licacion recuerda COMPARTIRLA en tu historia, darle ♥ y guardarla para que no se te olvide 😉 !Comenta!

#DisruptYourFeed 🙅️ ⠀
.⠀
Today we launch our Social Media Pledge, to promote healthier and more positive social media use amongst teens and young people. 📱 The Pledge is based on the ground-breaking findings of a joint research project between The Female Lead and Cambridge Psychologist Dr Terri Apter. Follow the link in our bio to read the full report. ⠀
.⠀
The research comes out of global concern around the effect of the digital world on young people’s wellbeing, especially girls. Current social media guidance focuses on safety and time limits, but very little on how to make the experience more enriching. We wanted to know: can social media become an inspirational force in girls’ lives?⠀
.⠀
This important research has revealed multiple positive outcomes resulting from the introduction of new, female role models and disrupting the social media feed. Our Social Media Pledge turns our main findings into four easy guidelines for young people to use. Influencers, celebrities and teens have signed up to spread the word to millions of social media users - and we hope you will too! ⠀
.⠀
Simple but meaningful actions, done together, can have a big impact. Let's all take a stand to promote healthier and more positive social media use. Share the pledge on your own social channels today.⠀
.⠀
⠀
Thank you to @mariafilar for creating our pledge illustration 🎨⠀

hashtags:
On being a minority woman in medicine

Facts (data)
🚺 50.7% of US medical students are female
🚺 19% of all surgeons are women
🚺 22% of full-time faculty in surgery are women
🚺 1% of all surgery department chairs are women
🚺 6% of the members of the Society of Vascular Surgery are women (2013)
🚺 31% of all women surgeons are non-Caucasian

Experience (all things I’ve heard)
- You are too young to be a surgeon.
- Look at today’s world, women aren’t staying at home.
- Are your kind allowed to work outside the home?
- I thought Muslim women weren’t allowed to work in a man’s field. Is your husband ok with that?
- You speak English very well for your kind.
- Oh you went into medicine because your parents wanted you to.
- You’ll never get married or be able to have a family because you went into surgery.
- So where are you actually from?

My narrative
My Muslim identity, my Pakistani identity, my first generation American identity, my identity as a woman, my identity as a physician and a surgeon make up my story. That is my story.

I haven’t seen all of these things in anyone, but I’ve seen parts and pieces in all of the kind doctors who have trained me.

My lesson
The color of your skin, your gender, your religious beliefs, all the labels you use may be different than mine but I’ve learned that the things that bind us together are so much greater than our differences. We are literally the same on the inside. It may be easy to forget on the daily but nothing is more evident to me as a surgeon.

Takeaway
If you are a student, resident, fellow, trainee of any sort, or a colleague, see this. The numbers are the numbers. Biases exist, and always will. But we are not the numbers. See the opportunity. Continue to pave your own path and find the people who inspire you.

Thank you @magnoliaprintzmd for starting this conversation 🙏🏽
————
Excerpt from @magnoliaprintzmd

I’m not looking for sympathy.
I am asking for more awareness and action.

What can you do?
✅ Believe us.
✅ Call it out when you see it.
✅ Stand with us.
✅ If you are a man, be a #heforshe.

#minoritiesandmedicine #womeninmedicine #ilooklikeasurgeon #minoritiesinmedicine #femaledoctor #growingupbrownskin

hashtags:
Committee service can change the landscape of medicine...⁣👩🏿‍⚕️👩🏻‍⚕️ 👨🏼‍⚕️👨🏽‍⚕️
⁣
Did you know that a year ago, ALL FOUR major GI societies were led by women? Even so we still can do better...⁣🌟
⁣
I’m honored to serve on the Member Engagement and Diversity committee of the @asgeendoscopy, and this past weekend we met in Chicago to discuss how we can do better. Many of my colleagues on the committee are big names in our field who can motivate change.⁣💥
⁣
How?⁣🤔
⁣
One of the major courses at @asgeendoscopy finally reached 50% female faculty. But we can do better with providing resources and paying attention to committee leadership (our committee happens to be led by a boss female endoscopist, Dr. Pari Shah from @sloankettering ).⁣🙌
⁣
We even questioned whether our committee was diverse enough. If you look closely we could still do better to ensure equal representation of racial, ethnic, gender, sexual orientation, and even career stage. Through informative white papers and grassroots campaigns, all GI societies are working on getting there for the sake of our future docs and how healthcare is perceived.⁣ 🌈
⁣
#diversity #representation #heforshe #genderequality #lgbtq #race #medicine #progress #inclusivity #doctors #change #medstudents #empoweringwomen #equality #letsdothis

Mi Alma Tiene Prisa ( Poema Golosinas ). Mario de Andrade - Brasil 1893-1945 
Conté mis años y descubrí, que tengo menos tiempo para vivir de aquí en adelante, que el que viví hasta ahora… 
Me siento como aquel niño que ganó un paquete de dulces: los primeros los comió con agrado, pero, cuando percibió que quedaban pocos, comenzó a saborearlos profundamente. 
Ya no tengo tiempo para soportar a personas absurdas que, a pesar de su edad cronológica, no han crecido. 
Ya no tengo tiempo para lidiar con mediocridades. 
No quiero estar en reuniones donde desfilan egos inflados. 
No tolero a manipuladores y oportunistas. 
Me molestan los envidiosos, que tratan de desacreditar a los más capaces, para apropiarse de sus lugares, talentos y logros. 
Quiero la esencia, mi alma tiene prisa… 
Sin muchos dulces en el paquete… 
Quiero vivir al lado de gente humana, ...muy humana. 
Que sepa reír, de sus errores. 
Que no se envanezca, con sus triunfos. 
Que no se considere electa, antes de hora. 
Que no huya, de sus responsabilidades. 
Que defienda, la dignidad humana. 
Y que desee tan sólo andar del lado de la verdad. 
Quiero rodearme de gente, que sepa tocar el corazón de las personas… 
Gente a quienes los golpes duros de la vida, le enseñaron a crecer con toques suaves en el alma. 
Sí… 
tengo prisa… -por vivir con la intensidad que sólo la madurez puede dar. 
Pretendo no desperdiciar parte alguna de los dulces que me quedan… 
Estoy seguro que serán más exquisitos que los que hasta ahora he comido. 
Mi meta es llegar al final satisfecho y en paz con mis seres queridos y con mi conciencia. 
Tenemos dos vidas y, la segunda comienza cuando te das cuenta que sólo tienes una... "Mario de Andrade"... 1.945

hashtags:
If you block vulnerability because you don't want to feel shame, sadness or even weakness, you will be also blocking the possibility to feel joy, and become your strongest self.
·
Real strength is built with real courage, and real courage isn't about who shows less emotions. It is about showing yourself as you are to the world, with no cover, no hiding. No guard up. That's the riskiest thing to do, what only true corageus men do.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Si bloqueas la vulnerabilidad porque no quieres sentir vergüenza, tristeza o incluso debilidad, también bloquearás la posibilidad de sentir alegría y convertirse en tu yo más fuerte.
·
La verdadera fuerza se construye con verdadero coraje, y el coraje real no se trata de quién muestra menos emociones.  Se trata de mostrarte como eres al mundo, sin cubiertas, sin ocultarte. Sin la guardia arriba. Eso es lo más arriesgado que pudieras hacer, lo que solo hacen los hombres verdaderamente valientes.
·
·
·
·
·

hashtags:
Equality between genders is the act of easily reaching the same sources, whatever the gender of the person is , that includes the involvement of women/girls in the economical,political,industrial fields and share in the making of decisions and others.
Equality between genders defined as the equality between male and female,under the topic that we are all humans (born equal) ,because both men and women are free to make their own decisions, create their own destiny,and develop themselves without facing the strict stereotypical thinking. 
Equality means that both personal and biological needs for both men and women should ( and must )be taken in consideration and recognition, and evaluated and understand without discrimination or double standards and favoritism that doesn’t mean that women and men MUST be similar but their rights and responsibilities and opportunities DON’T have to depend merely on their gender type. 
Equality means FAIR treatment between both genders, which include the equality in opportunities, benefits, duites and rights.
LAST but definitely not least teach your kids both girls and boys that feminism is not an act against manhood or men but a movement against abusing other human being under the name of manhood. ‎المساواة بين الجنسين هي سهولة الوصول إلى الموارد
‎بغض النظر عن نوع الجنس ، ويتضمن هذا المشاركة الأقتصادية و السياسية وفي صناعة القرار وتقييم السلوكيات المختلفة والحاجات وهذا بالمساواة بغض النظر عن الجنس.
‎المساواة بين الجنسين هي المساواة بين الرجل والمراة  وتتضمن مفهوم اننا جميعًا بشر، فالرجال والنساء هم أحرار في تطوير قدراتهم الشخصية وليصنعوا القرارات بدون الحدود المرسومة بواسطة الأفكار النمطية ( كل البشر مخلوقين احرار ). المساواة بين الجنسين تعني أن السلوكيات المختلفة والتطلعات وأحتياجات المرأة والرجل يجب أن تؤخذ في الاعتبار ويتم تقييمها وتفضيلها بمنتهى المساواة. هذا لا يعني أن الرجل والمرأة يجب ان يكونوا متشابهين ولكن حقوقهم ومسؤولياتهم وفرصهم لا تعتمد على نوع
‎جنسهم.
‎المساواة بين الجنسين تعني الانصاف في المعاملة بين
‎الرجل والمراة طبقًا لأحتياجتهم الخاصة. هذا يتضمن المساواة في المعاملة او المعاملة المختلفة ولكن الأهتمام بالمساواة في الحقوق والمنافع ‎والواجبات والفرص. 
Translated by @yara_own 
Art and Essay by @rereyahya7755

⚡ Negócio: Administradores, Marketing, Comunicadores, Relações Públicas, Empreendedores e outros perfis não-técnicos.

hashtags:
🎃Inktober 2019🎃
.
.
Day 7 : Emma Watson
Hey everyone this is Jesse your friendly neighborhood French Artist 🇫🇷
And today’s Inktober is about Emma Watson. It was just logical after Harry Potter. 
Because she became the first one that I called my Favorite Actress. 🥰
I’ve always loved her. She inspires me so much and everyday of my life. 
I love how she fights for what is right. And how she uses her celebrity so that people listen to her. 
I am so proud of what she did so far. With the campaign “He for She”, in 2014, which calls for men to advocate for gender equality.
July 2014, she was appointed as a UN Women Goodwill ambassador and made her first country visit as a UN Women Goodwill Ambassador to Uruguay where she gave a speech highlighting the need for women's political participation.
In 2016 with “Our Shared Shelf” : The goal of the club is to share feminist ideas and encourage discussion on the topic. One book is selected per month and is discussed in the last week of that month.
In July 2019, Watson helped to launch a legal advice line for people who have suffered sexual harassment at work.
.
.
.

On being a minority woman in medicine👩🏻‍⚕️⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
There are now more women in medical school than men (50.7% 🚺). However, as of 2019, only 23% of anesthesiologists are female❗️⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
It is an absolute honor and privilege to be an anesthesiologist. But there are challenges to being a small brown woman in medicine, especially in a male dominated field. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Years ago when Jon and I compared notes, he was in disbelief. He didn’t realize his privilege. No one ever questions his education, training, or expertise. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
❌I am constantly made to prove myself.  It is exhausting.❌⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Here are some memorable things I have encountered from patients: ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
“Can I  just call you Magnolia?” After he called the male phlebotomist, “Doctor.” ❗️⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
“Wait, so are you an ACTUAL doctor?”❗️⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
“When can I talk to the doctor?”❗️⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
“I don’t want that oriental girl putting an IV in me.” ‼️⁉️⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
In medical school I was bullied by a scrub tech. 😩⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I’m not looking for sympathy. ⁣⁣⁣
I am asking for more awareness and action. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
What can you do? ⁣⁣⁣
✅ Believe us. ⁣⁣⁣
✅ Call it out when you see it. ⁣⁣⁣
✅ Stand with us. ⁣⁣⁣
✅ If you are a man, be a #heforshe⁣.⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
And despite how you treat me, I will care for you like family. The of color your skin, how you identify, or your religion/beliefs maybe different than mine, but we are all human. Everyone is exactly the same in the inside. I know...I’ve seen it. ⁣⁣♥️⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Are you in a minority in medicine? I’d love to hear your thoughts. Tag me and join the conversation, #minoritiesandmedicine ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
#womeninmedicine #minoritiesinmedicine #femaledoctor #doctormom #anesthesia #growingupbrown #pinoypride #believeus #anesthesiologist ⁣#girlpower #femaleleaders #scrublife #womeninwhitecoats #girldoctor #medicalschoollife ⁣⁣
#medicalblogger 
#asawoman

October is National Domestic  violence awareness month⁣
⁣
Last week a young man who graduated in the same class as my son from St Mark’s School of Texas was arrested for raping 2 women⁣
⁣
He (along with my son) graduated in 2018 from an an elite all Boys Prep School in Dallas.⁣
⁣
He allegedly committed these crimes 3 months after HS graduation at age 18.⁣
⁣
This is horrifying ⁣
⁣
I am the mother of two boys⁣
⁣
I hope I have taught my sons  right versus wrong ⁣
⁣
Here is what I have learnt in reading about the issue of date rape:⁣
- teach your son that rape is not just a masked man assaulting a woman at gun point⁣
-  Ask permission before touching anyone ⁣
- Alcohol and sex are a bad combo⁣
- No means no ⁣
- A woman who has had alcohol may have her judgement impaired⁣
- A man who has had alcohol may not be able to comprehend NO and may also have impaired judgement ⁣
- Teach him empathy⁣
- Teach him kindness⁣
⁣
Boys need to hear more than just ⁣
“ don’t get her pregnant “⁣
⁣
They need to know the rules⁣
⁣
I’ll stop here because I feel sick about this 😔⁣

Outubro Rosa!!! Cada corpo tem uma história. O cuidado com as mamas faz parte dela!!! Celebrado anualmente, com o objetivo de compartilhar informações e promover a conscientização sobre câncer de mama, proporcionar maior acesso aos serviços de diagnóstico e de tratamento e contribuir para a redução da mortalidade.
Em 2019, a campanha no Outubro Rosa tem como como focos principais a prevenção primária (ações para reduzir os riscos) e a detecção precoce. O objetivo é fortalecer as recomendações do Ministério da Saúde para o rastreamento e o diagnóstico precoce do câncer de mama.

hashtags:
In an industry where most tech developers still are men, it’s easy to lose valuable perspectives. In order to develop technology that benefits all kinds of users, we need all kinds of people to join our company. That’s why we at Semcon have set a goal to be a gender balanced company in 2022 (male–female ratio between 60 and 40 per cent). We are already one of the most gender balanced companies in our industry, but we aim for a higher target. With more women in our company we not only develop better products and services, it also makes Semcon a more fun place to work at.
.

It’s been a fear for a long time to confess myself to be a feminist. Cuz you know, feminism is considered to be something arrogant and tend to be criticized especially here in Japan. But as shown in SDGs, gender equality is a essential and fundamental condition to make the better world and will be the key to solution for various modern social problems.(In fact, World Economic Forum,which is NOT a human rights organization also declares that gender equality must be achieved for economic development)So we need to take actions and create the future we live. Nobody should be left ignorant about the circumstance we are in and what is happening. In this symposium, I got inspired, impressed and encouraged by the students who gave amazing presentations. And I got to be convinced that our generation have the power to reach milestones. Girls, it’s time to stand up for what you think is right! Of course, men’s initiatives are very welcomed:) こんだけ長ったらしく書いたけど誰もこんな長文読みたくないと思うから端的に日本語で書くね。
日本でフェミニストって言うと男嫌いのキーキー喚いてる怖いおばさんってイメージがあるのは知ってるし、実際ネットでもネガティブな意見ばっかだけど本当は(少なくとも私は)フェミニズムは”ジェンダーに関係なく自分が思うように生きたらいいじゃん”ってことだと思ってるの。だから性別を理由に何かを強制されたり諦めさせられたりするのはうちらの世代でやめたいな。こうやって自分の考えをシェアするのはやっぱりちょっと怖いけど、黙ってるよりは批判された方が何億倍もマシだと思うからシェアするね。みんなもdon’t hesitate to speak out your opinionだよ!

#heforshe  #unwomen #feminism #feminist #genderequality

hashtags:
WHY WOMEN SHOULDN’T CLEAN CARS

The last time I offered an adult a lift in our car I warned them before they got in that it was a mess. ‘I’m sure it’s fine Helen, can’t be that bad…OH MY GOD!’ 🤮The reason it’s got so bad is that our car is so old and cost so little that we keep expecting it to die. It never seems worth the risk of investing all that time and effort into cleaning it. But we’ve been thinking this for two and a half years now and yesterday I could stand it no longer.

Plus, we all know the sexist image of the dad cleaning the car on a Sunday afternoon, don’t we? Well this would be a very good opportunity to subvert it. 🦹‍♀️ As Andrew recently pointed out, I’ve been quite lazy on the getting-out-on-the-farm-and-doing-the-dirty-‘boy’-jobs front. Not only are all the children, including Edie, probably massive chauvinist pigs by now, I’ve also veered dangerously off message on my blog (link in bio). Then again, there is something gloriously empowered about not doing the cleaning, isn’t there? By letting things go to shit perhaps I’m not just being a slattern, but a trailblazing feminist, who’s got better things to do than get down on all fours and contort herself into unlikely positions?

No?

I started mucking out the car. 🚙 Andrew and Bear were out at rugby, and before you say it, I had already taken Raff down to his rugby training, so there. It was as disgusting as ever. Sticky, dirty, full of things that shouldn’t be there (SWIPE 👉right). Although now I’m worried that those ladybird castanets and pre-chewed Snack A Jack cracker might actually come in handy at some point in the future. 💃

A few minutes in and Raff called me inside to wipe his bum. Fine. I did so then went back out and carried on with the car. Then Edie called me in to wipe her bum. Fine, again. As I went inside to help her Raff started hoovering the passenger foot-well.

When I came back out I began to smell burning. Then I realised the foot-well floor was soaking wet, and the wet had gotten inside the hoover. I felt very fortunate that it hadn’t blown up...for entire blog click link in bio

hashtags:
Hey you!⠀
⠀
Yes, you. What are you feeling right now? Deep breath, in and out. So much of our anger, stress, anxiety is generated in between our ears. Taking even a brief moment to step back (out of our heads) and into our bodies, through deep breathing, walking, or even laying down, can help us immensely in grounding back into reality.⠀
⠀
When things get crunchy, stressed, overwhelming this week do your best to snap out of it, step back, and orient to the reality that you’re alive and breathing.⠀
⠀
I’m not perfect at this, and you won’t be either, but I think it’s worth a try.⠀
⠀
😘⠀julia

hashtags:
This is me. Me and my serious face.
·
If you know me, you'll know that I'm normally smiling, dropping bad dad jokes. But not this time. This time, an overwhelming feeling of sadness and anger filled me, after a long hard day.
·
When I started working on my shadows, I started noticing other men's shadows, how much hurt there is in everyones heart, how deep are the wounds to be healed between men and women. How unconscious we have been while "living" our lives. How much pain we can cause when not being fully aware of ourselves and the ones that surround us.
·
There is a lot of work to do, but we definitely can do something to make it better. I'll do my best to guide more men toward their greatest selves. Towards their most beautiful selves. To find their inner light, so they can light up others too.
·
Yes, this is my serious face. One full of determination.
This is my purpose, and I'm not stopping.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Este soy yo. Yo y mi cara seria.
·
Si me conoces, sabrás que normalmente estoy sonriendo, haciendo algún chiste malo de papá. Pero no esta vez. Esta vez, un sentimiento abrumador de tristeza y enojo me llenó, después de un largo y duro día.
·
Cuando comencé a trabajar en mis sombras, comencé a notar las sombras de otros hombres, cuánto dolor hay en el corazón de todos, qué tan profundas son las heridas que hay por curar entre hombres y mujeres. Cuán inconscientes hemos estado mientras "vivíamos" nuestras vidas. Cuánto dolor podemos causar cuando no somos plenamente conscientes de nosotros mismos y de los que nos rodean.
·
Hay mucho trabajo por hacer, pero definitivamente podemos hacer algo para mejorarlo. Haré lo mejor que pueda para guiar a más hombres hacia su mayor ser. Hacia su ser más bello. Para encontrar su luz interior, para que puedan iluminar a otros también.
·
Sí, esta es mi cara seria. Una llena de determinación.
Este es mi propósito, y no me detendré.
·
·
·
·
·

hashtags:
October is well underway! 
This October is the 10th(!!) anniversary of She’s the First (@shesthefirst): the one and only cause I run for, and have been running for since my first marathon almost 4 years ago.
TL;DR I’d love your help supporting educating girls around the world. Link in my profile!

Every year I do something new with my running in an attempt to raise money for the amazing work these women do around the world, helping provide opportunities for young women around the globe to get educations and become educated women, leaders in their communities, and make the world a better place for everyone. I really can’t put into words how much I believe in the cause.

This year I’ve been running a full marathon every month—that means 9 marathons so far in 2019, each pictured above. I’m still out of the country for few more days and my attempts to run on vacation have been stymied, but once I’m home this week I’ll be back in action! As I come home I’ll be picking things up for the fall race season with more posts about training, race costumes, past memories, and of course my efforts at my final 3 marathons of the year. As I continue to #SweatForSTF you can also expect much more posting about She’s the First. I would be eternally grateful for each and every one of you to consider making even the smallest donation to She’s the First. As the words from the back of my first STF shirt said: “If you can read this, do something for the millions of girls who can’t!” Together we can make the world a better place one girl’s education at a time.
—

How often do you reinvent yourself? ⁠As I make another trip around the sun today, I’m reflecting on what new challenges I’ll tackle this year, and how they will make me grow.

It’s never too late to learn or try something new. In my forties, I have picked up:
- Tennis
- Writing
- Flatwater SUP
- Fundraising
- Soccer momming
- Social media as a physician
- And lastly, public speaking
⁠
I used to be terrified of speaking in a public setting. I could be engaging and funny with my closest friends, but never with strangers and definitely not in front of a crowd. ⁠
⁠
That changed just in the last few years. I learned how much of a voice I have, as a woman, a mom, a surgeon.  Never in a million years would I have thought that I could actually call myself a speaker, but now I do. ⁠In addition to speaking on my experiences as a mom and a woman in Orthopaedic surgery, I also get to MC a few events this year! 
Here’s to a good year!!
⁠————
If you'd like to see more of what I speak on, just click on this image in the link in bio!⁠

DISRUPT YOUR FEED🙅‍♀️ The Mail Online has just published an article on our research study "Disrupting the Feed". This week we will be launching our full social media and mental health campaign.
.
In 2018, The Female Lead and Psychologist Dr Terri Apter, Fellow Emerita of Newnham College, Cambridge teamed up to explore whether there was a causal or correlative relationship between teen aspiration, mental health and influence of social media. Much current research into  social media usage has focused on keeping safe online and time-limiting exposure to social channels. This research sought to explore whether teenage girls can be encouraged to use social media to expand, guide or reinforce their interests and aspirations by following more high-achieving women on social media.

Link in bio for the full report ! .
.⠀

The #MeToo movement has been a catalyst to where we are now- openly discussing rape culture and calling it out for what it is.⁠
⁠
But what now?⁠
⁠
We are at a cultural tipping point and in order for us to move forward and being able to say #NeverAgain, we need to actively and PROactively take measures to create #consentculture. ⁠
⁠
In this episode I talk about how we can do that- ALL of us!⁠
⁠
Check out the episode via the link in my bio!⁠
⁠
⁠

We are excited to share our research with the Daily Express in today's publication written by Lucy Johnston, the health editor.

This week we will be launching our full social media and mental health campaign. 
In 2018, The Female Lead and Psychologist Dr Terri Apter, Fellow Emerita of Newnham College, Cambridge teamed up to explore whether there was a causal or correlative relationship between teen aspiration, mental health and influence of social media. Much current research into teen social media usage has focused on keeping safe online and time-limiting exposure to social channels. This research sought to explore whether teenage girls can be encouraged to use social media to expand, guide or reinforce their interests and aspirations by following more high-achieving women on social media.

See the results here: www.thefemalelead.com/research
.
.
.⠀

hashtags:
Чоловіки про фемінізм: літературознавець і видавець Ростислав Семків розповів нам про фемінізм у його житті й українській народній творчості (повне інтерв’ю за лінком у біо 📲)
⠀
💬 Базовий стереотип, із яким ми воюємо, — жінка може менше, ніж чоловік. Він досі дуже поширений у багатьох сферах, хоча останні двадцять років ми бачимо, як цей стереотип неухильно зазнає краху — постійно з’являються успішні жінки в інших сферах. Це доводить, що це не якась природна диспропорція, що її штучно складено, а отже, її можна і треба змінити.
⠀
💬 На побутовому рівні я завжди пояснюю це так: мені дуже подобається слово «самостійність» через його етимологію. «Самостійний» — це той, хто сам чи сама може стояти, без підтримки. Фемінізм починається там, де самостійні жінки хочуть, щоб інші були самостійними. Чоловіки не просто мають право вирішувати — від них чекають, що вони будуть самостійними й вирішуватимуть за всіх, а від жінок цього не чекають.
⠀
💬 Мета феміністичного руху — вирівняти цей дисбаланс. Якщо людина уявляє собі, що феміністки — це такі жінки, котрі хочуть щось відібрати у чоловіків, підточити основи ладу, не хочуть народжувати дітей — маса різних фобій і неправильних уявлень, то це може викликати спротив. Якщо йдеться про те, щоб жінки самі вирішували і були самостійними, то це не мало б у більшості випадків викликати якогось опору чи якоїсь суперечности.
⠀
💬 Звісно, якщо ми розглядатимемо фольклор, то він весь дуже патріархальний і сексистський. Тут мають прийти якісь ремейки. А якщо говорити про літературу для дітей, то краще, ясна річ, брати сучаснішу, бо європейська література ХХ сторіччя для дітей вже інакша. Особливо якщо ми порівняємо це з фольклором, казками ХІХ століття чи й ранішими, як-от про Червону Шапочку тощо. А такі, звичайно, треба пояснювати, що це одна з версій історії, бо історія могла бути іншою. «Вовчиця і Червоний Каптурик» — це, по-моєму, непогано. Це потребує ремейків.
⠀
#HeForShe

hashtags:
-
Your feelings are important! Your feelings are valid! Your feelings are real and nobody can know how it is if they are not you! Don't let anyone dictate or criticize your feelings, don't let them make you think that you are worthless and fake. Don't get caught in that trap.
A lot of people will try to get you down, minimize your struggle, tell you nothing is wrong because they have been through or seen worse. But there is no such thing. Each person has a different body, a different mind, different living conditions, different problems, different ways to cope with bad thoughts and the list goes on. Nobody is you, nobody knows how you see the world, nobody knows how hard things are for you, nobody thinks and feels what you feel the way you do. Someone may think they have had it worse but that means that your situation would be easier for them to cope with than it is for you. Maybe their problems would be easier for you to deal with. But that's the thing; we don't choose our struggle, nobody chooses to be in pain, especially pain that they cannot endure.
Mental illnesses are different on everyone. And even if it's not a mental illness, it's still pain, it's still sadness, it's still stress, it's still numbness, it's still anger, it's still valid!! If it's bad, it's bad. It can hurt. It can confuse you. And you deserve to be heard! You deserve to recover! It isn't some kind of competition and you don't earn something by spreading hate & making people feel even more insecure. Stop comparing, invalidating, trying to pretend you know it all and thinking that people who don't hurt like you don't hurt at all. Instead, spread positivity, love, be kind, smile, don't trigger and promote how bad life is, understand people!! We're all humans, we can all work on ourselves in order to be better. We should change into better. I love you. 💗

hashtags:
And we can't walk it alone. We need help. We need support. We need accountability. We need compassion. We need love.
·
A lot of social debates have been against men, telling things like "all men are violent", "all men are the same", always refering to the negative side of men as something that has always been there, naturally. But that's not true.
·
Our shadows have been acquired through being surrounded by a violent culture, that never gave us the right to feel and grow emotionally. It's not men, or people, what we are fighting against. It's an idea, a wrong idea of what a man should be.
·
And what we, as men, have to do to end this idea, is to take every little step, from our heads to our hearts, being vulnerable and authentic. Showing up. Speaking up. Manning up. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Y no podemos caminarlo solos. Necesitamos ayuda. Necesitamos apoyo. Necesitamos compañía. Necesitamos compasión. Necesitamos amor.
·
Muchos debates sociales han ido contra los hombres, diciendo cosas como "todos los hombres son violentos", "todos los hombres son iguales", siempre refiriéndose al lado negativo de los hombres como algo que siempre ha estado allí, naturalmente. Pero eso no es verdad.
·
Nuestras sombras se han adquirido al estar rodeados de una cultura violenta, que nunca nos dio el derecho de sentir y crecer emocionalmente. No estamos luchando contra los hombres o las personas. Es una idea, una idea equivocada de lo que debería ser un hombre.
·
Y lo que nosotros, como hombres, tenemos que hacer para poner fin a esta idea, es dar cada pequeño paso, desde nuestras mentes hasta nuestros corazones, siendo vulnerables y auténticos. Estando presentes. Alzando la voz. Siendo hombres.
·
·
·
·
·

Meryl Streep has been nominated for 19 Academy Awards, more than any other actor or actress in history. She has won three times – best supporting actress for Kramer vs Kramer (1979) and best actress for Sophie’s Choice (1982) and again for The Iron Lady (2011). Born in New Jersey and educated at Vassar College, Dartmouth College and Yale, Meryl Streep is widely regarded as the leading actress of her generation, not least for her ability to transform herself into a wide range of diverse characters. She has received 29 Golden Globe nominations, more competitive (non-honorary) nominations than any other actor or actress in the history of the award, and won eight times.⠀
⠀
In 2010, President Barack Obama awarded her the National Medal of Arts and, in 2014, the Presidential Medal of Freedom. She was a founding member of Mothers and Others, an environmental advocacy group which successfully lobbied Congress for new regulations protecting children from the hazards of pesticide exposure. She has underwritten scholarships at colleges and universities, and funds a screenwriting programme for women over the age of 40 through New York Women in Film. In 2015, she sent every member of Congress a letter and a book, Equal Means Equal, supporting the Equal Rights Amendment, a proposed amendment to the US Constitution designed to mandate equal right for women under the law.⠀
⠀
See her full interview from The Female Lead: https://buff.ly/2oOlplU⠀

[☁️] Two years, two years now that my account has seen the light. In this two years I supported as I can with all my love and devotion, Emma Watson. And furthermore, on this two years I known a lot of Watsoners, around the world, with different countries, different languages but one common point, our idol. Thanks to Emma, my road in front of me is lighter, she learned me to stand up, even if it seems sometimes that it’s always nighttime and nightmares. And today, thanks to Emma, I met so much incredible and golden hearts people! 
On this 05 October 2019, I wanted to thanks you all for who you are, I want to thanks all of my friends, and I want you to wear your most beautiful smile because that is the most wonderful thing you can wear. Thanks to all the people who light my days, I wish to you all the best, that all your dreams come true, never forget that you worth it, that you are loveable and that I am here again, after two years now. You are all wonderful, thank you for all your kind messages today it goes through my heart and I don’t know what I did to deserve all this! 
Furthermore I did this edit to remind to each of you to never give up, follow your dreams and fight for who you are because I promise that you can. As I promise that I always be here and as I am thankful today for each of you. Remember that yesterday is history, that tomorrow is a mystery and who knows, maybe your dreams are just there, but that today is a gift, that’s why it’s called present! It’s a huge present for me to be in this community with angels as you! 
Now thank you for reading, I love you and I will finish by saying, -
-
-
•Above all, take care!• Margot💜

hashtags:
Questa mattina mi sentivo felice. 
Per la giornata di sole, per i capelli sciolti nel vento leggero, per il tempo che avevo dedicato e stavo continuando a dedicarmi. 
Questa mattina, quindi, camminavo su un marciapiede della mia città, assorta nei miei pensieri positivi e avvolta nel mio impermeabile rosa che contribuisce a farmi sentire tanto bene. 
Poi sei arrivato tu, essere umano di genere maschile. Tu hai pensato bene di liberare il tuo apprezzamento nell’etere e senza controllo, che si è tradotto in una smanceria volgare e priva di senso, oltre che di educazione. 
Ti svelo un segreto: agli occhi di nessuno sei sembrato più virile, solo patetico. 
Al contrario, anche a voler essere distaccati e a voler presumere la buona fede, hai fatto sentire me “sporca”, come l’animale da esposizione del mercato bestiame. 
Non è la prima volta che mi succede e non sarò l’ultima donna a patire questo imbarazzo. Il dilemma, però, è sempre lo stesso: esprimo la mia opinione o resto bloccata nel timore di essere giudicata esagerata? D’altra parte perché non dovrei farlo? In fondo non si tratta di essere incontentabile, ma solo di non sentirsi insicura. 
E in fondo una responsabilità morale verso le nuove generazioni c’è e non si può ignorare. 
Deve essere trovata una strategia per reagire, lo si deve a noi stesse come donne e a tutte le figlie e sorelline che girano in casa. 
Nel frattempo tu, piccola donna che stai crescendo, non sminuirti. Accetta, se vuoi, ironie e complimenti solo da chi ti è amico o da chi hai scelto per stare al tuo fianco. E tu, piccolo uomo, non prendere quest’altro uomo come esempio, non sono certo tutti come lui. Invece se riesci cerca di essere un alleato: c’è bisogno anche di te per cambiare lo status quo. 
#womenempowerment #future #worktogether #heforshe

hashtags:
En ce #day5 de #inktober2019 (pardon à la langue française pour cette première phrase), je voulais rendre hommage à mon épouse.
.
Parce qu'elle s’est coltiné, elle une féministe, le bon gros macho cisgenre que j’étais encore il y a peu.
.
Ça n'a pas toujours été facile pour elle de subir mes bons vieux réflexes de dominant issu du patriarcat.
.
Ben oui, voyons, tu le sais, hein, toi qui te crois supérieur parce que tu as deux grelots et un tuyau (pas toujours très long même si tu dis qu’il fait deux mètres).
.
Non tu sais pas ?... Et ben, y a du boulot...
.
Alors ma femme avec sa patience, et Dieu sait qu’il lui en a fallu, s’est appliquée à démolir brique par brique mon phallocentrisme et à reconstruire un homme moins misogyne. Je dis “moins” misogyne, hein, pas “plus du tout” misogyne, parce que tout n'est pas encore parfait, mais je progresse.
.
Aujourd’hui je me considère comme pro-féministe, pas comme féministe, car je ne vivrai jamais les difficultés que vivent les femmes. Je peux seulement essayer de comprendre…
.
Je me sens beaucoup mieux depuis, à l’inverse des hommes qui perdent leurs repères face au féminisme. J’ai moins la pression de la performance (sexuelle ou pas), de la virilité absolue, de la domination… Mettez-vous y les gars vous verrez on se sent mieux après…
.
Et oui un macho ça se déconstruit et un homme ça se construit. Alors merci ma chère épouse de faire de moi l’homme que je suis en train de devenir.
.
Et sinon, ce dessin est fait avec les personnages du blog @ozratopia pour lequel je fais des illustrations de temps en temps. #follow
.
Et merci aussi au podcasts #lescouillessurlatable animé par @vtuaillon ( 📷 @soundcloud @itunes) qui m’ont bien aidé aussi.
.
.
.

hashtags:
Meryl Streep has been nominated for 19 Academy Awards, more than any other actor or actress in history. She has won three times – best supporting actress for Kramer vs Kramer (1979) and best actress for Sophie’s Choice (1982) and again for The Iron Lady (2011). Born in New Jersey and educated at Vassar College, Dartmouth College and Yale, Meryl Streep is widely regarded as the leading actress of her generation, not least for her ability to transform herself into a wide range of diverse characters. She has received 29 Golden Globe nominations, more competitive (non-honorary) nominations than any other actor or actress in the history of the award, and won eight times.⠀
⠀
In 2010, President Barack Obama awarded her the National Medal of Arts and, in 2014, the Presidential Medal of Freedom. She was a founding member of Mothers and Others, an environmental advocacy group which successfully lobbied Congress for new regulations protecting children from the hazards of pesticide exposure. She has underwritten scholarships at colleges and universities, and funds a screenwriting programme for women over the age of 40 through New York Women in Film. In 2015, she sent every member of Congress a letter and a book, Equal Means Equal, supporting the Equal Rights Amendment, a proposed amendment to the US Constitution designed to mandate equal right for women under the law.⠀
⠀
See her full interview from The Female Lead: https://buff.ly/2oOlplU⠀
Image by Brigitte Lacombe for The Female Lead Campaign⠀⠀

People like  Rana and many more such  extraordinary people I call my friends and inspiration keep me going when I embark on my solo rides  trying my best to bring in awareness amongst the girls and women of the villages I pass through about genital hygiene ,cervical and breast cancer.
Sometimes when I feel I can't go on...I look back at such pictures and their inspiring stories...I confidence strengthens to focus on my cause and to move forward. I tell myself ,if this international skater from my city could SKATE the 6000kms of GQ for 90 days and raise money for 25000 nanhi kalis...and continue to smile through it all....what's my excuse to give up?? And then I go on....with new energy and new Josh to my next destination...
So thank you @ranarolling for being a constant support to me and my journeys and for inspiring not just me but thousands of them through your work and humble nature. 
This pic will always remain special to me.
#gratitude #heforshe #vizag #inspiration #friendwhoinspires #biker #solo #rideforacause #travelrealindia #incredibleindia🇮🇳

hashtags:
Ontem foi o último dia do Congresso de Liderança Política Feminina promovido pelo Tribunal Regional Eleitoral e pela Assembleia Legislativa de Santa Catarina em Florianópolis.

Só temos a agradecer por mais essa oportunidade de dividir com outras pessoas as nossas angústias sobre a baixa representatividade das mulheres na política e um pouco do que já aprendemos nessa caminhada.

Ironicamente, saímos de Brasília para tentar mudar um pouco do triste cenário que vivemos no Brasil, mas voltamos com a certeza de que - na verdade - mudamos mais a nós mesmas. Cada encontro como esse, em que conhecemos tantas mulheres incríveis e engajadas, renova a nossa energia e nos dá ainda mais força para seguir em frente.

#elaspedemvista #maismulheresnapolitica #elasporelas #heforshe #maismulheresnopoder

Todo dia de manhã bem cedo, antes de pisar no acelerador, tenho procurado parar e repensar o dia anterior para melhorar meu único dia possível, o hoje
.
Como sou uma pessoa compulsiva e ansiosa, a meditação, combinada com respiração profunda repetidas vezes, me traz serenidade. Dedico uns 5 minutos pra isso e me sinto muito mais consciente e  presente no agora!
.
E serenidade ou calma é, sem dúvida, fator primordial pra eu seguir sem "pirar o cabeçote" e cumprir as metas que coloco pra mim
.
E você, como tem se inspirado pra não pirar?

Il y a 3 ans je réalisais mon premier ouvrage, « Genre et développement en République du Congo. Promouvoir l’égalité homme-femme au profit de la croissance ». Comme son titre l’indique, ce livre rend compte du lien de causalité qui existe entre l’amélioration nécessaire de la parité homme-femme et le développement d’un pays, la République du Congo, et par extension de tout un continent. Si cet ouvrage m’a permis de faire un état des lieux en 2016, 3 ans après je m’interroge sur de réelles et concrètes avancées dans le domaine. De plus en plus sont convaincus par cette nécessaire et inéluctable évolution. Mais dans les faits… Ne croyez pas pourtant qu’il soit question de lâcher prise, d’abandonner le combat. L’enjeu est trop important. Il en va de l’intérêt de tous.

hashtags:
❤️#aventurasdarafa❤️
.
**ESFORÇO OU SACRIFÍCIO?**
.
Já que vocês pediram! Vamos falar de empreendedorismo por aqui.
.
Galera empreender não é algo que decidimos do dia para noite! É algo que começa com um sonho, e que depois de muitos planejamentos nasce um projeto.
.
A maior diferença entre fazer o que ama verdadeiramente , é você parar de falar em SACRIFÍCIO! Comece a entender que o que você faz é ESFORÇO! Todo sacrifício está ligado a coisas sofridas e ruins , já o esforço está ligado com empenho e recompensa.
.
Esforço é estar trabalhando quase 20horas seguidas , seu corpo já não responde seus comandos , porém sua mente e seu coração falam “ você da conta”! “Continua garota”!
.
Esforço é ver todos seus amigos no @rockinrio , e você saber que poderia estar lá , porém seus projetos de vida não te permitem naquele momento a sua ausência. .

Todo esforço tem sua recompensa ! Recompensa é receber um abraço apertado de alguém que era seu desconhecido , e após um contato , você recebe um feedback que te faz brilhar ainda mais os olhos! E não sejamos utópicos , recompensa também é saber que hoje não podemos estar no @rockinrio , mas daqui alguns dias você fará uma viagem dos sonhos ( tudo conquistado por vc! Fruto do seu esforço).
.
Nos próximos dias irei compartilhar com vocês um pouco mais sobre o que é empreender. Tem muita gente que me procura para saber como é sair de um mundo corporativo e empreender na prática! Então vamos lá né ... .
Acredite! Nunca desista dos seus sonhos!
.
Sonhe alto! Voe! O céu é o limite!
.

#empreender #heforshe #mulheresempreendedoras #programaelapode #behappy

@michaeladeprince is a Sierra Leonean-American ballet dancer. Born Mabinty Bagura to a Muslim family, she was orphaned at the age of three and sent to an orphanage where the ‘aunties’ who cared for the children believed that her skin condition, vitiligo, was a curse and called her the ‘devil’s child’. In 1999, she and another girl from the orphanage were adopted by a Jewish American couple who had 11 children, nine of them adopted.⠀
⠀
Inspired by a picture of a ballerina she had seen on a magazine cover in Sierra Leone, Michaela trained as a ballet dancer, winning a scholarship to study at the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis School at the American Ballet Theatre. In 2013, she joined the Dutch National Ballet; in 2015, MGM acquired the film rights to the book she wrote with her mother about her life, Taking Flight: From War Orphan To Star Ballerina.⠀

Målgrupp: Alla med intresse för idrott och jämställdhet. Ledare, utövare, styrelser och anställda. 🙂 Vi kommer att hålla till på Arken hotell i Göteborg. 
Kontakta thomas.gehoor@vgidrott.se för att höra om du kan få hjälp med kostnaden för deltagande.

Torsdag 24 oktober kl. 18.00 – 20.30
Charlotte Ovefelt - IF Brommapojkarna fotboll, BP, har som enda idrottsförening i Sverige fått statsbidrag från jämställdhetsmyndigheten för att arbeta med jämställdhetsprojekt under 2019.

Charlotte Ovefelt är anställd Jämställdhetsstrateg i fotbolls-Europas största barn- och ungdomsförening. Hon kommer att måla upp en bild av hur varje förening kan ta sitt ansvar i jämställdhetsfrågan, med konkreta exempel.

Fredag 25 oktober kl. 08.00-09.00 (Frukost 07:30)
Ida Lindgren - Judo5-konceptet. Det startade som ett strategiskt jämställdhetsarbete i en Judoförening och har nu, 5 år senare växt till ett prisbelönt koncept för jämställdhetsintegrering, applicerbart på alla idrotter. Ida Lindgren, svensk mästarinna, engagerad i RF:s etiska råd och med en lång rad erfarenhet av hållbarhetsarbete föreläser.

Processarbete under dagen kl. 9.00-17.00.

Fredag 25 oktober kl. 17.30 – 20.00
Utveckla arbetet med jämställdhetsintegreringen i din förening. Charlotte Axelsson är handledare i Försvarsmaktens utbildningskoncept i Jämställdhet, Genus och Ledarskap (JGL). Hon har även många års erfarenhet av jämställdhetsintegrerande ledarskap inom idrotts-rörelsen.

Lördag 26 oktober 9.00-12.30
Utbildarutbildning med Dino Ilecic: In- or outside the box

Dino har sin bakgrund inom tennisen och har ett stort intresse för idrottens roll i samhället. Dino har utformat vår egen utbildning ”In or outside the box” och håller under eftermiddagen en utbildarutbildning i materialet.

Lördag 26 oktober 13.00-14.30
Föreläsning efter lunch: Peter Rung (tidigare Svensson) - FN:s jämställdhetsenhet UN Women. Peter föreläser om jämställdhetsarbete i koppling till idrott. Få kunskap om hashtagen #heforshe och konceptet ”Ta snacket” som används inom idrottsrörelsen.

hashtags:
Es gibt Idioten, die tun einer Frau nicht gut. So richtige Dummköpfe. Wie mein Ex. Ich war nie gut wie ich war. Meine Klamotten zu "unsexy", ich selbst zu "unkompliziert", er der geilste Macker unter der Sonne (nein, das war er nicht!)
.
Gut, dass es vorbei ist! Ich weine ihm keine Träne nach 🙂 Wenn du gerade bei so einem Exemplar verweilst, renn weg so schnell du kannst 👣
.
Dann gibt es da die wundervollen Männer, die ihre Partnerin so akzeptieren, wie sie ist, sie respektieren und als ebenbürtig betrachten 💕💪
.
Sie kennen keine Abwertung, keine Chauvi Sprüche und haben das auch gar nicht nötig. Sie wissen, dass sie nicht besser, klüger, privilegierter oder wichtiger sind als eine Frau.
.
Sie finden, dass echte Gleichberechtigung keine Idee ist, sondern normal. Weil Frauen einfach das gleiche verdienen wie Männer. In jeder Beziehung.
.
Diese Traummänner sind selten. Aber sie sind für mich die einzig wahren echten Kerle💯
.
Wenn Frau sich so einen angeln kann, außerdem schwer verliebt in ihn ist und er zusätzlich auch noch ihr Kind vollständig akzeptiert, hat sie wohl im Lotto gewonnen 😊
.
Wenn er auch noch kreativ, klug, super witzig, verständnisvoll und attraktiv ist, ist es nicht nur Lotto, sondern jeden Tag 6 richtige 👩‍❤️‍👨
.
@wildemotive 💞
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

hashtags:
@michaeladeprince is a Sierra Leonean-American ballet dancer. Born Mabinty Bagura to a Muslim family, she was orphaned at the age of three and sent to an orphanage where the ‘aunties’ who cared for the children believed that her skin condition, vitiligo, was a curse and called her the ‘devil’s child’. In 1999, she and another girl from the orphanage were adopted by a Jewish American couple who had 11 children, nine of them adopted.⠀
⠀
Inspired by a picture of a ballerina she had seen on a magazine cover in Sierra Leone, Michaela trained as a ballet dancer, winning a scholarship to study at the Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis School at the American Ballet Theatre. In 2013, she joined the Dutch National Ballet; in 2015, MGM acquired the film rights to the book she wrote with her mother about her life, Taking Flight: From War Orphan To Star Ballerina.⠀
⠀
See her full interview from The Female Lead: https://buff.ly/334WGbT⠀

hashtags:
Today I have met an older man. I am always watch out for people. I saw him struggling with is mobility scooter. So I stopped and asked If he needed help and if everything was alright. 
Everything turned out to be alright. The scooter worked, he had a mobile phone  for emergencies, he had an umbrella and he went for a ‘walk’ with his dog. 
But he kept me talking. I really don’t mind talking to people. Especially if I’m in no rush. It turned out that he was incapacitated and lonely. We talked for more than one hour standing in the rain (I was standing, he was sitting on his mobility scooter). And he repeatedly invited me to his home. For a cup of coffee or tea. He showed me photo’s of his home (which actually looked lovely and well cared for) 
But I’m not a person who goes to other peoples homes without knowing them first. 
It just didn’t felt right! So I declined the offer in a friendly way (EVERY TIME). But he kept going! At a certain point he asked me if I was in a relationship. Maybe I was at fault here, but I told him that I was not in a relationship right now.  He kept going so I told him that I was a victim of domestic violence and that I don’t visit people I don’t know and certainly not men!!! And writing it down makes me think. Why did I talk to this man for so long. Why didn’t I tell him “No, I’m not interested”. I did try to leave a couple of times, but I didn’t want to be impolite. 
And he kept going. And I really do believe that this men really was lonely. It is really nice that somebody offers you to paint your apartment (for free). But it was quite intrusive. He told me that befriending him would be beneficial for me. [Do you hear the same alarm bells ringing, I do?) I was having flashbacks, my muscles tighten, I couldn’t breath, I was sweating … 
My EX always told me if I do what he wanted, everything would be alright. And it would be very good for me to listen to him, fulfill all his wishes. He told me I was always to stubborn and I didn’t know what was good for me. “NO, I appreciate the offer, but is doesn’t feel right! I will not go for a visit!” And why on earth I didn’t leave at that moment? ......
likes:
|And why on earth I didn’t leave at that moment? I am far too nice!!!!! In the end he ‘advised’ me to not listen to my fears. Because I don’t have to be afraid of him. He is lonely and I am lonely and it wasn’t good for me to be alone. 
To make it clear: I AM NOT ALLONE!! Yes, I’m alone in my apartment. Yes, I’m not dating. But I am not lonely! 
I don’t want to be manipulated into doing things I don’t want to do! 
And the only thing I learned today was, that I am for to open and for too nice to people! And that I should have left earlier! 
Writing everything down gives me chills again. 
I know loneliness is cruel. But I have the right to make my own choices! 
And looking back to this conversation only shows that this man overstepped his boundaries. If somebody tells you he or she is not comfortable with something, you should not try them to convince them otherwise. 
#domesticviolence #domesticviolenceawareness #ptsd #ptsd.awareness #empowerment

hashtags:
Fashion model Karlie Kloss was first approached by talent scouts at the age of 13 in a shopping mall in St Louis, Missouri, where she was brought up. She became famous following her first catwalk appearance for Calvin Klein in 2007, when she was 15. Since then, she has appeared on magazine covers and in advertising campaigns, as well as in numerous fashion shows.⠀
⠀
Proceeds from sales of the Karlie’s Kookies she devised are used to provide meals for children in need all over the world through the FEED Projects charity. Her Kode with Karlie scholarship programme, launched in 2015 in partnership with the Flatiron School in New York, helps teenaged girls learn to code. She also launched the Klossy YouTube channel in 2015, and began a course at New York University.⠀
⠀

hashtags:
In between passive and aggressive is assertive. 🛑stop 🛑 🤯🤯🤯 .

I guess I basically skipped right over that lesson when I was a kid. .

Oh no. Wait.  We didn’t teach our kids about social-emotional well being back then. .

And what was modeled on tv (the babysitter of the 80’s... can I get a 👊🏼 if you were a latch 🔑 kid) was full of accepted racism, homophobia and “boys will be boys” rape culture. .

Most of my life I was strong and confident with a side of aggressive.  This is not because I think I’m better than anyone (quite the contrary). .

This is how I survived. .

And, when my fire 🔥 couldn’t protect me, I would backslide into being completely passive. .

Assertive, is being able to speak my truth, and hold my boundary with a humble and kind heart.

It’s the response I’m able to find AFTER, I take a breath and get grounded. .

The old way was an automatic response. .

Assertive is a deliberate response. .

For me, this takes practice. 
It takes unpacking. 
It takes community. 
It takes dialogue. 
It takes acknowledgement. 
It takes learning. .

I hope you will join us online for this conversation. .

Personally, curating this course has delivered so many insights. And triggered some great debates. 
Can’t wait to be in our private online forum to really get in there. .
.
.
.
.

hashtags:
Ramaphabana is a farmer from Ha-Gumbu, close to Kruger National Park in northern South Africa. She decided to start farming due to poverty within her community and family. “Those who depend on my business are my three kids, mother-in-law, my husband and my stepson. In total, we are seven,” she says.

Starting with one hectare of land she has now built-up the farm to work across four hectares. “After getting four hectares of land, I realised that the workload is too much so I decided to employ workers in which six are for harvesting and three for spraying,” she explains.

On her farm, Ramaphabana grows “a variety of nine products, which are okra, onions, two types of spinach, baby marrow, green beans, green peas, gem squash and cucumber.” The photos show her and her team harvesting onions and sorting a crop of fresh, green okra.

Ramaphabana is proud of what she has achieved, “I excel in farming and there is nothing that I cannot do when it comes to farming…I’m grateful to AWOME, as it’s made me a success.” Ramaphabana is one of over 1,250 women micro-entrepreneurs who we are aiming to support through our AWOME (Accelerating Women-Owned Micro-Enterprises) programme. We’re working in partnership with @UNWomen and governments to accelerate women-owned micro-enterprises across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa. 
Link in bio to find out more.

#AWOME #standingwithwomen #HeForShe #buildingforever @debeersgroup @UNWomen
📷 Eugene Nagel @bluegroundassociates

"Uma pesquisa científica revela que o consumo de álcool está ligado a um aumento no risco de uma pessoa desenvolver 7 tipos diferentes de câncer, entre eles, o de MAMA
.
 O consumo de álcool foi responsável por cerca de 500 mil mortes por câncer em 2012, o que corresponde a cerca de 5,8% desses óbitos no mundo
.
MULHERES que consomem cerca de duas porções de álcool têm um aumento de 16% nas chances de desenvolver câncer de MAMA e morrer por conta da doença. Entre aquelas que consomem diariamente cerca de cinco doses, o risco aumenta 40%"
.
(Matéria publicada no jornal “O Globo” em 22/07/2016)

credit: @hernetworkonline... A What?... A King!👏🏾👑 | Dr. Olawale Sulaiman, 41, is a professor of neurosurgery and spinal surgery and chairman for the neurosurgery department and back and spine center at the Ochsner Neuroscience Institute in New Orleans.

He lives in Louisiana, but splits his time between the US and Nigeria, spending up to 12 days each month providing healthcare in the country of his birth -- sometimes for free.

Born in Lagos Island, Lagos, Sulaiman says his motivation comes from growing up in a relatively poor region. "I am one of 10 children born into a polygamous family. My siblings and I shared one room where we often found ourselves sleeping on a mat on the floor," he told @CNN.

Dr. Sulaiman said he negotiated a 25% pay cut with his American employer in exchange for longer holidays to Nigeria to pursue his passion. @RNZGlobal has treated more than 500 patients and provided preventative medicine to up to 5,000 people in the US and Nigeria.

Dr. Sulaiman believes that happiness doesn't come from what you get, rather, it comes from what you give.

In His Words; "There is always room to give; you don't need to be a millionaire to give."
-
Source: @CNN
#HerNetwork | @hnwoty

hashtags:
⁣
“Standing behind predators makes prey of us all.” DaShanne Stokes⁣
⁣
“Well, when she dresses like that, she’s asking for it!”⁣⁣
⁣⁣
You’re right - she IS indeed asking for it! Every single time! ⁣Guaranteed! ⁣⁣
She’s asking for it when: ⁣⁣
- she’s dressed in “revealing” clothing;⁣⁣
- she’s wearing her hair loose and bouncy, her red lipstick bright across her lips;⁣⁣
- she’s worked for years trying to make a career for herself and is in a meeting with her superior hoping for her next big break;⁣⁣
- she’s sitting at her desk, minding her own business, and gets called in to the office for a “chat”;⁣⁣
- she returns a smile to someone across the room, while sitting with friends at the bar;⁣⁣
- she owns the dance floor when she’s on it, her body one with the music; ⁣⁣
- she kisses someone after the first/second/seventh date; ⁣⁣
- she walks home alone after work;⁣⁣
- she paints her nails with a special nail polish that helps determine if her drink has been spiked;⁣⁣
- she’s home with an acquaintance / a new partner / a long-time spouse; ⁣⁣
- she walks down the street, goes to the gym, goes for a coffee, does her grocery shopping, goes to the beach, plays sport, stands still, walks fast, when she’s alone, when she’s with friends, in the morning, at night. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Every single time she is absolutely asking for it! Without fail. Guaranteed. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
What she’s asking for, though, is not what we are told! What she’s asking for are not the outcomes steeped in the rhetoric of a patriarchal and archaic system - with its outdated and misogynistic views. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Continued in comments...or through link in bio.
likes:
|(... continued 1) ⁣
⁣
What she IS asking for is to have the safety and freedom to go about her life without the threat that she will be verbally, physically, emotionally or sexually harassed and abused in some way. ⁣
⁣
She IS asking to be taken seriously for being intelligent, strong, capable and talented.⁣
⁣
She IS asking to be seen for more than her body parts, more than a sexual object, more than a thing. ⁣
⁣
She IS asking for the simple respect that should come with her being a human being. ⁣
⁣
Women have to work so hard for all these things, because they are *still* not a given. Indeed, they’re often blatantly withheld from them, violently denied and murderously extinguished. ⁣
⁣
To be clear: ⁣
⁣
Women are not asking to live their life wondering if what they’re wearing will be considered the “wrong thing” in a court of law. ⁣
⁣
They’re not asking to walk home at night tightly clutching pepper spray or fashioning car keys into weapons between their fingers. ⁣
⁣
They’re not asking to be catcalled, felt up, harassed, followed home, stalked, threatened, abused, raped, murdered. ⁣
⁣
They’re not asking to be called liars because it can take years to find the courage to call out their harasser.|(... continued 2) ⁣
⁣
Maybe it’s time we stop blaming the women of the world; as though they are to blame for not behaving in the ways that would keep them safe. Let’s stop pointing the finger at them each and every time they are harassed, raped and murdered simply for risking to walk out of their front door - and, often, not even having to do that! ⁣
⁣
Disgraced “comedian” Louis C. K. once did a stand up about how unsafe women are in the world (and should expect to be unsafe), simply for the fact that they are women. He said that it was a given that women would be harassed because they are women. And he laughed and laughed! I did not. I found it disgusting, degrading and extremely non-humorous. That’s a vile view to hold of women. ⁣
⁣
We need to continue to shine light on the system that propagates its misogynistic views and supports the violence and violations against women. ⁣
⁣

hashtags:
.
З усіма прищами
Не(фарбованими) нігтями
Милим животиком
І целюлітиком
Зимою/весною/осінню/
Літом
Кожна з нас 
Красива

Руденька/чорна/русява/сива
Маленька/середня/баскетболістка
Ніжна/залізна леді/сентименталістка
На каблуках і завжди у кедах
Цілеспрямована і та, що думками живе у небі

З усіма вибриками
Феміністичними нахилами
З усіма магнітами на холодильнику
І сотнею лахів у шафі

З макулатурою сотень квитків (бо це ж на пам‘ять)
І купою stories в інстаграмі
Не/«Робочою» стороною 
І кавою раз на тиждень (чесно, обіцяю!) З погодою Лондона десь в голові
З нахилами садиста власного мозку
З накрученими думками, бо ж хоч вбий,
Просто всі речі на світі існують не просто

Любіть.
Бажайте.
І нами живіть.
.
(і час від часу щось нам говоріть)
.

hashtags:
Edgar Ramirez made a speech at the University of Waterloo in Ontario, Canada. He spoke about how the social norms that define masculinity are destructive for men, women and societies as a whole. By making the philosophical question, "what does it mean to be human?", he said that even though it is our feelings that make us human, the expression of feelings is often discouraged by society, particularly for men and boys. The consequences are a burden for everyone and an impediment to gender equality, stating, "In the journey for equality, women and men are like two strands of DNA wrapped together in an embrace. Our burdens are as intertwined as our common destiny. The constraints that burden me will eventually burden you.  And the same is true in reverse: as long as you are burdened, I am too. By recognizing this inter-dependence, I can work for your well-being and know that I am also working towards my own. I can know that whatever action I take to free you, also frees me. This is not just what makes us human. This is what makes us a human family".
.
"#TBT #HeForShe #UniversityGetFreeTour with our incredible @UN @unicef #GoodwillAmbassador @edgarramirez25 😀".
(Thanks to @enyamayaro for sharing).
.

hashtags:
Marriage is heavy.
✨
My husband and I dated for 10 years but we were clueless as to what we promised to carry when we married 18 years ago. We were kids with rose colored glasses and nothing in our pockets. And, we believed that it was us against the world.
✨
I was fresh out of medical school and my husband had launched his business. Little by little, we carried the weight of being adults by slowly dividing and conquering our responsibilities: the bills and our chores. We bought our first home and wove our lives together.
✨
Nothing weighed more on our marriage than the work of having children. Fortunately, my husband was hands on: feeding the baby and changing diapers in the middle of night so that I could sleep longer. From the start, he cared for them solo on the weekends, did the chores and cooked.
✨
When I’m off, I made sure to lighten his load whenever I could. And as for any hardships inside or outside of our marriage, we tackled them together. But we kept it real too. To prevent us or our marriage from sinking, we also offloaded weight. Besides communicating, being patient and sacrificing, we knew when to ask for help.
✨
Looking back at our 28 years together, our relationship has never been about my happiness or his. It was always ours. We cultivate our marriage by filling our #marriagebox with: so much love, encouragement, appreciation, gratitude, respect, time for each other and ourselves, and generous forgiveness.
✨
Someday when our kids are grown up and it’s just the two of us again, we could feel that we were a team. We each carried the weight and offloaded when we needed to. More importantly, the more we gave the better we became.
✨
Thank you drsarahkiani for inviting me to join the #marriagebox conversation.
✨
What do you put into your marriage box?

hashtags:
We Stan!
Celebrating #BlackHistoryMonth

@Regrann from @hernetworkonline - A What?... A King!👏🏾👑 | Dr. Olawale Sulaiman, 41, is a professor of neurosurgery and spinal surgery and chairman for the neurosurgery department and back and spine center at the Ochsner Neuroscience Institute in New Orleans.

He lives in Louisiana, but splits his time between the US and Nigeria, spending up to 12 days each month providing healthcare in the country of his birth -- sometimes for free.

Born in Lagos Island, Lagos, Sulaiman says his motivation comes from growing up in a relatively poor region. "I am one of 10 children born into a polygamous family. My siblings and I shared one room where we often found ourselves sleeping on a mat on the floor," he told @CNN.

Dr. Sulaiman said he negotiated a 25% pay cut with his American employer in exchange for longer holidays to Nigeria to pursue his passion. @RNZGlobal has treated more than 500 patients and provided preventative medicine to up to 5,000 people in the US and Nigeria.

Dr. Sulaiman believes that happiness doesn't come from what you get, rather, it comes from what you give.

In His Words; "There is always room to give; you don't need to be a millionaire to give."
-
Source: @CNN
#HerNetwork | @hnwoty
-
#inspirationdaily #impactlives #dailyinspiration #healthcare #cnn #neurosurgery #touchinglives #inspiredbyhim #heforshe #hero

hashtags:
Approximately 8 out of 10 sexual assaults are committed by someone known to the victim. A friend, a family member or even your partner!

No partner in a relationship has the right to have sex! It is something freely given because of love or any other reason YOU are totally fine with (I really won’t judge here). If you are AFRAID, it doesn’t FEEL good, you have PAIN, … SAY NO! If he or she doesn’t stop,  it’s rape!

Victims often blame themselves for behaving in a way that encouraged the perpetrator. It’s important to remember that the victim is a never to blame for the actions of a perpetrator.

Perpetrators may use, next to physical force, emotional coercion, psychological force, or manipulation to force a victim into non-consensual sex.  One of the things my ex did, was to force me to stay awake, until he got what he wanted. Sometimes they can be very creative to achieve their goal.

If you are in this kind of a situation, please seek help. Your doctor, a family member, a counselor at work, call an anonymous help line, the police … there are so much options.

I also want to encourage MEN to seek help. I am a woman and I want to help woman, but I won’t look away. There is also (sexual) violence against men, so if you are a man, SPEAK UP! You shouldn’t feel ashamed, or feel a lesser man because of it. Don’t give up!

Happy Birthday President Carter!🎈
•
Yesterday Jimmy Carter became the first U.S. president to reach his 95th birthday, and to celebrate, we're looking back at his 2014 Women in the World Summit appearance.
•
The former president talked with @katiecouric about the importance of electing women in public office, saying, 'When women do actively seek public office and gain it, they transform their governments because they have an overwhelmingly greater commitment to peace and to justice and understanding.'
•
'I think we will have a woman president in my lifetime,' he went on to say, so roll on 2020...
•
Watch the interview via the video link in bio 🎥 @womenintheworld •

Meghan, Duchess of Sussex is suing the publisher of the Mail on Sunday for publishing a private and handwritten letter she sent to her estranged father, The Guardian reports.
.
In a strongly worded statement issued on the Duke and Duchess of Sussex’s official website Tuesday, Prince Harry lambasted the British tabloid press for its treatment of his wife, saying she had been the victim of ‘relentless propaganda.’
.
‘For these select media this is a game, and one that we have been unwilling to play from the start. I have been a silent witness to her private suffering for too long. To stand back and do nothing would be contrary to everything we believe in.’
.
Referring to the legal action, the Duke said, ‘Though this action may not be the safe one, it is the right one. Because my deepest fear is history repeating itself. I’ve seen what happens when someone I love is commoditized to the point that they are no longer treated or seen as a real person. I lost my mother and now I watch my wife falling victim to the same powerful forces.’
.
Photo: Reuters/Dominic Lipinski

・・・
Happy Birthday President Carter!🎈
•
Today Jimmy Carter became the first U.S. president to reach his 95th birthday, and to celebrate, we're looking back at his 2014 Women in the World Summit appearance.
•
The former president talked with @katiecouric about the importance of electing women in public office, saying, 'When women do actively seek public office and gain it, they transform their governments because they have an overwhelmingly greater commitment to peace and to justice and understanding.'
•
'I think we will have a woman president in my lifetime,' he went on to say, so roll on 2020...
•
Watch the interview via the video link in bio 🎥
•
#WITW #womeningovernment #PresidentCarter #39thpresident #JimmyCarter #katiecouric #heforshe

hashtags:
Lucy Bronze is an English footballer who plays as a right-back for French club Olympique Lyonnais and the England national team.

Bronze represented England at all youth levels before featuring in the full national squad at Euro 2013. She played in the 2015 World Cup, helping England to third place, and the 2019 World Cup in which they finished fourth. She has won the PFA Women's Players' Player of the Year award twice – in 2014,and again in 2017. In 2018, she was named BBC Women's Footballer of the Year. In 2019, she became the first English footballer to win the UEFA Women's Player of the Year Award. Bronze is widely regarded as the world's greatest right-back.
