Ja, den riktar sig till dig! 🙂 Alla med intresse för idrott och jämställdhet är varmt välkomna!

Kontakta Thomas.gehoor@vgidrott.se för mer info och anmälan. Vi undersöker gärna möjligheten att finansiera helgen för dig. 🙂

Vi har bokat hotellrum, måltider och konferenslokaler på Hotel Arken, Hisingen i Göteborg.

Program
Torsdag 24 oktober kl. 18.00 – 20.30
Charlotte Ovefelt - IF Brommapojkarna fotboll, BP, har som enda idrottsförening i Sverige fått statsbidrag från jämställdhetsmyndigheten för att arbeta med jämställdhetsprojekt under 2019.

Charlotte Ovefelt är anställd Jämställdhetsstrateg i fotbolls-Europas största barn- och ungdomsförening. Hon kommer att måla upp en bild av hur varje förening kan ta sitt ansvar i jämställdhetsfrågan, med konkreta exempel.

Fredag 25 oktober kl. 08.00-09.00 (Frukost 07:30)
Ida Lindgren - Judo5-konceptet. Det startade som ett strategiskt jämställdhetsarbete i en Judoförening och har nu, 5 år senare växt till ett prisbelönt koncept för jämställdhetsintegrering, applicerbart på alla idrotter. Ida Lindgren, svensk mästarinna, engagerad i RF:s etiska råd och med en lång rad erfarenhet av hållbarhetsarbete föreläser.

Fredag 25 oktober kl. 17.30 – 20.00
Utveckla arbetet med jämställdhetsintegreringen i din förening. Charlotte Axelsson är handledare i Försvarsmaktens utbildningskoncept i Jämställdhet, Genus och Ledarskap (JGL). Hon har även många års erfarenhet av jämställdhetsintegrerande ledarskap inom idrotts-rörelsen.

Lördag 26 oktober 9.00-12.30
Utbildarutbildning med Dino Ilecic: In- or outside the box

Dino har sin bakgrund inom tennisen och har ett stort intresse för idrottens roll i samhället. Dino har utformat vår egen utbildning ”In or outside the box” och håller under förmiddagen en utbildarutbildning i materialet.

Lördag 26 oktober 13.00-14.30
Föreläsning efter lunch: Peter Rung (tidigare Svensson) - FN:s jämställdhetsenhet UN Women. Peter föreläser om jämställdhetsarbete i koppling till idrott. Få kunskap om hashtagen #heforshe och konceptet ”Ta snacket” som används inom idrottsrörelsen.

hashtags:
😳How many of us heard this as a child? Maybe even said it?

For me, it was in elementary school. A boy in my class would chase me, push me, tease me, and eventually pulled down my underwear in front of everyone while i was on the monkey bars. But each time it happened, and each time it escalated, I was met with the same rationalization by the teachers, “Just ignore him! He only acts that way to you because he likes you.” or “He’s just being a silly boy.” What were the ripple effects of hearing this as a child from a person of authority - a FEMALE teacher - whom I adored and still consider one of my best and favorite teachers?

In the immediate, I never even told my parents*. Even though it FELT BAD in my body, I was told it was ok, normal even. So, for the first time of many, I learned to ignore the message my body was sending and that I made a big deal of things that were not a big deal. (“Don’t be so dramatic” - another favorite #micro-aggression I’ll hear a lot). In the long term, I learned to equate an uneasy feeling in my stomach with love - making it hard to separate those amazing new love butterflies with actual warning signs. 
I learned that boys/men don’t need to listen to our boundaries and that’s just “how they are.” I learned that if I wanted attention from boys (which I did) that it could feel gross but that was a good sign.

And what did that boy learn? What had he been told and modeled to behave like that? Looking back, I’m not sure my teacher was “wrong” - I do think he wanted my attention but why was no one teaching others way to get it and boundaries to respect even if he didn’t?

And what happened to my teacher to think the best advice she could give just to ignore and accept behaviors from men that you don’t like?

These are the tough but important conversations that @manifestingmofo and I will be facilitating in our online class SHE PERSISTED through @offthemat By acknowledging these #microaggressions we can create #microhealing and not only feel and do better for ourselves - but have the vocab and resources to model and teach better behavior to our children. We deserve this, our kids deserve this! 🤞Link in bio to register.

hashtags:
Färdig med utbildning av Peab yrkesskola i ämnet jämställdhet och #heforshe
Vi berörde även ämnet härskarteknik som ofta kan kopplas till att just trycka ner andra människor pga kön eller tillhörighet. 
Det slår mig att jag just härskarteknik är en oerhört viktig del och kan få människor att må riktigt dåligt. Speciellt när man blir utsatt av någon som betyder mycket. Tex en kollega, familjemedlem eller en vän. 
Ofta vet de inte om att de använder den, men i mina ögon är detta även under rubriken vuxenmobbning. 
Har du råkat ut för något av följande:
1. Att göra dig osynlig
2. Förlöjligande av dig som person
3. Undanhållande av information
4. Dubbelbestraffning
5. Plantera skuld och skam för att du själv ska ta på dig skulden, men inte vet vad du gjort.

Då är du utsatt för härskarteknik. Man kan såklart agera mot detta genom att synliggöra, fråga personen som utsätter dig och söka stöd. Ett ämne som är oerhört intressant då jag själv utsatts för härskarteknik och vuxenmobbning, men det har också gett mig egna upplevda kunskaper som jag inte hade tidigare 🙏🏻
Hoppas jag också levererade en dos kärlek och respekt 🧡 För att just respektera varandra och våra olikheter är nyckeln till ett tryggare samhälle där alla skulle må så mycket bättre 💪🏼
Lämnar Stockholm för färd mot Hedviksfors! Glöm inte att du är bäst ❤️🙌🏼
#härskarteknik #heforshe #jämställdhet #likavärde #kärlekochrespekt #tahandomvarandra

Lebogang is a 28-year-old single mother of two. She worked in a salon in earlier years and has a major passion for fashion and beauty, which motivated her to start her own business, LBeauty Salon.

Lebogang is a lively person and believes in looking good. She loves style, which is why these photos look like a fashion shoot. She loved working with the camera. Her favourite parts of her business are Afro hair treatments and interacting with clients. She’s very popular and had five regular clients popping in whilst we were filming. In some of the images you can see her having lengthy conversations with them.

She takes training very seriously and has exceeded all her trainer’s expectations. “With AWOME, I learnt record keeping, costing, how to manage my business and keeping my sleep. AWOME made a huge difference because now my salon is operating well, the marketing is so good and I’m on social media.” She has a great relationship with her trainer Kgotlelelo, (‘Gotle’). In the images, they are going through her paperwork, her new products and her own LBeauty Oil, which she’s developed and manufactured herself. She has big plans for LBeauty. "In five years time I want to have a big factory, employing youth like me, with big machines. Right now, I’m manufacturing at home,” she says.

Lebogang is one of over 1,250 women micro-entrepreneurs who we are aiming to support through our AWOME (Accelerating Women-Owned Micro-Enterprises) programme. We’re working in partnership with @UNWomen and governments to accelerate women-owned micro-enterprises across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa.

Link in bio to find out more.

#AWOME #standingwithwomen #HeForShe #buildingforever @debeersgroup @UNWomen
📷 Eugene Nagel @bluegroundassociates

hashtags:
Dear Emma Watson,

My first introduction to you was like everyone else's, in the role of Hermione. I'd loved her in the books, but oh it was you who brought her to life. And the reason you were so perfect was because you had a bit of Hermione in you. And I had a bit of Hermione in me. It was meant to be.

And when I grew up, and you did too, when life became more than Harry Potter, I saw how real you were. You graduated, started to do other movies and involved yourself in various movements. Whether it was the falling in love with your captive Belle, or the terrified and mistreated Angela, or the bold and confident Nicki, you were nailing it all, and I was a fan. 
But then the exact moment when I realized how inspiring you were was when I saw you campaigning for women and children rights. You started the HeForShe movement and explained how all genders are suffering in some way or other and all need to break from these social constructs. It's been five years now since that started. Your speech in the UN still gives me goosebumps. Your work is making a change and inspires so many each day, every day to work for a better cause.

You came from a position of privilege, and you were able to look past that. You saw what others rarely see and you did something about it. You continue to do something about it. In my opinion, that is the best anyone can do. 
Hermione would be so proud.

Yours,
A HeForShe
.

Last night, the adventure continued for them with an exclusive event: Girleek meets Proximus SpearIT ⌘

During the event, about 20 registrants had the opportunity to discover more about the company’s culture, their different job offers and even had a first job interview! A unique occasion to get a job in the field of technology!

But the adventure does not end here. Friday morning will be the second part of the event. This time, it will be not far from 30 registrants who will meet us and the SpearIT team!

Our best wishes to them!

I, alongside what is seemingly one in 5 women, have PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome). My bastard little ovaries are ganging up on me. It’s somewhat a pain in the arse, given that the advisory lifestyle changes include avoiding wine and potatoes (two of my most stable food groups), but a real relief that I finally have an answer to my questions. Earlier this year, I started noticing some changes. I was putting on weight for no apparent reason, I had severe bloating that nothing would shift, my skin was oily and I was breaking out constantly. I’ve always been quite a hairy person, but the level of thick dark hairs on my body started to creep up and then, finally, my periods decided they had better things to do than pay me regular visits. After multiple pregnancy panics I was finally referred for a scan. The next day, they confirmed my diagnosis... (read the remainder of this week’s Tuesday update using the link in the bio now!) 💋 #WomanOnTop #PCOS

If you wanna vent you know where I am lol x|#Female #FeminismTag #Inspo #Feminism #Feminist #Blog #Blogger #UkBlogger #SexBlogger #Follow #WomensRights #Empowerment #SexPositive #YesAllWomen #GirlBoss #GirlPower #HeForShe #IntersectionalFeminist #Confidence #Equality #BodyPositive #FeministKilljoy #WomenSupportingWomen #FeministAF #NastyWoman #InstaBlogger #Polycysticovarysyndrome|I have it too!! 😭♥️|I have it too my lovely Angle 📐and I LOVE potato in ALL forms! ❤️|I’ve had the pleasure of PCOS, endometriosis and now adenomyosis for 25 years. @sydney_uni_business_school This year marks the 5th anniversary of the #HeForShe movement. What began in 2014 as a pathway for men to commit their support for women’s rights and gender equality has now become so much more. Five years on, the #HeForShe movement has become a platform for everyone, regardless of gender to stand in solidarity for a world where we all have equal rights and opportunities. For men, women and gender diverse people to commit to transforming words into actions and accelerating gender equality in their everyday lives. Today we are proud to stand in solidarity with @unwomenaust and the world’s women and girls as we make the commitment to strive for a gender equal world. Will you join us? Go to unwomen.org.au to make the commitment today.

hashtags:
Dear Ohio,⁣
⁣
I didn’t forget about you!  I’ve just been super tired after getting back into the mountains. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
It was a quick tour, thank you for the tail wind!  And the hospitality!  I actually have roots in your great state and a cousin, one removed that I’ve never met came to see me ride through. Thank you, Deb & John Raddish (@debraddish) for making the effort to meet us... and thank you for lunch!! I find it so cool that you live in my great grandmothers home!  I hope to see that house some day. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
It was also really great to see our friend and fellow Everest summiteer, Kara Stinson (@kstinso). Great to see you and reminisce about the climb. Your little slice of heaven on Lake Erie and a home cooked meal was a treat. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
It was pretty cool to see people surfing Lake Erie as we road through Cleveland and onto the East. The terrain started rolling as soon as we got out of Cleveland. I’ll have to come back to see more of you, particularly Akron, where my great grandma lived and I still have family!⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
#TriForEquality #ClimbForEquality #UltimateWorldTri #heforshe

Today is former President Jimmy Carter's 95th birthday! 🎉 Keep reading to find out why he believes it's imperative to elect women into leadership positions... ⤵️
.
 #Repost @womenintheworld ・・・
Happy Birthday President Carter!🎈
•
Today Jimmy Carter became the first U.S. president to reach his 95th birthday, and to celebrate, we're looking back at his 2014 Women in the World Summit appearance.
•
The former president talked with @katiecouric about the importance of electing women in public office, saying, 'When women do actively seek public office and gain it, they transform their governments because they have an overwhelmingly greater commitment to peace and to justice and understanding.'
•
'I think we will have a woman president in my lifetime,' he went on to say, so roll on 2020...
•
Watch the interview via the video link in @womenintheworld 's bio 🎥
•

hashtags: Esses da foto são Marco, Gabriel e Victor, três dos coordenadores do HOMINE, um grupo de reflexão sobre Masculinidades. Nosso grupo foi criado em Março de 2019, com o objetivo pensar e dialogar sobre experiências e reflexões que falem sobre masculinidades. Entendemos que a masculinidade, no singular, vem sendo pautada como uma ideia muito restrita. É o que hoje chamamos de masculinidade tóxica. Essa noção única de homens viris, fortes, poderosos, agressivos, racionais e insensíveis é a grande razão da violência e desigualdade de gênero. E é aí que entra nosso papel... e se pudéssemos pensar outras maneiras de ser homens e nos relacionarmos com nós mesmos? Que tipo de relações seriam construídas com mulheres? Quais outras possibilidades de paternidade poderiam ser pensadas? São esses alguns pontos de debate que conduzem nossos encontros, às terças, de 18h às 19h, na Unicamp. Happy Birthday President Carter!🎈
•
Today Jimmy Carter became the first U.S. president to reach his 95th birthday, and to celebrate, we're looking back at his 2014 Women in the World Summit appearance.
•
The former president talked with @katiecouric about the importance of electing women in public office, saying, 'When women do actively seek public office and gain it, they transform their governments because they have an overwhelmingly greater commitment to peace and to justice and understanding.'
•
'I think we will have a woman president in my lifetime,' he went on to say, so roll on 2020...
•
Watch the interview via the video link in bio 🎥
•

Throwback post from 2018! Posted @withrepost • @patmacrn #Sponsored by @allheartscrubs As Breast Cancer Awareness (BCA) month commences, I can’t help but think about all of the women in my life. One in particular, my aunt Bessie, stands out, because she was BCA warrior for over 20 years. ⁣
⁣
I call her a warrior because she was more than just a survivor, she had breast cancer and thrived. In many ways, BCA has been a staple feminists movement. It gave women a voice and made men listen and care. ⁣
⁣
It made talking about a woman’s body, from a health standpoint, less taboo. BCA paved the way for women to talk about other issues that impacted them, such as mental health, abuse, and other topics. BCA shows that women around the world are stronger than we’ve ever imagined. BCA shows us the warrior inside mothers, sisters, aunts, daughters, and cousins. ⁣
⁣
Typically, in epidemiology, mortality rates are presented, showing how many people die in x time-period from a particular disease process or illness. Rather than highlighting that over 41,000 are expected to die from breast cancer, this year. Let’s highlight the fact that every day, millions around the survive to see another day! Thank you to @allheartscrubs for the #BCA gear from 2018! ⁣
⁣

hashtags:
Difícil não é matar um leão por dia.. difícil é desviar das antas!

Já ouviu essa frase?

Metáforas e analogias são recursos terapêuticos usados para entrarmos em contato com assuntos difíceis.

Ouvi a frase há anos atrás e vira e mexe ela aparece na minha cabeça.

Você sabe identificar seus leões e suas antas? Rsss

Parece uma pergunta boba, mas ela pode nos ajudar a entender porque nos comportamos de determinada maneira, porque tomamos algumas atitudes e porque mantemos alguns atos.

Autoconhecimento é a melhor ferramenta para viver uma vida que valha a pena ser vivida.

Bora lá trabalhar isso em terapia?

Tamo junto!

hashtags:
British actor Emma Watson was appointed UN Women Goodwill Ambassador in 2014 and since then she has dedicated her efforts towards the empowerment of young women by serving as an advocate for UN Women’s #HeForShe campaign and most recently supporting #SDG5 in promoting gender equality.

#QuoteOfTheDay  #emmawatson #emmawatsonquotes #believe #motivationalquotes #motivation #successquotes #success #positivequotes #powerfulquotes #sdgsinmiami #sdgs2030 #UN #humanrights #2030agenda #justice #genderequality #GenerationEquality #genderstereotypes #womenempowerment #womenup

First I want to tell you: I’m NOT a therapist. So if you know better, I will change the graphic.

My goal was to visualize the circle. It is well known that depression affects motivation. And without motivation you can’t take steps out of the situation. So the situation keeps the same, you get more frustrated, afraid etc.  Eventually you get even more depressed. And the circle starts over and over again.

The solution is to break the circle (I know, it’s fare more easy to write it down than to eventually do it)

You need to be good to yourself. That way you will get more energy. With the extra energy you will be able to do more. You will gain moments of success. That will give you a good feeling and you will be less depressed.

Hopefully your downwards spiral turns into an upwards spiral. But note: sometimes you take two steps forwards and the next day is one step backwards. And that is OKAY! You don’t need to be perfect. Go your own pace. Just keep going. By changing nothing, the situation won’t change.

You can do it!

I challenge you to do one thing  for yourself this week. It can be as simple as using a face mask, or playing your favorite song 10 times in a row. But it needs to be something you normally don’t do for yourself

In my case I started, to wear my earrings every single day!!! #domesticviolence #domesticviolenceawareness #ptsd

hashtags:
Please comment below how long is parental leave in your country for men and for women? 🤗👇🏼🤗👇🏼 Share if you liked it!⁣
⁣
🇬🇧Today is a big day. I start working after a 7 months period of parental leave. When I wrote this I was sitting on a train on the way to the office. I had the feeling that I was leaving my kids behind (similar feeling when I left Franki at the kindergarten for first time). However, it also felt like a big relief, like I was going on vacations. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I understand that this is part of life but it still makes me sad to think that from now on I will see my children only from 6pm to 9pm and it is a shitty anxious feeling. I guess every parent has gone through this stage.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I am bit anxious to know how my life will look like in the near future. Typically, everything gets automatically sorted out after taking well-enough decisions. But as a person with a chess mentality I need to plan everything months in advance and I trully have no idea how to do it.⁣
⁣⁣⁣
One thing that people probably do not acknowledge is the fact that we, as men, have it easier. And please continue reading, this is not some ideology stuff that I want to force you to believe. It is the fact that while women are still considered as the children’s main caretaker, they will not be treated equally in the work market. They might not be hired at their 30s because of the risk for the company of a person taking a maternity leave.⁣⁣ They might lose their job positions or they will get paid less because they are assumed to be less efficient because they have kids to take care of. And other items in a huge list of fake biases. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
If men would take the same amount of parental leave days than woman, then the companies would not be biased by the maternity factor (provided that the society also supports this idea). This is one clear example on how providing benefits to men can also lead to gender equality.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#parenting #parentalleave #paternityleave #genderequality #equality #heforshe

hashtags:
-
You are the one that should decide how your life is going to be. You don't have to live up to everyone's expectations, because you can't please them all. 
There's not right or wrong, good or bad, beautiful or ugly, normal or not. These are subjective and what matters is what feels real to you!! You define who you can and will be.
Choose your path not only with wisdom but also enthusiasm, live with regrets or not but remember that you can change. You can change yourself when you want to. It's never late to start over. As long as your actions seem bad to you, you can see your life from another perspective and get a chance to become a better version of yourself. People change.
You can be whoever you want to be, do the job you like, dress the way you want to, do what expresses you. If your choices make you happy, then nothing can take that away from you, it'll always come back or you should go and get it.
There are plenty of difficult parts in life and you shouldn't be careless. However, if you love yourself and acknowledge that you are not who others want you to be, that it is YOUR life and it's not going to last forever, I think that it will be much easier and more beautiful. You are enough just the way you are. ❤
@emmawatson #emmawatson

Ava DuVernay is a film writer, producer, director and distributor. Her 2014 film Selma, about Martin Luther King’s 1965 campaign to secure equal voting rights by marching from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama, was nominated for the 2015 Academy Award (Oscar) for Best Picture. Her previous film, Middle of Nowhere, won the 2012 Sundance Film Festival Best Director Award.⠀
⠀
She graduated from the University of California, Los Angeles with a double major in English and African American studies, and then worked as a film publicist. Her award-winning distribution company ARRAY has undertaken more than 120 film and television campaigns for various acclaimed directors. It focuses on films made by people of colour and by women.⠀

hashtags:
MARITAL RAPE •

Sejak tweet saya dua hari lalu mengenai pemerkosaan dalam rumah tangga (marital rape), banyak reply yang tak beradab dan begitu kasar. Banyak netizen yang mungkin shock dan tak habis pikir dengan reply itu. •

Saya pribadi sudah kenyang dengan serangan personal & cenderung tidak peduli. Yang menyeramkan adalah kenyataan bahwa banyak orang yang tidak memahami definisi perkosaan dan menganggap perkosaan dalam rumah tangga itu tidak ada atau menganggap itu sebagai sesuatu yahg baik-baik saja. •

Padahal, banyak sekali perempuan yang sedang hamil, baru melahirkan, atau sedang haid yang menjadi korban pemaksaan seperti ini. Bahkan ada yang akhirnya meninggal dunia. Mereka abai & cenderung tak mau mendengar kisah para korban. •

Itulah kenapa kita harus mendukung disahkannya RUU Penghapusan Kekerasan Seksual (PKS). Dibanding kaget terhadap serangan personal kepada saya, lebih baik kita kaget terhadap fakta bahwa DPR periode 2014-2019 gagal mengesahkan RUU-PKS untuk melindungi korban kekerasan seksual. • 
Ini harus menjadi salah satu fokus utama kita. Selamat dilantik Bapak/Ibu anggota DPR RI periode 2019-2024, kami akan kawal!

hashtags:
So I’m not going to get into the politics of the situation but simply speak on the issue at hand because I don’t want this to degenerate into some partisan bullshit.

When women say things like “men are trash” “men are pigs” “we’re not safe around men alone” etc. if you get offended or feel like that doesn’t apply to you because you’re not trash or a rapist, good for you, gold star for being a normal fucking human being.

Now when you feel the need to defend yourself and those like you when a woman or anyone for that matter starts a discussion like this, take a deep breath, think carefully about what you want to say in terms of “there’s good guys out there” “not all men” or whatever and then.....jus don’t say it.

All you’re doing is saying that your fragile little ego is more important to you than someone else’s experience. As in what they’ve gone through. As in they’re speaking on something that happened to them. 
We live in a society where I personally do not know a single woman that has not been the victim of sexual assault on some level or another. Not. Fucking. One.

So when you feel the need to steer the discussion away from the issue at hand and towards how it doesn’t apply to you personally guess what? You’re perpetuating the very problem you’re “not a part of” by saying that your feelings are more important than the problem itself. You’re saying it’s not as bad as they think, you’re telling them to relax when they shouldn’t, you’re saying that your own myopic fucking view is more accurate than their experience. Bottom line, you’re being a Fucking asshole.

The first step in solving a problem is acknowledging that it exists. Wanna be one of the good ones. Start by acknowledging the fucking problem and putting it before your fragile fucking ego. 
In olden times when cartographers would draw up maps they’d fill in everywhere that was charted and along the borders where no one had gone yet they’d just write “there be monsters here” as a justification as to why no one had gone there. Well here we are now with the whole world charted and to day we might as well just write that all over the fucking map because I don’t honestly have a better explanation.

hashtags:
Female Leads: Roya Mahboob, the first female tech entrepreneur in Afghanistan, where women rarely work outside the home. Roya is working for women’s education and empowerment by providing access via social media and the internet.⠀
⠀
Roya Mahboob was born in 1987 in Iran, where her family was exiled during the Soviet occupation of Afghanistan and the subsequent Taliban takeover which precipitated the destruction of girls’ schools across the country. Her family finally returned to Afghanistan in 2003, and Roya went on to gain a computer science degree from Herat University. In 2010 she co-founded a software company, Afghan Citadel, which won contracts with private companies, government ministries and NATO.⠀
⠀
She also co-founded Women’s Annex Foundation (now Digital Citizen Fund), a non-profit organisation that seeks to increase digital literacy by the establishment of computer labs where women and girls learn to use social media and produce content for which they are paid. In 2013, beset with death threats, Roya was forced to move to America on an expedited visa. She has since formed a new company, EdyEdy, an online learning platform.⠀
⠀

Premiering this Wednesday!
 Monique and I speak about the mindset she needed to overcome poverty and struggle in her life and the journey that lead to becoming a mental health advocate and authoring 6 books! Monique speaks openly about how mentorship and seeking guidance transformed her life and helped her to pivot from Economics to ultimately finding her true passion.

Our conversation gets really deep when we dive into her latest research turned book that speaks to the nexus between mental health, culture and gender based violence. Trust me, she goes very deep here and you’ll receive a lot of insight from her work.

During the 2010 football World Cup in South Africa, the vuvuzela - a long, colourful plastic trumpet - gained international fame for the way it filled stadiums with a loud, buzzing sound of fan support.
•
Nearly a decade later, the instrument has taken on a new purpose in a country rife with violent crime. It is being used to alert women in Soweto, the country's largest township, that their local patrol group is ready to safely escort them to public transport.
•
"I wake up feeling safe when I hear the vuvuzela outside," said Zanele Thusi, a domestic worker, walking towards the train station at 4.30am for her hour-long journey to the Johannesburg suburb of Bosmont.
•
"We could not walk safely in the streets before these patrollers. We would have our cell phones stolen, we would hear of stabbings and daily incidences of crime," Thusi said.
•
South Africa has been making headlines recently as its citizens have taken to the streets to protest the lack of public safety, especially for women, who are frequently murdered, kidnapped and raped, according to women's rights groups.
•
About 3,000 women in South Africa were murdered in 2018 - or one every three hours - which is more than five times higher than the global average, according to the World Health Organization.
•
The patrollers, who said there are thousands of them working in groups ranging from three to 15 members across Soweto, meet women at their homes to walk them to their train or bus station, blowing their vuvuzelas to announce their arrival.
•
Some carry golf clubs, tasers, batons and whips for added protection.
•
"I wish we lived in a society where women were able to walk freely in the streets," said Khanyile, founder of Johannesburg rights group Rise Up Against Gender-based Violence.
•
"But in the absence of this, (the patrols are) an awesome, meaningful, tangible move by men who are taking responsibility for the scourge of gender-based violence in South Africa," she said in a phone interview.
•
Photo + Reporting: Thomson Reuters Foundation/Kim Harrisberg

And after years of abuse, being yourself is quite a challenge. I did not know who I was anymore.

If you asked me for my favorite color, I respondent to the question by saying his favorite color and not mine.

It is PURPLE!!!! Being able to say it now, has such an impact on me. Being able so say purple, for me this is freedom. Discover who you are is another big part of the journey you have to take on.

To become acquainted with yourself again is not always that easy. But you will learn a lot about yourself.

This October 4th will be the fourth year that red dresses have hung from the trees in Centennial Park in remembrance of the Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women, Girls, Trans and Two-Spirits. The REDdress Project which is now a nation-wide expression of grief, outrage and loss, was created in 2014 by Jaime Black, a Metis multi-disciplinary artist. As poignant as it is powerful, Black’s installation art project: red dresses and garments hung in wild and public spaces, has become a national action to evoke the memory and honour the humanity of our stolen sisters. 
The REDdress project is a simple but profound way to honour the humanity and the memory of Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women, Girls, Trans and Two Spirits. 
This year take a moment on October 4th to witness these silent representations of lives lost to violence in the intersection of colonialism, racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia and classism. People are invited to bring red dresses or garments to hang in Centennial Park between 8am and 9am on Friday October 4th, or to hang a dress in their driveways or work place. The dresses will be up all day. There will be a vigil at 4:30pm in Centennial Park to honour our stolen sisters.

As with all companies, we also practise FIFO. We don’t usually have to keep our stocks for too long because you guys are amazing supporters 😘 Even in HQ, they usually go Out of Stock (OOS) and for some instances, open for pre-orders while waiting for the factory to run production.

So what is FIFO? First In First Out. Why does it matter to you? Because we assure you, even the ones you’re getting are fresh batches and is best consumed within 2 years (as printed). As HQ does not ship directly to Brunei, we agents have to stock up so that we can deliver them directly to you (as opposed to how they do it in Malaysia, Singapore and Indonesia). An ‘extra’ hassle for us, yes. But for me personally, I actually enjoy delivering them directly to you to show honesty and our commitment to help.

Have we been helping you with your issues? Thank you for trusting us all these while and we appreciate all our customers the same 😘

Whatsapp 8969-990 to get your Jamu restocked for the month 🥰

📣💁‍♀️✨💪 Oggi diamo un caloroso benvenuto a Eleonora, nuova aggiunta del nostro team!
Eleonora ha deciso di collaborare da Modena e ci aiuterà a riflettere sul tema della violenza di genere.
Ecco perché ha deciso di unirsi a noi! 👉 [English in the comments] .
🇮🇹 Fin da piccola i miei modelli di riferimento nel mondo dei cartoni e serie tv erano abbastanza alternativi rispetto alle tipiche principesse. Adoravo Fantaghirò, Xena, Mulan e Buffy. L’aspetto in comune di queste figure femminili è che sapevano cavarsela da sole, si ribellavano alle convenzioni e lottavano per la libertà. Le ammiravo e avrei voluto essere come loro. Perciò pur non avendo mai combattuto contro vampiri o barbari, ho “combattuto” per sconfiggere certi stereotipi e pregiudizi, soprattutto riguardanti la violenza di genere. Infatti, questo argomento mi ha sempre colpito tanto. Ho iniziato a conoscere meglio gli aspetti che riguardano la violenza di genere grazie al tirocinio presso la Casa delle donne contro la violenza di Modena, durante gli studi alla triennale di Psicologia di Parma. Grazie a questa esperienza e ai racconti delle donne che venivano in struttura ho potuto capire le loro difficoltà ad uscire da una relazione con una persona violenta. Inoltre, ho approfondito, nella mia tesi, l’aspetto, spesso sottovalutato, delle conseguenze che la violenza assistita provoca sui figli. Successivamente, durante gli studi presso l’Università di Psicologia scolastica e di comunità, ho indagato maggiormente gli aspetti riguardanti le rappresentazioni della violenza di genere nei giovani. Rendendomi sempre più conto che, è proprio sulle rappresentazioni e sul linguaggio che si usa, che bisogna lavorare per prevenire questo fenomeno nelle nuove generazioni. Ed è per questo motivo che ho deciso di partecipare al progetto di “Beyond what they sell – oltre ciò che vendono” per dare nel mio piccolo un contributo al cambiamento.
.
Se anche tu vuoi collaborare con noi, non importa dove vivi,
contattaci! Non vediamo l'ora di condividere nuove idee! ✨✌️💪🔥
.
.
#sisterhood #empowerment #womenempowerment #feminism #youthempowerment #womenempowerwomen #civilengagement
likes:
|🇬🇧 Since I was a child my models in the world of cartoons and TV series were quite alternative to the typical princesses. I loved Fantaghirò, Xena, Mulan and Buffy. All these female figures have in common that they know how to make it on their own, they rebelled against conventions and fought for freedom.
I admired them and I wanted to be like them. So, despite never having fought against vampires or barbarians, I "fought" to defeat certain stereotypes and prejudices, especially concerning gender-based violence. In fact, this subject has always struck me so much. I learnt more about it and its aspects thanks to the internship at the House of Women against violence in Modena, during my studies for my bachelor’s degree in psychology at the University of Parma. Thanks to this experience and the stories of the women who came to the facility, I could understand their struggles in getting out of a relationship with a violent person. Moreover, I have deepened, in my thesis, the aspect, often underestimated, of the consequences that witnessed violence causes on children. Later, during my studies for my master’s degree in School and Community Psychology, I investigated the aspects concerning the representation of gender violence among young people. Becoming increasingly aware that, we should precisely work on the representations and on the language that we use, to prevent this phenomenon in the new generations. And for this reason, I decided to join the project "Beyond what they sell - beyond what they sell" to give my contribution to change in my small way.|If you want to collaborate with us, doesn't matter where you live, contact us, we look forward to sharing new ideas!

“I started farming due to poverty within my community and my family. I also saw that women are being undermined when it comes to farming and they are said to be incompetent,” says Ramaphabana Nyaluvhani from Ha-Gumbu, close to the Kruger National Park and Zimbabwe border in northern South Africa. “I started at home, behind my hut, until I realised the business was growing.” The wind whistles past as Ramaphabana explains that she then decided to get more farmland, to grow “a variety of nine products, which are okra, onions, two types of spinach, baby marrow, green beans, green peas, gem squash and cucumber.” “I got into the AWOME programme when the trainers came to my village and introduced the programme on business growth.” She explains how she’s learnt how to keep records, budget and plan for the future.

Ramaphabana’s pride is evident as she describes the importance of being a female farmer in a culture where that’s unusual. “It means a lot because women are limited to certain things and I am an example to other women in South Africa. I excel in farming and there is nothing that I cannot do…my business empowers women by creating employment and I also donate my products to crèches, schools and funerals. I’m grateful to AWOME, as it’s made me a success.” Ramaphabana is one of over 1,250 women micro-entrepreneurs who we are aiming to support through our AWOME (Accelerating Women-Owned Micro-Enterprises) programme. We’re working in partnership with @UNWomen and governments to accelerate women-owned micro-enterprises across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa. 
Link in bio to find out more.
#AWOME #standingwithwomen #HeForShe #buildingforever  @debeersgroup @UNWomen

hashtags:
• Female Empowerment - Not Just For Girls •

I’ve really been admiring the work of @raisingstrongdaughters  this week. Her fight for female empowerment and being strong role models to your own daughters to lift them up from day one is an awesome piece of well rounded work and I applaud it loudly!

Not having a daughter it made me think about female empowerment from my own perspective and how important it is to me for my own empowerment and that of my female friends and their daughters to be acknowledged, encouraged and enforced; I thought about the men in our lives and how important their attitude is to achieving female strength and it made me realise that we don’t just have to raise strong daughters,  we have to raise respectful and caring sons, and those sons have to have role models in the strong women AND MEN whom they know. 
I want my son to grow up knowing women are STRONG AS FUCK. I want him to see that his mum works her ass off in her job(s) and at home, that she fights for her family (blood and not) and that she can do whatever she sets her mind to. I want him to see that his Dad agrees, that his Dad also does housework, and childcare and works his ass off at work. That he’s proud of the strong females in his life so that my son can follow in both of our footsteps.

I want my son to enable female empowerment by lifting up the females he relates to, by knowing there is strength in feeling emotion, knowing that real men cry, and care and love. Knowing that he can fight, but so can she.

My gift to #femaleempowerment will be raising good sons. Because we all need to be on the same page.

Hj, na fila do açougue, eu e meu filho Vicente de 3 anos de idade esperávamos o atendimento enquanto o homem da frente, sorrindo enquanto olhava p Vicente, me disse: "Eu e minha esposa só tivemos filhas mulheres (feições de decepção), agora uma delas nos deu um netinho homem!!! (feições de o maior e mais maravilhoso feito sob o sol). A senhora pode imaginar o quanto ele é paparicado, né!"
Eu não me contive e respondi, enquanto ele ainda não tinha conseguido encerrar o sorriso de realização em seu rosto: "mas é claro! Homens são bem mais importantes do que mulheres, não é mesmo?! (Cara de nojo)" Ele não entendeu e perguntou "o quê?"
Eu repeti com a mesma cara de nojo e determinação. 
E ele ainda no rabo do mesmo sorriso bobo, sem pensar ou talvez sem ouvir direito de novo o que eu disse, ou simplesmente por nunca ter imaginado na vida que alguém problematizaria uma coisa tão "maravilhosa" como essa, apenas respondeu "sim, sim!" Afinal de contas, (pensamento comum do machista e, imagino eu, poderia ter sido o desse senhor), como uma mulher que tem um menino (UM MENINO, PORRA!) poderia não concordar com este ponto de vista? Devo tê-la escutado mal....
.
.
.

hashtags:
Questa settimana è stata taaaaanto impegnativa, piena di novità, qualche delusione che però si lascia ignorare dalle buone premesse, e la sensazione di aver corso come una pazza per prendere al volo un treno in corsa.

E quindi questo weekend è stato leeeeeento, per recuperare e prepararsi a un ottobre pieno. Mi sa che sarà l'ultimo salto al mare. 😁

Il mare di #Cagliari a settembre è uno spettacolo: poca gente, la bellezza di certi posti nell'ultimo giorno di apertura, con la voglia di raccontarsi un'ultima volta prima di chiudere il sipario sulla stagione.

E poi una serata in cui ho barattato la partita del Cagliari con due ore libere per una visita a un piccolo meraviglioso museo. Sono entrata nella storia di una donna incredibile, di cui presto vi parlerò. È la parte più bella del mio blog: essere accolta nella vita delle persone che mi regalano racconti di mondi lontani dai miei e mi donano bellezza, ogni volta diversa, che si riflette anche su di me (grazie al cielo!). .
PS. In questa foto ho la t-shirt di #heforshe, la campagna mondiale per l'uguaglianza di genere, nella vita e nel lavoro, tema che sento in modo particolare in questo periodo. Una campagna che vuole volare da una parte all'altra del mondo, così come vuole che gli uomini, insieme a noi, distruggano quel tetto di cristallo che ci impedisce di volare.

PPS. la foto è di Matteo (una dei millelila tentativi), lo sto instradando perché il marito non je la fa. Che dite, è stato bravo? 😁

hashtags:
1️⃣Heart disease is the world's number 1 killer.
•
2️⃣18 million people die every year of heart disease worldwide.
•
➡️Today on #worldheartday we are on a mission: we want to ensure HEART HEALTH  EQUITY  for ALL.
•
❤A woman's heart looks very similar to a man's heart from the outside, but there are differences how women develop and present with heart disease.
•
❤Heart failure is the most rapidly increasing type of heart disease in the world, and women make up 50% of cases.
•
❤Women are less likely to receive guideline-directed medical treatment to manage their condition.
•
❤Women are less likely to be referred for transplantation.
•
❤Women often receive treatment based on data from studies that predominantly enrolled men, and therefore the treatment may not work that well for them.
•
❤Coronary heart disease is the single biggest killer of women worldwide.
•
❤If a woman has a heart attack, she is less likely to survive than a man. If the woman is treated by a female doctor, she is more likely to survive.
•
❤Pregnancy complications such as preeclampsia or early delivery may be warning signs for future heart disease risk.
•
❤Women are more likely to suffer broken heart syndrome (SCAD) than men.
•
➡️Heart disease is preventable and we can reduce the risk factors by changing the way we live our lives. Very few people know about all these points above. Please tag a woman who needs to hear this. •
➡️This year on #worldheartday we are on a mission to ensure we are creating heart health equity for all. •
➡️We want to create communities of heart heroines & heroes. #sheforshe #heforshe
•
➡️We promise to ourselves, our families to eat more healthily. Know our blood pressure. Stop smoking. Move more.
•
➡️We share our promise and inspire others.
•
➡️We promise as healthcare professionals that we help patients to give up smoking and to lower their cholesterol. •
➡️We promise to keep our promise...for
MY Heart, for Your Heart, for All OUR HEARTS, because our hearts matter.

hashtags:
Taking good care of yourself is a very big step! People in extreme circumstances tend to neglect themselves. We hear we are worthless, that we aren’t pretty enough, that we don’t work hard enough… I only tried to make him happy… or at least avoid making him angry. There was no time, money or energy left for me!

A some point in life I stood up at 5 AM, before going to work I prepared his breakfast and clothing. (he didn’t work!) At 7 AM I started work. I left office at 15:30PM. I was rushing to the grocery store, do the shopping. When I arrived home around 17:00PM I started to cook, so dinner would be ready at 6! After dinner it started! He talked hours and hours. How the whole world was against him, that I didn’t clean the house, why I was tired, couldn’t I wear a sexy dress with high heel shoes? etc … I was exhausted going to bed at 1 o’clock in the morning. And after a max of 4 hours sleep I had to get up again. With no ME-TIME at all! (and I don’t talk about the bad days, this is a description of a good day)

Looking back it comes to no surprise I became ill. I won’t say he made me sick. But by exhausting myself like this, my health resistance probably was at an extreme LOW!

After (of more precise during the brake up period) I left him, I started to change. I tried to be good to myself! Why would be anybody good to me, while I don’t live the example.

My sleep rhythm is still of! But it is far better than the 1 to 2 hours sleep a day I had the last half year (at least) of my relationship. I always tried to maintain  a good day/night rhythm. I try to sleep at night and be awake while the sun is shining. If I’m exhausted I take a nap in the afternoon.

I tried to put some work in my looks. It is hard when you are in the middle of a depression. Even changing your cloth is so difficult.  So I make a list in my head what I had to do EVERY DAY. This list was like: -  Brush your teeth (at least twice a day) -  Take a shower -  Clean your face -  Use skin care products -  Change cloth. Wear nice cloth even if you don’t leave the house -  Use make up (from time to time)
likes:
|- Wear earrings (I love earrings, My ex told me wearing earrings is ugly – Guess what I wear EVERY DAY nowadays!!!)
-  Do your hair 
I started to go to a hairdresser after so many years. I put all my money into him. He went out for a haircut. I colored and cut my hair myself. It felt like becoming a completely different person, in a good way. I became a little bit like ME again. Or the person I should have been the whole time.
And I found a good one! You never leave the shop unstyled. Sometimes they curl my hair and I even got an amazing fishtail braid once! It made me shine again.
While leaving him I made a choice. I didn’t tell our friends. I didn’t want to get involved in a mud fight. I didn’t want to justify why I was leaving. And I definitely didn’t want to meet my ex during birthday parties. I wanted to be free! So I not only became single but I also lost all my friends (which apparently wasn’t a big loss because nobody called me to ask my side of the story. One female ‘friend’ even walked past me a couple of weeks ago and didn’t stop to say ‘hi!’. She ignored me and looked to the other side) That makes you really lonely. I moved, I didn’t now anybody. It would have been so easy to stay at home and cry all day.
I forced myself to go outside. I explored the area. I went for a walk every day (at least once). It was after my car accident. So I had several braces and a casts to wear, which made it impossible for me to exercise. I got a membership at the cinema. I went there to watch movies. I had to leave the house, walk for 20 minutes to go to the train station, take the train, walk 15 minutes to the cinema to watch the movie. And going home afterwards. I always got so much energy from it.|I talked to people. Even if it was the cashier at the grocery store. I went to the women emancipation center. I talked to people in the waiting room while visiting my doctors. I went to lectures. I visited my family more often (it is a 4 hour train ride – one way!!). I did everything to come out of de isolation.
Currently I looking into my hobbies. In my case, the difficult part is finding something that have no big impact on my hands. My right hand got severely damaged during that accident and I can’t use my right hand as I used to be. I already had one surgery. The results are better than expected. I am actually able to move my wrist. The remainder is work in progress! Why is it important? Because I love working with my hands. I like crafting, knitting, sewing, doing some DIY stuff (I still need to paint my bench white)… the last couple of weeks I’m thinking of picking up photography again. During my time at university I took several courses. But I never had the time to do something with it. I never had ME TIME. I also discovered that some photos I took were deleted by my ex. (It must have happened in the last weeks living together.) But I’m starting over, I always can take new ones.
I won’t give up!
And I like DANCING!!!
By doing all this, I get a better balance in life. I try to keep my life as structured and organized as possible. And it really helps my mental wellbeing. I look more rested, I smile more, I get compliments that I am shining and look more beautiful and happy. And especially on difficult days I try to all of this above. At some point it will become a routine.  Selfcare is crucial!
I won’t say it will solve all problems, but maybe you will be able to love yourself again. Because I did!

Chorar no banheiro é o refúgio preferido de 99% dos adultos. Ainda é onde se encontra um mínimo de privacidade para se despir das máscaras sociais.
.
Mas e quando não é permitido? Imagine uma vida inteira sem poder colocar para fora tristezas, angústias, frustrações. De tanto 'engole o choro, menino', uma hora explode!
.
Uma pesquisa realizada com 40 mil homens levantou dados alarmantes sobre o universo masculino.
.
Se você é homem, é bem provável que viva um tanto de violência na pele a as terríveis consequências dela em sua vida e em suas relações. Já refletiu sobre elas?
.
Os padrões de comportamento vigentes são opressores e trazem sofrimento para todos. Precisamos quebrar esse silêncio e falar sobre masculinidades possíveis. Alguns homens comuns e muito corajosos ousaram...
.
Junte um pacote de pipoca e quem estiver a seu lado para dedicar uma horinha a esse assunto. Com apenas um mês de lançamento o documentário "O Silêncio dos Homens" realizado pelo PapodeHomem ultrapassou as 485 mil visualizações.
.
O impacto positivo que deseja ver no mundo pode começar dentro de você. Você se arrisca a abrir essa caixa?
.
(link nos comentários)
.
Apoio: @naturabroficial, @reserva e @onumulheresbr

hashtags:
It’s National Sons Day.  And, the most important thing I can do as a mama of 2 boys is to teach them how to navigate this world with compassion, empathy and respect for all.

I bought this book for Arya.  And, I turned around and the boys were completely engrossed in it and I snapped a quick pic because I thought it was so cute that they were reading side by side.
.
But, I was surprised at first that they liked this book.  And then, I paused, and forced myself to examine why I was surprised they would gravitate towards this book, when I try so hard to teach them exactly this very lesson.  That to be a pioneer is not a male or female trait.  Whereas I focused on the “WOMEN” in science.  They focused on the PIONEERS in Science, not even noticing that all the stories were of women.

This is it.  The next generation.  Change starts right here. #heforshe #nationalsonsday #brotherlove

Somos um escritório de advocacia formado por mulheres atuando em prol do Direito da Mulher e pelas mulheres. ⠀
.
O Coimbra e Schipman Advogadas assume para si a missão de  ser agente causador da  efetivação dos direitos das mulheres no Brasil e no mundo sob a perspectiva de uma abordagem  sistêmica e humanizada que promove além da composição do conflito, o empoderamento e a  melhoria da qualidade de vida das mulheres. ⠀
.
O afastamento do modelo convencional de advocacia beligerante para a advocacia sistêmica e humanizada é o principal diferencial  do Coimbra e Schipmann Advogadas, pois estrutura uma nova forma de atuação com abordagem interdisciplinar e sistêmica, valendo-se dos princípios femininos de empatia, generosidade, intuição e sensibilidade. ⠀
.
O foco ultrapassa a questão conflituosa, senão, assenta seu olhar no ser humano e na história por trás de cada pessoa que chega até nós, promovendo aos nossos clientes uma experiência de acolhimento, empatia e transformação do contexto inicialmente posto pelo restabelecimento do diálogo, a composição do conflito e o restabelecimento do espaço de fala e poder de decisão das mulheres. ⠀
.

hashtags:
Have you ever been treated unfairly because of someone else’s unconscious or implicit bias?  So many of us have been, and it can be really difficult to know how to react.  Many years ago, when I joined the board of The Duke of Edinburgh’s Award and attended a drinks reception at Buckingham Palace, I put out my hand to introduce myself to my new fellow board member (a white man of a certain age!) and he put his empty coffee cup in my hand and walked away.  He presumed I was the waiting staff. I just took the cup, with my mouth hanging open in total shock. I didn’t know what to say. I didn’t want to come across as some overly sensitive young woman and I didn’t want to make a scene.  So, I said nothing.  I really regret that now as my silence sounded like acceptance.
-
This is a perfect example of unconscious bias in action. He hadn’t even realised what he’d done, and he certainly hadn’t meant to cause offence. Speaking up is difficult. What if it becomes confrontational? What if I get emotional when I try to explain how their words or actions affected me? Will it make any difference?  We have to push past these concerns and speak up anyway because it is the only way to make the unconscious, conscious.  So, if you find yourself in a position where you are being treated unfairly or unequally, try one of the three strategies I explain in this video. -
I’ve also put together a free PDF to help you to walk through the steps of speaking up. You can get it at www.debrasearle.com/bias . I’d recommend printing it and stashing it in a notebook or your top drawer at work, just in case!  The good news is that the thought of speaking up is always much worse than the reality and, in my experience running the Diversity & Inclusion consultancy MIX, most people are shocked to find that they may have inadvertently hurt you or caused offence and are open to being re-educated. -
#speakup #bias #implicitbias #unconsciousbias #mentalhealth #reachout #womenempowerment #change #metoo #motivationalspeaker #motivation #confidence #inclusion #diversity #minority #LGBTQ+ #BAME #empowerment #gaypride #heforshe #genderbalance #everydaysexism #whyididntreport #genderequality #whiteprivilege

Tratto dal libro ”15 consigli per crescere una bambina femminista” di Chicamanda Ngozi Adichie , una delle promotrici maggiori del femminismo conosciuta per il suo famoso discorso ”Dovremmo essere tutti femministi”
.
. 
Questo è un buon libro , scorrevole e ricco di grandi verità . E il passo da me pubblicato è uno dei più belli che traduce con le parole della scrittrice , ciò che ho sempre pensato. 
I ruoli di genere ci vengono inculcati talmente tanto -fin dalla tenera età- che crediamo di essere diversi. 
In realtà la propria personalità e il modo di essere non dipende dal genere , uomini e donne possono essere molto simili e meritano entrambi lo stesso trattamento e gli stessi diritti.
L’unica diversità auspicabile sta a livello anatomico se vogliamo dirla tutta . 
Buon sabato a tutti 🤗

Eergisteren waren we uitgenodigd bij HIJ VOOR ZIJ in @lochal013 waar we het hadden over wat mannen kunnen doen om geweld tegen vrouwen te stoppen. Mooi om te zien dat er zoveel partijen bestaan waar mensen terecht kunnen, als het om dit thema gaat. Ik hoop dat @stopstraatintimidatie, @saynothnks, Feniks, De Blauwe Maan en Veilig Thuis weer eens snel bij elkaar komen. 🌟

Nog mooier om te zien was de opkomst van mannen op deze avond! De meeste daders zijn mannen, maar niet alle mannen zijn daders. Toch hebben we mannen nodig om dit probleem op te lossen. 💪

Om mensen een duidelijk beeld te geven wat straatintimidatie is, kun je het nu zelf ervaren met onze VR experience in Amsterdam. Houd onze events in de gaten, zodat je de kans krijgt om de bril op te zetten, maar binnenkort ook online te zien. 
Blijf onze vooruitgang en strijd volgen op sociale media 👊

Sunny-Girl runs an automotive business that specialises in panel repair and spray painting. She’s been operating outside Windhoek, Namibia, since 2016. “Since I grew up, I’ve loved cars. It was so interesting. Even if my father came home, the first thing I would do is come and check if the car was fine. That is how I grew up, I really love to deal with cars,” she says.

The men she works with are happy to share their passion with her and work together as a team. Some of her male customers are surprised to see a woman with her own garage but are always impressed.

Our AWOME (Accelerating Women-Owned Micro-Enterprises) programme has helped her develop key management skills; how to keep the books, how to market the business, how to use WhatsApp and Facebook, and organise salaries. “I know that AWOME has polished me into a different shape. And then they made my business shiny,” Sunny-Girl says.

She already has six members of staff. In the future she aims to have a better workshop with more resources and tools, and to work with government and company cars.

Sunny-Girl is one of over 1,250 women micro-entrepreneurs who we are aiming to support through our AWOME programme. We’re working in partnership with @UNWomen and governments to accelerate women-owned micro-enterprises across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa.

Link in bio to find out more.
#AWOME #standingwithwomen #HeForShe #buildingforever #inclusionweek @debeersgroup @UNWomen
📷 Eugene Nagel @bluegroundassociates

Se você, assim como eu não sabia o que era o @donademimoficial, digo que vim para essa ilha chamada Hurricane Island para descobrir a potência desse movimento que só começou há 9 meses. E ontem foi o dia do mundo saber, afinal não é qualquer dia que mais de 20 nacionalidades ouvem sobre seu sonho e te são feedbacks para ele se tornar ainda mais robusto - obrigada @unitedpeopleglobal 
E, se eu posso subir num tecido e desenrolar, as mulheres podem estar no lugar que elas quiserem

Isso é o Dona de Mim: um movimento para encorajar e empoderar as mulheres para que elas estejam aonde elas quiserem: CEO, astronauta, mãe, empreendedora. Fazemos isso tanto através de conteúdo, de motivação e encorajamento quanto através da criação de uma rede fortíssima baseada na colaboração. Em menos de um ano foram mais de 15 novos negócios, 2 pessoas empregadas e 570 mulheres nos 3 workshops. Nossos planos pro futuro são bem divertidos: temos uma corrida para engajar homens e mulheres ano que vem, junto com o workshop. E dia 12/10 estaremos no Four Points Sheraton em Curitiba com um time incrível para compartilhar histórias e inspirações. Espero vocês ♥️

hashtags:
Dear Indiana,⁣
⁣
I spent a mere 30 hours in your state and never made it more than 25 miles from your northern border. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
I started with some adventure riding through the steel mills of America in Gary, IN and actually enjoyed that more than I would have expected. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
It was my next stop that really blew my mind... Indiana Dunes National Park. America’s newest national park was beautiful and a welcome stop for a little lunch and sand between my toes. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
We spent the night in South Bend and did a little early morning riding through Notre Dame... one of America’s most iconic universities. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
The real treat was being able to meet up with Caroline’s brother, David and his wife, Laura. It was my new nephew, Isaac’s 5th birthday so naturally I got to ride bikes with him and chase my niece, Zoe around the park. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Riding east from South Bend, I found a simpler, slower way of life. Maybe that’s because I was in Amish country!  More horse drawn carriages and bikes than I could count! ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
The luck of the Irish ☘️ gave me tail winds and I thank you for that... see you again soon. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
📸: @carolinegleich 
#TriForEquality #ClimbForEquality #HeForShe #ultimateworldtri

I love your “Dear State” letters! So fun to read and then see all your adventures in each one.|Hey Rob, we have never met. I am friends with Caroline and have known her for a long time. Just wanted to let you know it has been super fun watching you traverse across the United States on your bike. Keep up the great attitude and finish strong. Be safe out there and have fun. #dreamsarealiveandwell!|Knockin’ ‘em down!!!!!|Yay welcome to OH!! Enjoy the lake views!!|Cheering you on from Indiana! Curious about the flat situation...I haven’t seen any posts about flats. I’d imagine you’ve had your fair share at this point in your journey|I’m from South Bend and we say we are from “Michiana”. glad you enjoyed it. It’s a secret how neat that part of Indiana is. Nessa quarta eu fui assistir o lançamento do documentário O Silêncio dos Homens e tive a oportunidade de falar um pouco sobre a abertura do grupo mensal O Melhor Que Podemos Ser - Conversas sobre Desconstrução da Masculinidade Tóxica, a importância desse tipo de iniciativa e da participação das pessoas nela e tal. Eu tava MUITO nervoso. Cês não tem ideia de quanto. Acho que eu nunca estive tão nervoso na vida. Mas tá aí. E fiquei feliz de saber que existe um progresso no nosso estado tão machista nesse sentido. Não sabia que o RS era o primeiro estado a se mobilizar no movimento #HeForShe. Espero que esse espaço se torne cada vez maior e mais acolhedor. Que mais e mais homens possam se posicionar nesse tipo de iniciativa e mobilizar mudança em si e nos outros ao seu redor. Vamos tentando ser melhores do que éramos ontem, porque o mundo precisa desse movimento. Nesse domingo e no último domingo de todo mês temos roda de conversa aqui no espaço Luz em Paz, deem um pulo aqui e vamos nos ajudar nesse processo. :) #ElesPorElas #RodaDeConversa #OMelhorQuePodemosSer #MasculinidadeTóxica #Masculinidade #PortoAlegre #Desconstrução

hashtags:
Congratulations @debeersgroup, on 2 years working with @unwomen! #DiamondsDoGood 
#Repost @debeersgroup ******
Today we’re celebrating the two-year anniversary of our partnership with UN Women. We hold our commitment to standing with women and girls close to our hearts because we believe that by supporting women, it creates a positive ripple effect that can help many more people. Through our HeForShe partnership with UN Women we have committed to creating a more equitable business and society for the wider communities connected to our business. Over the last two years, we have made great progress - here are some of the highlights to date!

We are committed to driving greater gender representation across our own business. We've almost doubled our appointment rate of women into senior leadership positions, run workshops to engage male employees on the topic of gender equality and provided lactation rooms in our mining operations to make life easier for mothers returning to work.

We are committed to supporting women and girls within our diamond producing communities. Through our AWOME (Accelerating Women-Owned Micro-​Enterprises) programme we have supported over 700 women micro-entrepreneurs across South Africa and Namibia, and are now expanding the programme into Botswana. We’re also helping build the next generation of women leaders in STEM (science, technology, engineering and maths) subjects in Canada and southern Africa. Our investment is providing science camps and scholarships to help inspire and train young women.

We are committed to being a positive force for gender equality through our brand marketing. We have implemented inclusive marketing guidelines, which aim to avoid gender stereotypes and rather portray both men and women realistically and positively. 
Link in bio to find out more.
#standingwithwomen #buildingforever #inclusionweek #HeForShe @UNWomen

C H I L L
.
.
What a rollercoaster 24 hours it's been🤪. Put in my notice and exited my place of work yesterday🤷🏾‍♀️, then jetted off to #nyc to support my friend as she plans an important launch event for @awb.network at the ongoing #UNGA 👏🏾👏🏾.
.
.
.
I'm most grateful to my hubby😘🥰 who let me off the hook for 3 days and will handle the home front while I'm trying to detox and decompress before my new assignment starts on Monday.
.
.
.
For workaholics like me, even on a relaxation trip, work goes on. Aside from supporting @tobi.olanihun, I'm also working on an important marketing campaign for my Forever Living business for the month of October. The month is dedicated to breast cancer awareness and I'll be putting the spotlight on this cause through the month. More details in the coming days.
.
.
.
This post is just to remind you that you need to decompress from time to time. It doesn't have to be a getaway to another city🤭. It can be a massage, a bath soak or an evening at the park reading a motivational book or some alone time studying the bible!
.
.
.
Just take some time as the month of #September winds down to #chill and #rest. I promise the world will not fall apart while you're away😁
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

hashtags:
You can talk about your dream and you can plan it out and schedule it but you have to take MASSIVE action if you actually want to get there. ⁣
⁣
I love this photo because it sums up a feeling- I was invited to an event hosted by Emma Watson, I have been invited to another HeforShe event next week and I can’t wait. ⁣
⁣
Why am I here and not someone else? Guaranteed I’m not the smartest or the most talented, I don’t have a business qualification or economics degree but I sure am the most hardworking. I recently visited my old university where Smart Girl Tribe first started, and girl, has it come a long way! ⁣
⁣
That digital magazine now has merchandise, a jewellery line, a podcast, has worked with some only the world’s most impactful organisations and has its first event coming up. ⁣Not to mention it’s the UK’s number one female empowerment organisation. ⁣
I could have thought about what an event would have looked like, how great it would have been but instead I got MOVING and SHAKING and decided to just go in, ALL IN.⁣
⁣
Which is why I’m inviting you to start showing up for yourself and YOUR business or brand. October 8th the Smart Girl Tribe Summit in London. Goodie bags worth £200, drinks reception, networking, an expert panel and a room full of press. This is your opportunity to change the game. ⁣
⁣
For creatives, entrepreneurs, businesswomen, founders and anyone wanting business support or just in need of some new friends.. this one is for you. Tap that link in my bio for tickets or head to www.eventbrite.co.uk or www.eventbrite.com and search for Smart Girl Tribe Summit. ⁣
⁣
The last few tickets are left now, so will you? Are you going to go ALL in and commit to becoming the best version of yourself? 🎫 ⁣
⁣
Can’t wait to see you there 💖

-IWB ROUNDTABLE DISCUSSION- 
Alhamdulillah. Everything went well. Penggulungan dan pembentangan hasil dan laporan kajian berkenaan dengan "Diskriminasi Gender Dalam Amalan Pekerjaan di Kalangan Penjawat Awam di Negeri Selangor", YB Puan DR. Siti Mariah memberikan maklumbalas yang memuaskan, berlapang dada menerima dan mendengar 'findings', dan akan menambah baik polisi dalam kerajaan negeri yang berkaitan dengan 'Gender Equality'. Thanks to Institut Wanita Berdaya (IWB) Selangor atas kesedaran dan mengambil berat tentang perkara ini, semoga hasrat selangor untuk menjadi negeri idaman tercapai dengan salah satu kelebihannya adalah dapat mengurangkan dan mengawal diskriminasi gender. 
Thanks to my research team (all the Doctors, Assoc. Prof) for the opportunity given to me, to join the team, to gain knowledges and experiences. 
#heforshe 
#sheforhe 
#iwbselangor 
#globalgendergap 
#genderdiscrimination 
#letspartayy 
#dontforgetmyownresearchthesis 🙄

Dear Illinois,⁣
⁣
I was only in your great state for a total of about 18 hours. But how could you not love Chicago? Chicago is a beautiful city perched on Lake Michigan with great history. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
I enjoyed meeting up with and staying with a friend, Mike Tobin (@michaelptobin) who we met on Cho Oyu. We had a great Italian dinner before calling it a night and leaving early in the morning.⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
A great majority of my riding in your state was on the lakefront trail which is an absolute gem. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
There is much more of you to explore and discover, but I will have to save that for another trip. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
#TriForEquality #ClimbForEquality #UltimateWorldTri #heforshe

hashtags:
I’m back on the road with my hubby @rob.lea as he continues his ride across the USA! So far, he’s biked over 2,500 miles/4,000 km in the last 28 days as the final leg of his Ultimate World Triathlon (his self-created challenge to climb Everest, swim the English Channel and ride across USA in six months).⁣
⁣
I think we all thought this bike ride was going to be the easy part, but we totally underestimated the physical and logistical challenges! We’ve been figuring it out as we go along. I am so jealous I can’t ride the entire thing with him due to my knee (which is feeling really good), but I’m still riding with him every day and then riding back to the car to get 20-40 miles of my own in before I return to crewing duties. I’m hoping I can stay with him through the finish of his ride, which we estimate will be in less than two weeks! Keep checking his page and website for updates and cheering him on!!! ⁣
⁣
And remember what he’s doing it for: to raise awareness for men’s role in advocating for gender equality. I’m so proud of him for using his goal to talk about a bigger issue. We know an athletic endeavor isn’t going to change the world, but if we can get even one person to think about the role they play in making the world a better place, we feel like we’ve won. ⁣
⁣
#triforequality #climbforequality #heforshe⁣

Thanks to our friends at @fattire for supporting us! #thenbeer

hashtags:
⁣
Dear Wisconsin,⁣
⁣
It was my first time visiting you. I didn’t know exactly what to expect, but I was impressed. I crossed into you after crossing the mighty Mississippi River. The riding was interesting as I peddled through marshlands and wetlands to begin my journey across you.⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Marshlands gave way to more rolling hills that I had not seen for a while. Although my legs are still tired, the variety in your terrain was welcome.  Rolling hills then gave way to more agriculture and lots of cornfields. But let’s not forget the cows and the dairy. I enjoyed cheese curds 🧀 all the way across your beautiful state :-). ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Your capital, Madison and the University of Wisconsin are stunning. I really appreciated the commitment to cyclists in your city. And from Madison all the way to Milwaukee I was able to enjoy some of the most beautiful bike paths I’ve encounter. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Milwaukee was probably mostly what I would have imagined. Previously an industrial town that seems to have new legs and vibrancy. But it was also another mile stone to reach the Great Lakes and ride your shores south. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Probably most of all I will remember Wisconsin for the culture. You can tell Wisconians are proud of their states and their history.  I took extra notice of how well manicured your lawns and gardens were and how well-kept the houses were. Until next time, drink Wisconsibly my friends. 🍻⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
#TriForEquality #ClimbForEquality #UltimateWorldTri #heforshe

hashtags:
Title: Beat the Puss y Up.

Hyper aware of the derogatory language our culture accepts without blinking an eye, this piece is exploring gender bias and sexism in language. “Beat the Pussy Up” is a commonly used phrase in rap lyrics and people are singing it without considering the repercussions of their words. To me, the phrase is literally referring to raping a woman, but according to www.urbandictionary.com, the verb means to f*** the pussy and is “commonly used in street talk and hip-hop culture”. This language perpetuates the idea that women are sex objects for men to conquest. The reproductive organs also loosely resemble a bull skull as a symbol of women’s strength and resilience. The painting is an anatomical view of a woman’s genitals and I chose to accentuate the fabric’s qualities by tearing and fraying the edges, which also serve as a comparison to “Beating the Pussy Up”. .
.
#beatthepussyup #rap #streettalk #hiphop #hiphopculture #derogatory #derogatorylanguage #genderbias #sexism #sexobject #objectification #objectificationofwomen #raplyrics #woke #wokeaf #feminist #feminism #feministart

⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

1. Listen to and believe women
2. If needed, adjust own behavior
3. Wear something orange every month on the 25th

Heforshe! "Ele por ela" é uma ação mundial que pretende fazer os homens pensarem e buscarem formas de diminuir o machismo. Uma tarefa nada fácil. Mas que deve ser iniciada. Hoje, os homens estão com cada vez mais dificuldades na escola e representam a maioria quando se trata de casos de suicídio. Talvez por essa pressão de uma sociedade machista no sexo, em casa, na família e no trabalho. Dei meu depoimento na apresentação do documentário "O Silêncio dos Homens" e confesso que foi muito bom falar sobre o assunto.

hashtags:
I want to always use my plaform to spread light. Sometimes that means having hard conversations like this one.

Since moving to Asunción in March, I have completely had to go online with my business. All of my clients live in the states, and all of the networking I do is online. I love meeting and connecting with new faces! I've used Instagram for that and have made some really meaningful relationships through connecting on here.

Today I got a message from a man introducing himself and asking where I'm from. I honestly haven't gotten very many appropriate and work related messages from men in the history of me working online, I block and report innaproproate messages I get from men on a regular basis.

But this time... I thought... "Maybe this time it's different... Maybe I should give this man a chance. Maybe he is actually interested in the work that I'm doing, perhaps he is messaging me because he wants to set up a session." So. I responded with a short and professional message. He then proceeded to get my business email and started not only emailing me but also sending me innaproproate messages over Google Hangouts. Predictable, yet it broke my heart.

I am asking each woman who has ever recieved innaproproate messages from men to reply to this message with a ❤️ or a ✊. For positive change to happen, first there has to be this awareness.

Let's stand together through this and show people that this common issue is not okay, we will continue standing up for what is right, and through bringing awareness in, make a positive change.💞 ~ Please pass this message on. Let's make a ripple. ~

USP e Instituto Oceanográfico no Relatório da ONU 2019

Marcando o quinto aniversário do movimento #HeForShe da ONU Mulheres, mais de 30 líderes globais divulgaram ontem (24/9/2019) o Relatório Anual do Projeto Impacto 10x10x10. Chefes de Estado, CEOs globais e líderes acadêmicos de 10 governos, 10 empresas e 10 universidades estão trabalhando para demonstrar que um progresso significativo para a igualdade de gênero pode ser alcançado.
A USP é a única universidade da América Latina a integrar o Projeto Impacto e neste ano, contribuímos com o relatório contando a história do Mergulho na Ciência USP, coordenado pela professora e pesquisadora do Instituto Oceanográfico da Universidade de São Paulo, Profa. Dra. Camila Negrão Signori.
Neste ano, o relatório reuniu histórias inspiradoras para demonstrar como indivíduos e comunidades em todo o mundo estão promovendo a igualdade de gênero na sociedade, no local de trabalho, em casa e com a próxima geração.

Texto adaptado de USP Mulheres: (http://uspmulheres.usp.br/aliancas-pela-igualdade/)
Veja o relatório completo clicando aqui: https://www.heforshe.org/sites/default/files/2019-09/HeForShe%202019%20IMPACT%20Report_Full.pdf
Sites relacionados: http://uspmulheres.usp.br/escritorio/impacto-10x10x10/ 
http://www.onumulheres.org.br

"Balance ton Quoi" - Angele⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I remember being a sophomore in high school and having arguments with @averyferin about Feminism. It would take a while for me to come around to it. Emma Watson and her #HeforShe speech was the beginning of my confronting the fact that I'd grown up in a bubble. That I was blinded by privilege. It was a real turning point for my views on the issue. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
It's hard to admit that you're wrong. It's not fun. But I was VERY wrong back then, and over the years I've had to watch women I care about, women who are strong, intelligent, passionate, driven and inspiring, I've had to watch as they deal with senseless bullshit that doesn't need to happen.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Once some change has been achieved that is the time to double down, not relax. We've taken some steps but we need to take more. We're a long way from victory and this isn't a battle for them to fight alone. We have to join. We need to take responsibility. We need to confront the truth. We need to step up. We need to cut the bullshit.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
I urge you to check out @angele_lv music video for the above-titled song. It is both enjoyable and brutally honest. I haven't been able to get it out of my head the past month. It's an important piece of art.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
