hashtags:
#ЧЕРЕЗКУПУРОКІВ або ТРИ БАЖАННЯ 
Нещодавно в інтерв'ю мене запитали, начебто, банельне... Поділитися трьома мріями. І ви знаєте, я задумалася, зависла...так в мене буває. Насправді не на довго, а для мене, як вічність.

Однозначно,
це самореалізації через кар' єру
це реалізація через міцну сім'ю
і третє, це щось таке сокровенне, про що я завжди думаю, але ніколи не говорю в голос : я дуже хочу бути рушієм якихось глобальних позитивних зрушень. І хай, це звучить егоїстично, але я хочу ввійти в історію, навіть не так Я ХОЧУ ЦЮ ІСТОРІЮ НАПИСАТИ САМА, але так, щоб вона запам'яталамя усім і надовго.

І от, через багато-багато років, коли я буду вже поважному віці, стояти на сцені і ділитися своїми життєвими граблями. Я хочу щоб мій спіч був про те, що я ні про що в своєму житті не жалію. Що я вдячна своїм батькам, навіть не маючи матеріальних засобів вони намагалися мене розвивати, вони вкладали останнє в мій хіп-хоп, фортепіано, журналістику... і хтось би може сказав, що то безтолкова трата часу і грошей, яких нема, але не мої батьки. Я не пожалію про жодну п'янку, і поворот не туди, про "неправильні" компанії з якими стикалася, не пожалію ні про одне розчарування і упадок. Не пожалію, навіть про цей ПОСТ, а більше буду на нього зсилатися. Бо саме так я отримувала можливість ставати мудрішою і рости над собою день за днем.

Я вкотре подякую всім Хто був поруч, Хто підтримував, інколи не розуміючи. Хто мотивував, Хто дарував тепло, любов, взаєморозуміння, Хто давав чарівного копняка і просто був поруч.
Якось так

Marchité y florecí en menos de 5 horas gracias a las mujeres correctas. Y como si no fuera suficiente, encontré rostros nuevos por admirar♡

Scientist (noun): a person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences.

I may not be a PhD or a researcher, but as a surgeon, I consider myself a scientist. 
Science...it’s apolitical. That’s the beauty of science. It matters not if you lean left or right. Scientists make hypotheses, derive predictions from them as logical consequences, and then carry our experiments or observations based on those predictions. 
Tell me about your love affair with science? How did it start? *If you like to watch my video on how I got into my field, click this image in my link in bio.

#PAYWOMENEQUALLY
What do these 3 physicians - an anesthesiologist, physiatrist, and surgeon - have in common? Lost income. According to @doximity, men make $1.25 for every $1 women make. 🤦🏻‍♀️
▫️
September is the @amermedicalassn Women in Medicine month (#WIMMonth) to celebrate the accomplishments and contributions of women physicians. While this is a step in the right direction give credit where it’s due, we still have a long way until we see equity.
▫️
Medical school classes are now gender-balanced. Women graduates need to be aware of the inherent barriers to advancement. It’s not just about pay... it’s that promotion or leadership position that we didn’t even know was available. It’s the lack of fierce women mentors to create a pipeline. It’s the subtle and not-so-subtle gender biases and harassment that knock us down. .
▫️
Women don’t necessarily practice the same way as men - it may even be possible that women may lead to better patient outcomes (see JAMA: “Comparison of Hospital Mortality and Readmission Rates for Medicare Patients Treated by Male vs Female Physicians”) - shouldn’t our paycheck reflect this mortality benefit?! 👏👏👏
▫️
But we are speaking up and making waves. @amwadoctors has always been on the forefront of making change and I’m proud to have this network of women to lean on. .
▫️
Thank you to @natasha.mom.md & her post on @womeninwhitecoatsblog for starting this conversation. We needed it. Check out my stories for some other powerful posts from the campaign. .
▫️
📸: from July’s #MWIA100 meeting; photo credit due to @johnezgoeazy & his team #heforshe . .
▫️

hashtags:
If you thought surfing was a male-dominated sport, think again.⁣⁣
⁣
The thirty women surfers profiled in this thrilling collection can rip a wave with the best of them. Hailing from all over the world, each surfer is featured in spectacular photography and with their own inspirational words. There‘s American professional surfer Lindsay Steinriede on how her father‘s death has inspired her career; French board shaper Valerie Duprat on how she got her start “sculpting foam“; Conchita Rössler, founder of Mooana Retreat in Portugal, on connecting mind, body and spirit; and Australian photographer Cait Miers on empowering women. You‘ll also meet surfers who are over sixty, who surf while pregnant, who captain boats, teach yoga and make movies. Breathtaking photography captures these women from every angle, on and off the waves, in some of the world‘s most visually stunning locations.⁣⁣
⁣
Join us in October for the ‘Surf like a girl’ book launch along with a panel discussion on the challenges that women surfers face. ⁣
⁣
For more info about the event (and the lovely give-aways to everyone attending)  make sure to follow our Facebook page. ⁣⁣
(Head to the link in bio 👆)⁣⁣

hashtags:
💵 GENDER PAY GAP 💵 ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Nobody likes talking about money…especially doctors. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
❗️But the gender pay gap NEEDS to be addressed. ❗️⁣⁣
⁣⁣
I am lucky to be part of a private practice anesthesiology group that pays everyone equally.  Not everyone is so fortunate. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
@medscape recently came out with their annual compensation report and the gender pay gaps STILL exists. Yes, even in 2019!! ⁣🙄⁣
⁣⁣
In anesthesiology, men were paid $63,000 more than women. In other specialties, the gap is even higher. 📈⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🚺 It’s not because women work part time. Part-time physician salaries were not included in the analysis. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🚺 It’s not because women were in lower-paying specialties. Within higher paying specialities, there was still a pay gap. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🚺 It’s not because of the practice model. This analysis only looked at the employed model and there was still a pay gap. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🚺 It’s not because of age. Physicians were compared against their own age group and there was still a pay gap. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
❌It really could be due discrimination, and that is a sad reality in 2019. ❌⁣⁣
⁣⁣
With women now being the majority enrolling in medical schools (50.7% 🚺 ), this pay gap needs to be addressed and rectified. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Women have the same level of training and experience as their male physician colleagues. We take out the same massive student loans. Studies have shown time and again that patients do better overall when women physicians are in charge of their medical care. ⁣⁣
⁣
✨We are privileged to be physicians and it’s an honor to care for our patients. ✨⁣
⁣
❌But don’t take advantage of our altruism.❌⁣
⁣
It’s time for women to get compensated fairly for our work. ⁣👩🏻‍⚕️⁣
⁣⁣
Thank you @natasha.mom.md for inviting me to this important campaign, #paywomenequally⁣⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣
⁣⁣

hashtags:
A great man only has one face.
·
No masks.
No acts.
·
No great man would hide who he really is and pretend to be someone else. Covering up his own flaws and imperfections would go against his confidence of who he really is. Trying to be perfect in front of others would mean he's not able to accept himself as a unique, imperfect man. And acceptance is one of the first and most important steps we have to take in order to become our greatest selves as men.
·
Take that mask off. You don't need it. You are amazing, just as you really are.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Un gran hombre solo tiene una cara.
·
Sin máscaras.
Sin actos.
·
Ningún gran hombre escondería quién es realmente y fingiría ser otra persona. Cubrir sus propios defectos e imperfecciones iría en contra de su confianza de quién es él realmente. Intentar ser perfecto frente a los demás significaría que no puede aceptarse a sí mismo como un hombre único e imperfecto. Y la aceptación es uno de los primeros y más importantes pasos que debemos tomar para convertirnos en nuestro ser más grande como hombres.
·
Quítate esa máscara. No la necesitas. Eres increíble, tal como en verdad eres.
·
·
·
·
·

Bugün işyerimden Bilkent Üniversitesine doğru giderken Ankara - Konya Yolu üzerindeki OPET’de benzin almak için durdum. Tam arabayı nereye doğru yaklaştırsam diye bakarken istasyonlardan birinde bana güzel bir gülümseme ile "Gelin, gelin" diyen bir kadın çalışan gördüm. Sanırım uzun zamandır bu kadar şaşırmamıştım ve hemen aracımla kadın çalışanın yanına gittim. " Ne kadarlık benzin istiyorsunuz? " diye sorduğunda, soruya cevap vermek yerine şaşkınlıkla " Burada bir kadın çalışan görmek ne kadar güzel, çok sevindim" diye cevap verdim. 
Biraz sohbet ettik ve kendisinden izin alarak fotoğrafını çekip bunu paylaşabilir miyim diye sordum ve "Bundan gurur duyarım, benim gibi daha çok kadına ilham oluruz belki" dedi.
Bende bu amaçla burada paylaşmak istiyorum. Cesareti, vizyonerliği ve yaratıcılığını bu denli gösteren bu istasyona ve kurumsal çerçevede bayilerini bu denli destekleyerek geleceği şekillediren firmaların daha çok olmasını dileyelim. Kendi nezdimde katkımı ise bundan sonra benzinimi buradan alarak göstereceğim :) Sizlerde bunu paylaşarak daha fazla kişiye ilham olmak ister misiniz? ☺️
.
.

The old man looked around the shore and saw hundreds of starfish laying upon the dry sand. He approached the young lad and said, "There are too many for you you to save them all. hashtags:
“My favourite part is doing afro hair, I love that,” says Lebogang Elsie Machaba. She’s perched happily in the middle of her LBeauty Salon in Senwabarwana, 40 minutes from Polokwane and two hours from the South African border with Botswana. She’s a vibrant young woman with a real passion for beauty. “I also do foot massage, manicure, pedicure, make-up and sell my own hair oil.” Lebogang talks about the AWOME (Accelerating Women-Owned Micro-Enterprises) programme: “I was invited by the municipality to get involved. Before, my business was in a stagnant position. Now I’ve learnt record-keeping, costing, how to manage my business, my marketing is good and I’m on social media.” Clearly, her mentor Kgotlelelo (‘Gotle’) had a big impact. “She was more like my sister, teaching me how to arrange my place,” Lebogang says. ”She was a good teacher.” As we talk, customers pop in and lively chats ensue. “I love being around my customers! They’re not just my clients, they’re my friends as well.” Finally, she speaks to her ambitions: “I want to take care of my family and be independent. In five years’ time I want to have my own factory for my oil and employ the youth, like me.” Lebogang is one of over 1,250 women micro-entrepreneurs who we are aiming to support through our AWOME programme. We’re working in partnership with @UNWomen and governments to accelerate women-owned micro-enterprises across Botswana, Namibia and South Africa. Link in bio to find out more.

#AWOME #standingwithwomen #HeForShe #buildingforever @debeersgroup @UNWomen
📷 Eugene Nagel @bluegroundassociates

hashtags:
#repost @demilune_prints
・・・
I remember watching Emma Watson giving her He for She speech to the U.N. and feeling blown away. Gender inequality is not just a women’s issue, and finally, men could hear that. During this speech she points out,
.
“When at 15, my girlfriends started dropping out of their beloved sports teams, because they didn’t want to appear muscle-y, when at 18 my male friends were unable to express their feelings, I decided that I was a feminist.”
.
Emma Watson has illustrated that feminism isn’t just for women. We all suffer when self expression and development is hindered by gender stereotypes. I’m grateful to her for using her image and popularity to put feminism and why we all need it, back into the world spotlight. 💫
.
@demilune_prints Childrenswear Ending Gender Bias
.

hashtags:
Oggi condividiamo con voi un post di Maria Prisco, la sua riflessione su un colloquio di lavoro, i vestiti "appropriati" e gli stereotipi! Siamo fiere di noi stesse, non importa cosa indossiamo!
.
È così difficile da capire che possiamo essere entrambe le cose? Belle e intelligenti? Mi riferisco soprattutto a quegli uomini che quando si ritrovano a fare commenti del genere intendono sminuire la persona che hanno di fronte. Una donna non deve essere per forza vestita seguendo determinati standard per fare un colloquio di lavoro, se provassimo un po' di più ad andare oltre a tutto il contorno di una persona, di certo non si verificherebbero situazioni del genere o per lo meno sarebbero meno frequenti. Perché sì, ancora sono frequenti, per questo è così importante parlarne. Nel nostro lavoro con Beyondwhattheysell affronteremo più avanti anche il delicato tema del sessismo e delle molestie al lavoro. Seguiteci se volete saperne di più .
.
#beyondwhattheysell #feminism #community #againstviolence  #womenempowerwomen #youthempowerment #womenempowerment #heforshe  #feminism #empowerment  #againstsexism #activism #igersitalia #igersumbria #femminismo #blog #italianblog #womanpower #sisterhood #womensupportwomen
likes:
|🇬🇧 We are sharing today a post by Maria Prisco, her reflection about a job interview, "proper" clothes and stereotypes! 
Let's be proud of ourselves no matter what we wear! 
Is it so hard to understand that we can be both? Beautiful and intelligent? Above all, I am talking about those men, who make comments like this to belittle the person they face. A woman shouldn't have to dress within certain "standards" for a job interview, if we try a little more to go beyond the whole exterior of a person, certainly such situations would not occur or at least would be less frequent.
Because yes, they are still frequent, so it is so important to talk about it.
In our work with Beyondwhattheysell we will soon address the delicate issue of sexism and harassment at the workplace. Keep following us if you want to know more!

hashtags:
Easy for a girl. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
As many of you know, I’ve been setting up my home in Houston, Texas. I was searching for the perfect shelf to complement my entertainment center (not an easy task considering the blue gray color 😂) and stumbled upon this review: ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
“Great storage space and easy for a girl to put together!”⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Easy for a girl? It might not surprise you this review was written BY a girl. ⁣⁣⁣And this is not the first time I’ve heard this phrase. Even in the OR (with a mostly female team) I’ve heard people say, “We need a guy to help move this patient, it’s not easy for a girl.” ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
I’ll admit there are things I don’t do well. And there are things I don’t like to do. But NONE of those are defined by my gender. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
It might be hard for me to lift heavy furniture (or a patient) because I’m petite (and don’t lift weights as much as I should). It might be hard for me to build furniture because I hate reading detailed instructions. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
So to that helpful person who left this review, maybe what you meant to say is, “It was easy to build even for a person who hates building furniture.” ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
Let’s put aside “easy for a girl” and “easy for a boy” and instead address people as individuals. ⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣

hashtags:
These past few weeks have been like something out of the dystopian teen fiction novels I used to binge read back in the day. A world where even a post office isn't safe. Yessess man. We were angry. We were loud. So f*cking loud. And the silence we got back was deafening. 
Beyond a government that actually works it feels like our hands are tied. Somehow the culture of rape and harassment has been made a "you problem, not a me problem" kind of situation. And that sucks. It feels like we're not valued from the top of government to the bottoms of that fckbois old skool Vans. 
And it made me exhausted. So angry, so many clear indications of what's BEEN happening. Yet people are still  demanding "prove it". Yet in our workplaces people wear green and gold on Bok Friday, but didn't wearing black the one time we asked for solidarity. I had to take a step back because I felt worn out. Heavy with the realisation that so many people in my life we're not who I thought they were. 
And then I remembered. Natural hair brought with it an amazing support network. Every day I log into a community who support each other. Who want to see their people win. Who will give you advice from conditioner to career moves. So now I move forward with that intent. To be the change I need to see in this world, or at least in my circles. The support is extending from hair. To value ourselves so much that they cannot ignore how actually valuable each female actually is. If you're already part of this online family, thank you for teaching me how to boss babe every damn day. If you're not, consider this your formal invite. Let's take over the world now? 💜
📷: @naturallywoke

hashtags:
Dear Minnesota,⁣
⁣
You live up to your nickname, “The land of 10,000 lakes”. The greenery and abundance of water was certainly a welcome sight! But you were so much more. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
From start to finish, you have by far been the most cycle and pedestrian friendly state that I have crossed. The number of bike paths, and even more so, the number of paved bike paths is impressive. It is very apparent that your state has a commitment to the outdoors and being active! I love that about you. ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
There is no doubt you are a beautiful state, but I was really impressed with your hospitality. From complete strangers to family, I felt welcome. And speaking of family, it was wonderful to stay with a cousin, a brother, sister, nieces and nephews. It was important to see where my new bride got her roots, and I can see why she turned out so amazing. We even got to tour @carolinegleich childhood home and see the pencil markings on the wall from when she was a child!⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
I hope to return soon, maybe to ski at Welch Village... where Caroline learned how to ski. Maybe to stay with Caroline’s family or maybe to explore one or a thousand of your lakes. I’ll be back because you treated me so well... and I can’t take the Minnesota out of Caroline.⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
#TriForEquality #ClimbForEquality #UltimateWorldTri #heforshe

hashtags:
I remember watching Emma Watson giving her He for She speech to the U.N. and feeling blown away. Gender inequality is not just a women’s issue, and finally, men could hear that. During this speech she points out,
.
“When at 15, my girlfriends started dropping out of their beloved sports teams, because they didn’t want to appear muscle-y, when at 18 my male friends were unable to express their feelings, I decided that I was a feminist.”
.
Emma Watson has illustrated that feminism isn’t just for women. We all suffer when self expression and development is hindered by gender stereotypes. I’m grateful to her for using her image and popularity to put feminism and why we all need it, back into the world spotlight. 💫
.
@demilune_prints Childrenswear Ending Gender Bias
.

A Fada do tapa na cara sempre sensata, não?! Esquete da patrulha Mulas Muertas 🚺=🚹
#heforshe #heforshebrasil #elesporelas 
Você sabe o porque comemoramos 8 de março o Dia Internacional da Mulher? 
O Dia Internacional da Mulher, diz a história foi marcado a partir de um incêndio em uma fábrica têxtil de Nova York em 1911, quando cerca de 130 operárias morreram carbonizadas. Sem dúvida, o incidente ocorrido em 25 de março daquele ano marcou a trajetória das lutas das mulheres. Porém muitas outras situações aconteceram antes que foi determinando a importância da mulher na sociedade.

Movimentos de mulheres trabalhadoras já protestavam em vários países da Europa e nos Estados Unidos. As Revolução Industrial introduziu jornadas de trabalho de 15 horas diárias em média e com salários medíocres pela levaram as mulheres a greves para reivindicar melhores condições de trabalho e o fim do trabalho infantil, muito comum à época, pois como eram pequenos era fácil trabalhar para recolher debaixo dos teares.

No entanto o primeiro Dia Nacional da Mulher, oficialmente, foi celebrado em maio de 1908 nos Estados Unidos, quando cerca de 1500 mulheres aderiram a uma manifestação em prol da igualdade econômica e política no país.

Mas foi em 8 de março de 1917, quando aproximadamente 90 mil operárias Russas manifestavam contra as más condições de trabalho, a fome e que a data consagrou-se, embora tenha sido oficializada como Dia Internacional da Mulher, apenas em 1921. Vinte e poucos  anos depois, em 1945, a Organização das Nações Unidas (ONU) assinou o primeiro acordo internacional que afirmava princípios de igualdade entre homens e mulheres. Nos anos 1960, o movimento feminista ganhou corpo, em 1975 comemorou-se oficialmente o Ano Internacional da Mulher e em 1977 o “8 de março” foi reconhecido oficialmente pelas Nações Unidas.

Team Decoding Patriarchal Codes organised an event for the students of Dayal Singh College in collaboration with their Women's Development Cell @virangana.dsc on 21.09.10.
 Artist Gopal Namjoshi @gopalnamjoshistudio was joined by Gender and Sexuality Rights Activist Arpit Bhalla @thequartproject in an interactive session that encouraged the audience to analyse and express their own experiences with Patriarchy. This was followed by a Creative Session in which the audience stripped off the patriarch's mask in their posters and designs.

Performance artist Hiten Noonwaal @hiten.noonwal was the show stopper so to say, topping the event off with his marvelous dance performance that moved to the beat of coexistence- a theme that consistently runs through Gopal Namjoshi's work.

A few still moments from yesterday's event.

Follow @decodingpatriarchalcodes for more!

Consent is sexy.⁠ 👉🏽 What Consent Involves:⁠
⁠
Consent means the agreement given to a sexual partner at the moment the partners take part in sexual activities.⁠
⁠
This consent must be voluntary. This means that it must be given freely and not forced. Consent must also be informed.  Informed means that the person consenting understands the consequences of the decision. If the choice is not free and informed, then the person's consent is not valid.⁠
⁠
There is no consent if someone refuses to participate in a sexual activity but is forced into it anyway.⁠
⁠
Also, the consent must be clear, and it must be given personally by the person taking part in the sexual activity. Consent based on the words or actions of someone else is not valid.⁠
⁠
👉🏽 How Consent Must Be Given⁠
⁠
The law doesn't say exactly how consent to sexual activities must be given. It is enough that someone consents through words, through actions or both these ways. Therefore, consent doesn't have to be verbal or in writing.⁠
⁠
#KnowYourRights⁠
Now go enjoy some hot 👉🏽consensual sex!⁠
⁠

hashtags:
アーティストの役割は、アートでより良い社会にしていくこと。
表現に携わる者として、自分がどう社会に貢献できるのか。
最近、ずっとそれを考えている。

私はアートを通じて、ジェンダー平等な社会にしていきたい。
女性と女児のエンパワーメントのための活動をしていきたい。

自分が今まで関わってきた芝居やダンスといった方法で、
または他ジャンルとのコラボレーションで、それを実現していけたら。

そんなことに考えを巡らせながらの、清々しい秋の朝。

Despite the last word being cutoff on this #repost (the word is “nothing”), I still felt it was really important to share this because it matters. I have had to learn how to be angry in a healthy way because what this post says is how I was for too many years. Crying was my body’s only way to release anger, and crying is perceived in our society as weakness. Equality in all things for women also means equality in “being allowed” to express all types of emotion. It also means not being judged for how those emotions are expressed. However this can also apply to “allowing” men to cry without judgement. Can we, as human beings with emotions, finally just be allowed to feel how we feel without societally-created judgements?? #Repost @the_female_lead with @get_repost
・・・
This needs to change⠀

hashtags:
Uma homenagem mais do que merecida!
⠀
A "Turma da Mônica" tem uma projeto muito interessante chamado "Donas da Rua", nós já falamos dele por aqui. O objetivo é destacar todos os meses uma mulher que seja inspiração por sua luta em favor da igualdade de gênero ou que marcou a história da humanidade. Este mês a honra é da atriz inglesa Emma Watson.
⠀
Ela é conhecida das crianças, como também dos já adultos como nós, por ter interpretado Hermione Granger, em "Harry Potter". No entanto, esse presente deve a sua atuação como embaixadora da ONU Mulheres, através do movimento HeForShe (ElesPorElas), que ela lidera.
⠀
Emma se dedica desde 2014 a engajar meninos e meninas, mulheres e homens na remoção das barreiras sociais e culturais que impedem as mulheres de atingir seu potencial. E eu adoro o projeto dela de "esquecer" livros em transportes públicos, praças e lojas ❤.
⠀
Não bate um baita orgulho de ser fã dela?
⠀
⠀

hashtags:
When she becomes a mother

A moment of celebration at home,
While a moment of concern for her career.

She’s a window to the universe’s next generation,
While her window to opportunities almost collapses.

Her dictionary is being redefined,
Not be her but her insignificant others. 
From work challenges and successes 
She progresses and yet regresses, 
To sacrifices and compromises

What a hypocritical world we stay in ?

There’s a almost compulsion for a woman 
To be a mother,
While she ain’t celebrated in the workforce.

Fathers need empowerment for their daughters, 
But choose to disempower the expectant mothers (daughters of others), when they play bosses

What a hypocritical world we stay! 
Also when these Bosses are themselves mothers, and have mothers working under them, 
Are they truly empathetic managers ? 
How will we make this world a better place ever? 
If work-designations-corporations-investors don’t see families progressing and don’t celebrate their employees. 
How will we make this world a better place? - 
Roshni Khanna, 
Founder and CEO - O Womania - A Women Empowerment Initiative  #womenempowerment #feminism #genderdiversity #genderinequality #sisterhood #genderbias #heforshe #owomania #genderroles #patriarchy #genderstereotypes #leadership

Read this👇🏻, inhale, exhale and join me and other real men in this very important cause! Everyone should, let’s do this together🙅🏻‍♂️ @heforshe @unwomensweden @unwomen

・・・
#HeForShe 
Varför?
Jo, jag är så trött på att se och höra om vad så många många stackars kvinnor och barn utsätts för, då, nu och framåt. 
Att måste klä sig heltäckande, att bli slagna, att bli våldtagna, att bli utsatta för psykisk terror, att inte få samma villkor för samma jobb/utförande...ja listan kan göras oändlig MEN VARFÖR? 
Jo för att män i alla tider har tagit sig friheter att tolka, egenmäktigt bestämma lagar och regler, att till råga på allt våldföra sig på kvinnor utan någon som helst attraktion eller spänning skett gör alla dessa så kallade män till små små väldigt små obetydliga varelser! 
Vill jag utsätta min mor, min fru, mina döttrar och alla andra underbara kvinnor för detta? 
Svaret är NEJ!!! JAG VILL ÄNDRA PÅ ALLT DETTA OCH LITE TILL, därför är jag en HeForShe! 
Alla riktiga män borde visa de små!

Mitcho Batalov, skådespelare

Emma Watson, a Hermione de Harry Potter, virou uma personagem de Turma da Mônica. 
A arte é uma homenagem aos cinco anos do movimento ElesPorElas (HeForShe), que busca envolver homens e jovens para remover barreiras que impedem mulheres de atingir seu potencial e também para série Donas da Rua, que faz uma homenagem a mulheres poderosas.

Emma Watson é Embaixadora da Boa Vontade pela ONU Mulheres e está envolvida em diversos proojetos de inclusão pelo mundo.

While initially the couple were just interested in helping the company from a design perspective, they learned a year later that Heath was being sold; within no time, they raised funds and bought the 55-year old brand instead. Since then, Cathy has restructured and grown the local company, and even opened a storefront in Los Angeles in 2008. hashtags:
WOMEN’S  WORLD
It’s just another normal day, Mr. and Mrs. Cumberworth are busy with their perfect job roles, thank you.
Mr. and Mrs. Cumberworth are among those couple who are well accepted and well maintained family of the city called ‘Modern Society’. It’s a very lovely city where males and females are perfectly equal except the fact that women start rebelling for equal payments, rights over their own body and etc, stupid women.
Now, as the clock strikes at nine am Abigail comes down from her room to meet her parents for breakfast maybe that’s the only time you can see three of them together. Oh, I was nearly forgetting to introduce Abigail, Abigail Montana Cumberworth one and only daughter to Mrs. Montana Cumberworth and Mr. Alexander Cumberworth. She is seventeen, very intelligent, artistic and a headstrong young lady. She is very beautiful, no I am not going explain how she looks like she could be either very beautiful or very ugly her by appearance am leaving it up to your imagination but she is a very beautiful human. Now moving on, Mr. cumberworth looked up at his daughter with a not so satisfying glance according to him and the standards of the city modern society she would have been a perfect lady if she wasn’t so, let’s call it rebellious. Mrs. cumberworth  with wished her daughter ‘Good Morning Abi’ with a very flattering smile she wore it so skillfully that one cannot see the despair in her corner of her eyes. But, not Abigail she knows her mom if it was someone else they would have let it go but not her, not abi.

She asked her mom, “DAD FORCED HIMSELF ON YOU AGAIN?!” a little louder than she was supposed to according to the rulebook of city. Her, mom just lowered her eye. Now how could she defy her husband? That husband who treats her with enormous luxury, fulfill her every wishes and most importantly let her do her job. Who cares about martial rape? According to the city’s rulebook it’s a pleasure all men deserve.

Rest in comments
likes:
|Abi understood her mother’s silence and gave  her father a stare a kind of stare that would have killed her father if looks could kill. She asked her dad in calm yet very cold voice “Why?!!!” “why did you do it again Alexander!!!” her voice was getting louder than her dearest father prefer.
Mr. Alexander slammed his fist on the table so loudly that one of the cutlery fell on the floor and broke. 
He shouted very loudly at his daughter “THIS IS HOW YOU TALK TO YOUR DAD?! THIS WHAT YOUR MOM’S BEING TEACHING YOU?! TO INTERFARE IN ADULT’S MATTER?!!” Now Abigail was angry, the moment she was about to start arguing with her dad, Montana stopped her “Abi please”, she was about to fight her mom but Montana’s pleading look worked on her as a magic, she stopped. By the time Montana was stopping Abi, Mr. Cumberworth got his cue to leave from that what he calls a disgusting situation. With an one last disgusted and partly angered look he have departed for his job. Mr. Cumberworth was a lawyer by profession.  I don’t really know what are you going to with this useless piece of information but according to our city’s rulebook it’s really important to mention a man’s profession. 
When Monata noticed that her husband was not there anymore she sat by daughter’s side. Her daughter who was now fuming with anger by the fact that her mom let her dad do whatever he wants. Montana asked in her usual low tone “Abi dear are you okay?” Abi responded back in very displeased tone “how long mom? Just how long you will let him do whatever he wants?” she was in verge of angry tears
TO BE CONTINUE …|#wordsofwisdom  #womensworld #writing  #writersofinstagram  #storytime #yourqoutes  #writingagain  #heforshe  #words

hashtags:
Believe survivors. 
When I was nine I was molested by a older male neighbor. Two male police officers came to my house. They sat on either side of me on my couch. I remember putting my feet up against the edge of the coffee table to hide them shaking as much as I could. They were nice to me. But it was traumatic. They told my mom to take me to the hospital. My mom had been a victim of repeated incest rape as a child and teen. I asked why they wanted me to go to the hopsital. She screamed at me "To see if he put his penis inside you, DEAR." She was struggling with her own demons this brought up for her. I didn't talk about it anymore. Many other girls on the street had been molested. I told the cops all. They interviewed each girl who were mad at me for telling. Nothing whatsoever happened to him. He grabbed our budding breats and pinched them and literally grabbed our pussys. Nothing happened. My dad stayed friends with him. I told my dad to go fuck himself when I was a bit older, (there were a lot of other issues there besides this). It was satisfying. 
I have other stories. This is the one I will share, today.

Em comemoração ao aniversário de cinco anos do movimento @heforshe junto com a ONU mulheres, a escolhida desse mês para ser a #donadarua é a MARAVILHOSA da @emmawatson !

Para quem não conhece esse projeto LINDO da Turma da Mônica e a Maurício de Sousa Produções, vou explicar. Todo mês eles fazem uma homenagem a uma figura feminina que fez história. Assim essa mulher será fará parte do projeto "Donas da Rua". Como fã da atriz e de seu trabalho incrível fora das telas, estou SURTANDOOOOO pela atitude da equipe da Turma da Mônica por ter escolhido ela e por reconhecer esse trabalho MARAVILHOSO que ela está fazendo ao redor do mundo. Usando sua imagem e sua voz para fazer desse mundo um lugar melhor onde meninas e mulheres tenham orgulho de viver nele.

hashtags: Humbled and honoured to be the featured volunteer of @unwomenuk. We need to raise more awareness on gender inequality and how poetry and poetry spaces can be exclusive or unsafe for women and gender minorities. Many spaces within the London poetry scene, including @thepoetrysociety where we hold our events, need to adopt clear and accountable policies and guidelines to be safer for and more inclusive of women and gender minorities, and take a stance against rape culture, against the desensitisation of gendered and sexual violence. It is undeniable that voices of LGBT+, BAME, and female poets have been systemically removed from the canon and some organisations still continue to do that. And we're really proud to have made a small change, albeit small, by creating a diverse night with so many powerful voices - a few of which were heard for the first time - in order to raise awareness on gender equality. We are so proud of every single one of our poets (tagged in the photo) 👏👏🙏🌹 #poetsversus #feminism #genderequality #heforshe #drawaline #poetsvsgenderinequality #endgenderbasedviolence #genderequality #equalityforall #blacklivesmatter #translivesmatter #nonbinarylivesmatter #womensrights #reproductiverights #fightracism #fightsexism #londonpoetry #londonpoets

hashtags:
My students participated in a Socratic seminar yesterday that I can’t get out of my head. It began as a conversation of discrimination against women, but it became a discussion of stereotypes that are harmful for both women and men. 
Particularly the idea that all athletes (male) are macho, sexist, perverts was particularly offensive. Y’all... I have to admit that I believed the stereotype to a point. I was ashamed of myself as I like to think of myself as aware and open, but on that point I had never done the work to correct the ideas that no longer serve me and my students. 
I admit this to encourage you to do the work - confront the stereotypes of high school or gender based stereotypes or culture based. Redefine them and work from that point. 
It’s worth the conversation. 
#iteach #iteachhighschoolenglish #quitstereotyping 
Also thank you @emmawatson for your #heforshe speech!

hashtags:
👋🏽 aus München! Eine Frage, die immer wieder in Interview kommt: braucht es denn Organisationen wie @global_digital_women ? Wenn ich mir die die Entwicklung (zurück in die Steinzeit) anschaue: mehr denn je! Ich sehe Bilder von Gremien, die für Innovation stehen soll, in denen nur ein Geschlecht - das männliche - vertreten ist. Ich lese und sehe, dass weibliche Vorstände, Führungskräfte gehen, und die Stellen wieder mit männlichen Vertretern besetzt werden, ich sehe, dass der Anteil an Gründerinnen auf statistischem Tiefpunkt ist, und ich sehe, dass Frauen (und auch Männer!) mit zum Teil derart veralteten stereotypischen Vorstellungen von Rollenbildern sich rumschlagen müssen. Innovation lebt durch Vielfalt. Verschiedene Köpfe sprechen verschiedene Zielgruppen an. Und so lange es immer noch eben diese Gremien, diese Diskussionen und diese Stereotype gibt, braucht es Unternehmen, Netzwerke, Organisationen und jede*n Einzelne*n von uns, die und der aufsteht und für Diversität und Inklusion als Selbstverständlichkeit einsteht! 
Amen 😉(Interview mit @cancom.se ist in der Story verlinkt!)
.
.
#GDW #globaldigitalwomen #femaleentrepreneur #diversityandinclusion #netzwerk #entrepreneurofinstagram #heforshe #diversity #diversität #tech #digitalisierung #innovation #wortzumfreitag

#TheDearistPeople: The jovial and dexterous @suket.dhir, who describes himself as a “former slacker”  once sold AT&T mobile phones in a call center; now, he is India’s rising fashion star and International Woolmark Prize winner. Suket’s Ikat hand embroidery is all about mathematical precision, with clean lines and an underlying hint of geometry. Not that Dhir knew much about geometry, or anything, for that matter. ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
When Suket was in his 20’s, he came to the realization that he had no five-year, or even five-minute, plan. “A friend said, ‘Do you know what you want to do with your life?” he said, “And I didn’t. And I actually had tears in my eyes.” ⁠⠀
⁠⠀
Brand Page: @suketdhir⁠⠀
⁠⠀
⁠⠀

Decoding Patriarchal Codes is all about taking an initiative to open up a conversation on the impacts of Patriarchy on the society and we aim to do achieve the same by having a series of events alongside the Public Art Installation in October.  We are thrilled to announce the first event of the pre Installation phase of the project.
We are collaborating with the students of @virangana.dsc to organise an interactive discussion with the Artist Gopal Namjoshi (@gopalnamjoshistudio ) and Arpit Bhalla (@ye_mausam_bheega_bheega ), Gender Rights Activist and founder of @thequartproject 
The talk will be followed by a creative session that will encourage the audience to express their narratives in a format they are comfortable with.
Join us for the event and share your views on the theme!
Follow @decodingpatriarchalcodes for more.

hashtags:
⁣
“In the US population, about 14.5% of all men are six feet or over. Among CEOs of Fortune 500 companies, that number is 58%.” -Malcolm Gladwell, Blink. ⁣(@malcolmgladwell )
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Over the last couple days, I’ve been listening to The Revisionist History Podcast hosted by Malcolm Gladwell. It got me thinking about when I read Blink in 2006. I was 25 years old, fresh out of University. I remember reading that statistic about male CEOs and thinking, “alright, I’m set up for success!!!” ⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
Looking back, I realize how absurd my thoughts were. I now see the combination of white male privilege, implicit bias and misogyny that existed and continues to persist in our society. Before we can break down these power structures to create gender equality, we have to recognize them.⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
I want to use my athletic endeavor to bring to light how implicit bias affects women and people from other marginalized groups. We need to make opportunities in life merit-based. Don’t be that guy that hires the employee or promotes the subordinate just because he looks and reminds you of yourself.⁣
🚴🏼‍♂️⁣
#TriForEquality #UltimateWorldTri #HeForShe #climbforequality 📸: @jaykolsch & @handheldproductions

hashtags:
Como dice @nickonogues : "desde las masculinidades, la escoba ES la varita mágica de la Igualdad. 
Hay muchos hombres que se auto definen como “progres” y feministas —y que cada quien se autodefina como quiera— Verdaderamente me encanta escuchar esa historia y por eso a todos ellos siempre les pregunto con auténtica curiosidad lo mismo: —¿Cuántas veces barres a la semana? (Silencio incómodo)

La Igualdad No es una palabra. Es una ACCIÓN. Lejos de ser solo algo académico y discursivo es algo a poner en práctica. Cada día.

Soy un firme convencido de que la verdadera revolución masculina empezará cuando todos y cada uno de los hombres agarremos una escoba como muchos patean un balón, y nos pongamos a limpiar sin ni siquiera pensar que eso tenemos que hacerlo por ser esa una labor que también nos corresponde. 
La escoba como metáfora del cuidado y de lo interno es extrapolable a cualquier actividad que demande un cuidado y atención en la esfera interior. El Gol es llegar a sentirnos totalmente cómodos y hábiles allí, tanto como históricamente nos hemos sentido bien ocupando la esfera pública.

Amigos, es la escoba 🧹 y no el balón, la que nos hará libres.

De momento y desde hace mucho, este tipo agarra la escoba y se pone a barrer dos veces por día. Es mi particular y sagrado ritual". De todo esto hablamos hoy en el @foroequidad.tec #HeForShe en #Monterrey

Un placer compartir todo lo que estamos haciendo en @demachosahombres para desafiar al machismo en la sociedad.

Gracias por la invitación y sigamos Construyendo. 💎
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

#demachosaHOMBRES
#ForReEducation
#HACERisthenewDECIR #Forofetodxs

hashtags:
: Siempre digo que, desde las masculinidades, la escoba ES la varita mágica de la Igualdad. 
Veo a muchos hombres que se autodefinen como “progres” y feministas —y que cada quien se autodefina como quiera— Verdaderamente me encanta escuchar esa historia y por eso a todos ellos siempre les pregunto con auténtica curiosidad lo mismo: —¿Cuántas veces barres a la semana? (Silencio incómodo)

La Igualdad No es una palabra. Es una ACCIÓN. Lejos de ser solo algo académico y discursivo es algo a poner en práctica. Cada día.

Soy un firme convencido de que la verdadera revolución masculina empezará cuando todos y cada uno de los hombres agarremos una escoba como muchos patean un balón, y nos pongamos a limpiar sin ni siquiera pensar que eso tenemos que hacerlo por ser también una labor que nos corresponde. 
La escoba, como metáfora del cuidado y de lo interior, es extrapolable a cualquier actividad que demande un cuidado y atención en la esfera interna. El Gol es llegar a sentirnos totalmente cómodos y hábiles allí, tanto como históricamente nos hemos sentido bien ocupando la esfera pública.

De momento y desde hace mucho, este tipo agarra la escoba y se pone a barrer dos veces por día. Es mi particular ritual.

Amigos, es la escoba 🧹 y no el balón, la que nos hará libres.

De todo esto hablé hoy en el @foroequidad.tec #HeForShe en #Monterrey 
Un placer compartir todo lo que estamos haciendo en @demachosahombres para desafiar al machismo en la sociedad.

Gracias por la invitación y sigamos Construyendo. 💎

-
Today is the birthday of our wonderful bby girl 𝓗𝓮𝓻𝓶𝓲𝓸𝓷𝓮 ❤️
-
Dear Mione.
I just wanted to congratulate you💕
I hope you're all good and celebrate well✨
You're such a strong, strong person. You not only taught us that brightness is always very useful in life but furthermore that friendship and bravery are equally as important, if not more.
In my opinion your brilliance and cleverness shows the most in the way you duel. You know so many unused spells (Glisseo is just iconic) and use them to distract your contra in the right moment; not shooting around the "hard ones" but seeing the perfect moment to surprise the enemy and grab them by their stupidity.
I also wanted to point out what a wonderful companion and friend you are; always supportive and giving everything to protect your loved once. True power and bravery.
Furthermore, your charactical change through time was just impressive; from a bit annoying and know-it-all to a true fighter with amazing qualities.
You showed us that we all can change for good if we want to and that we are allowed to use our talents, and may they only be knowing lots of maybe unnecessary things. In the right moment they'll be useful. 
I really admire you and look up to you as a role model.
Your characteristic qualities are the ones one should try to achieve, at least I'm trying every day to be a bit like you.
Well, celebrate well, legend💕
I love you so much and will always support you.
Greetings, lots of love and yours forever,
Toni❤️✨
-
Dear Emma.
Thank you for bringing this brilliant girl to life. No one would be more suitable to portray her than you were and are.
Thank you❤️

hashtags:
Minhas lindas borboletinhas,
A pior prisão é a da mente. E ele sabe disso. 
Seu agressor sabe que a tortura psicológica é pior que a física. A física deixa marcas no corpo, mas a psicológica deixa feridas na alma. Essas são mais difíceis de serem curadas. 
Sabe aquele "você não vive sem mim", "você é uma inútil. Ninguém vai te querer se eu te deixar", que você escuta enquanto chora em silêncio? 
Pois é, talvez você não tenha percebido ainda, mas é aí que ele começa a te matar. E essa morte é lenta. Você vai morrendo um pouquinho a cada dia, a cada insulto, a cada xingamento.  E o pior é que você nem percebe, pois essa morte é silenciosa.
Borboletinha, você nasceu para ser livre. Para voar por aí com suas lindas asinhas. Não deixe que ninguém aprisione sua mente, sua alma, seu coração... Eles não foram feitos para a prisão. E nem você. 😉

Liberte-se. Apoie-se em quem te impulsiona a voar.

Gender equality is often pitched as a ‘women’s issue’ but surely, by its definition, it’s something that impacts us all? ⁣
⁣
I am guilty of living in an echo chamber, listening to the voices of women the majority of the time. I naturally gravitate to events and groups aimed at women and 90% of my followers are female.⁣
⁣
I’m committing to spend more time speaking and listening to men about gender equality.⁣
⁣
Do you find that this is something men take an interest in? Feel excluded from? Want to be more active in? Let me know!

hashtags:
- Meet The Artists -
Ariel Baillie♀️
Creative Artist

I have been drawing since I was able to pick up a crayon. I have always loved arts and crafts and creating anything that came to mind. Growing up as a very nomadic child I was exposed to different parts of the world at a very young age which opened up my mind to a whole new perspective.

I didnt start focusing on acrylic paintings until I moved to vancouver in 2018. The response I received from my pieces opened up opportunities I never thought could become a reality. It sparked something within me and I have never looked back.

As each piece I created recieved such different interpretations it hit me to want to portray a message that could mean more to someone than just "I like that". This is where I met the beautiful mind of Aubree.
I had done a couple sketches of females that I posted on an Instagram story and she asked me if she could use them. This being my first time that anyone has asked to collaborate on a piece I was Instantly intrigued.
The piece she created blew me out of the water and I never thought I could see my sketches come to life the way she merged them together and put colour into it. I feel like this piece is where it all started for TPIF to come to light.
To empower each other to create and be represented in the art world never has meant so much to me then this moment right now. To see creative minds of women come together and make an impact is exactly what we want to do with TPIF.
The time is now to go for our dreams and create a reality with our goals.
“Women don’t need to find a voice, they have a voice, and they need to feel empowered to use it, and people need to be encouraged to listen.” – Meghan Markle

TPIF is created to empower women to use their gifts of creativity and show the arts community that they deserve the spotlight. Once we allow women to understand and exercise their power, they can remake the world.
📷 @chapmandigital

Hoje foi feita o último dia da roda de conversa com os meninos do 6°, 7° e 9° ano. Agradecemos a todos os envolvidos! Com certeza esses dois dias de conversas foram bem importantes e especiais.
JUNTOS SOMOS MAIS FORTES!
#ELESPORELAS
 #onumulheres
#heforshe
"Se os homens são considerados o problema, eles também podem ser a solução." Contamos com vocês por um mundo mais justo.

Jag är HeForShe därför att det är så rätt och så naturligt för mig! Varför ska inte kvinnorna runt mig ha samma förutsättningar, samma villkor, samma möjligheter, samma lön som män bara för de är kvinnor?
Det är ju bara dumt att resonera annorlunda.
Jag vill att min dotter, min fru, min exfru, min mamma och alla andra kvinnor ska ha samma förutsättningar och möjligheter utan diskriminering, utan att bli utsatta för våld eller sexuellt förtryck.
Så enkelt, så rätt, så naturligt! #HeForShe

Mikael Klots Rubin, Hammarby Fotbolls medicinskt ansvarige
